description:
I came here with a group of 4 on a Friday and it was great!

Food: 
Our group ordered a bunch of food, but it was great. We had two pizzas that were recommended. One was a truffle pizza and the other was a meats. Both pizzas were cooked perfectly. The crust was thin and crunchy, the taste was incredible. Some of the better pizza I have is in SF. They were small personal 5/6 mini slice pizzas 

We ordered two pasta dishes. They were very creamy and tasteful. A lot of cheese topped on top. 

We had for started bruschetta, burrata, and carpaccio. They were all great.

We also had row bottles of wine that was good. 

For food it was overall very good for what we ordered. There wasn't anything that was bad and would order the same items again.

Service: 
The service was very prompt and attentive. Our waiter was always right there for anything  we needed. He was very friendly. I'd give the service 10/10

Pricing:
I'd say the food and service were very very fairly priced. For how good both were, there were no complaints. The wine however was on the expensive side at $62 a bottle (we got two). I'd say that's something you can skip.

Overall:
A great place with great food. This place has been here for awhile and it's because it's a great spot! Will recommend and bring friends here again!
author: Robert R.

description:
If I could give 4.5, I would. I wasn't quite dissatisfied enough to give a 4, but 5 feels like a special thing reserved for my top restaurants. I would return here for good Italian food, but I wouldn't put it on my list of top San Francisco spots.

Eating here feels like a genuine Italian experience. Our waiter had an Italian accent and attended to us much like you would see in Europe. He kept his distance and gave us lots of time. We didn't mind it, but if you were in a hurry I could see it being troubling.

They bring out some complimentary bread to start the meal. I think it was basically pizza dough cooked as a roll. It was honestly a little boring on its own, but was good when we asked for oil and vinegar to dip it in.

We tried the bruschetta and burrata appetizers. The bruschetta was good, but nothing to write home about -- quite basic. The burrata was very delicious.

I ordered the eggplant Parmesan and absolutely loved it. It was delicious. The one thing that was a little deceiving is that on the menu it is under "pasta" and it mentions everything being with a tagliatelle pasta. Well, the eggplant just comes alone as an eggplant stack in a baking dish with no pasta on the side. That was a little disappointing, but I still thoroughly enjoyed it. 

The other members of my party loved their food. Particularly notable was their "spicy" pasta that the waiter recommended. Everyone was very impressed with it. The fresh made noodles were stellar.

We also tried the pine nut and custard tart dessert (I would write the name if I even knew it -- it's Italian). It was mediocre. The custard was a little too sweet for my taste. I would've preferred a more subtle sweetness in a dessert focused around pine nuts.

In summary, eat here, but don't be in a hurry, and make sure you get oil and vinegar with your bread. Thank you, goodnight.
author: Taylor O.

description:
Good pasta place in North Beach!

Our original plan was going to sotto mare, but the wait was too long so we decided to go to pasta place nearby! This place was unexpectedly good! 
We got arrabbiata ($20) spicy pasta, bruschetta ($13) and truffle salame pizza ($22)!
Arrabbiata pasta here reminded me of pasta I had in Italy! It was very authentic and really delicious! Pizza was great with fresh arugula! Bruschetta was crunchy and tomatoes on too was fresh and good! Service was amazing! As a cheese lover, I love how they grind up the cheese in-front of us! 

I'd definitely go back to try other pasta!
author: Clare L.

description:
This small noisy, family run restaurant is one of the best we've enjoyed in several years!!! Great service, perfect servings, lively atmosphere and everything we ordered was a "winner". 
The tortellini porchini, pizza monte Bianco, eggplant Parmesan, were totally outstanding!  We had various salads which were all great -- especially those with the Italian cured meat.  Yum!  All downed with Barbera wine. We finished dinner just in time to head over for a raucous evening - Beach Blanket Babylon in a nearby theatre. All made for a perfect Friday night in the City. We'll be back!
author: Willliam O.

description:
We got the pear pizza and the margarita pizza. My brother liked the margarita pizza a bit more and I was a fan of the pear pizza, so basically, you can't go wrong. 

More importantly, we found the best cannolis in the entire Bay Area! We've been on the hunt for somewhere that fills the cannolis fresh so that the shell has that nice crunch. If you've ever been to Modern or Mike's Pastries in Boston, that's the level of cannoli we're used to. We're spoiled.  Lo' and behold, we find out that the cannolis here are made in house, and ... that's right! They have that crunch! They're filled fresh. The only thing we wished was that they just went simple but delicious with the cannoli. No cherry, just some sweet ricotta and chocolate chips. But with the lack of good cannolis in the Bay Area, who are we to really complain here.

I have a feeling we will be back for those cannolis.
author: Kavita P.

description: This place is absolutely amazing! My husband and I walked in without a reservation and opted to sit at the bar. The staff was able to accommodate us and give us a table. The restaurant is cozy and a cute little place. The food is so fresh. We had the mushroom tortellini and arrabiatta pasta. So delicious! Tiramisu was the perfect dessert afterward. :)
author: Divya S.

description: I went here on a biz trip as the owner is from my home town in Italy. I ordered the tordelli lucchesi which is a famous dish in Lucca. It was really good and made me think about Home. The focaccia was so good and fresh. I did not have the pizza, but my friend did and it looked good, not amazing but good. The place is simple, nothing too trendy but I did not care. I would go back just for the tordelli.
author: Ginevra A.

description:
I really wanted to love this restaurant, and I ended up liking it.  I am not sure that I am in love with it, but I respect the tradition and the history that this place brings to North Beach. 

We ordered the following:
- Burrata: decent, nothing special.
- Prosciutto and melon: decent, nothing special
- Contadina pizze:. Wowza.  The crust was incredible and the shavings of pear conplemented the fungal and salty taste of Gorgonzola cheese.  The winner of the night.
- Arrabiata: Excellently cooked home-made egg pasta dressed in incredibly spicy sauce.  Good.

The food overall was good.  Thumbs up.

What was a bit lacking was service.  The guy that served us was perfectly fine -- but it was soulless, hardly hospitable or chummy.  Never was offered any cheese or oil or vinegar. Maybe a cost cutting procedure?

The ambiance also left a lot to be desired.  It was run down and not sure what they were going for in terms of the interior.  Maybe nothing.

All in all, good food, mediocre service and ambiance.  Not sure this is my first pick when it comes to Italian food in North Beach.
author: Mike P.

description: Can't say enough good things about this restaurant - it's authentic and everything we ordered was delicious. The service was spot on - food was hot when served and they were extremely helpful in making recommendations. If your looking for a small authentic Italian restaurant then this is the place to go. Get there's early as it gets pretty busy later in the evening.
author: JJ P.

description:
A nice, cozy Italian restaurant in North Beach. I'm usually not fond of the options in this neighborhood because they tend to be all flash and without the great food. I like that this one was out of the way and unassuming.

THE WAIT: None on a Friday night at 7pm for four. The main dining room was full, so we ate in the adjoining one. Not a big deal, just no windows there.

THE COST: $167 before tips for 1 bottle of wine, 4 entrees, 1 dessert. 

PASTA
* Tagliatelle Alla Bolognese ($25) - 3.5 stars
A solid dish, glad we had it, but nothing to go out of your way for. 

PIZZA SPECIALI
* Pizza Truffle Salame ($22) - 4 stars
Great flavor! Nice thin crust.

* Tiramisu ($8) - 2 stars
This was basically like a pudding with a little bit of soggy cake. Not at all like a tiramisu!
author: Ziyan C.

description:
Another visit to my favorite pizza place just reaffirms my love for their super thin crust pizza. We had the Margherita Bufalina, Salame with tartufo (truffles) and another with arugula. Fantastic! I still have no idea how they manage to get their crust so thin and yet crispy enough to be able to hold (most of it at least) in one hand without flopping over. I bought an Italian outdoor pizza oven to experiment and try to mimic their version, but am failing miserably at it! Another reason to come here!

Homemade pasta is well done and perfectly chewy--the tagliatelle with meat sauce was perfectly executed and reminds me of our visit to Firenze (Florence). On this trip we opted for dessert--cannolis were perfectly sized and not too large like is often seen, the chocolate tartufo ice cream mimicked a truffle beautifully, and my affogato tasted superb ( though the gelato was a bit too melted when served--cooled espresso works better for this dish--but no big deal).

Tips: come early or make reservations as they were turning folks away after 7p. Parking in Nor Beach is always challenging--we used Waze to find some nearby parking lots as trying to find an open street spot just is way too challenging in this area.
author: Ron M.

description:
We just came back from Italy and miss Italian food so mi
We are excited to find Baonecci Ristorante because its food tastes very authentic and delicious!
author: Angela W.

description:
Had a reservation for 3, but I think they forgot. Luckily there was a table open and we were seated in a few minutes. Service was not amazing - the server took his time to take our order and didn't bring out the bread basket until our food almost arrived. And the bread was unceremoniously dumped on our table without any olive oil or butter (it did taste good though - like the best kind of pizza crust). The server did not check up throughout the meal or pay much attention to us, which made it difficult to end and pay the bill. I suppose it's part of the mom and pop store vibe. 

Pasta was solid - fresh made and cooked to the perfect level. We ordered the lasagna, gnudi, and lobster ravioli. The lasagna was great - perfect combination of meat and cheese and pasta. The other two dishes were good but not stand out. Portion sizes were pretty small given the price. 

Overall good food, but small portions and below average service and nothing stand out. Worth a try but probably wouldn't come back with all the other great Italian options!
author: Hali M.

description:
We visited San Francisco and weren't sure where to eat. We looked up the reviews of Baonecci and decided to give it a try.
I've never been to Italy but honestly felt like this restaurant gave us a little taste of what it would be like. 
We didn't have reservations on a busy Saturday night but they seated us within 30 minutes in a private dining area in the back, which was perfect!! 
The service was great and the food was amazing!! I am still dreaming of the Pesto Pasta dish I ordered. By far one of the best Italian dishes I have ever had!  
I would highly recommend this place to anyone visiting the city!! I honestly can't wait to go back!
author: Marcy M.

description: Oh yah, very pleased with this place. We ordered a bolognese and spicy arrabbiata both were wonderful! I love how they made the homemade pastas. The plate was well presented, the quantity was good, the quality was on point. Everything would have been amazing if only the service was there... definitely did not get much attention from the waiters. Bread was not served without request, had to ask 3 times to get ice water. Overall still a lovely night out and would definitely come back.
author: Nina Y.

description: Wonderful San Francisco North Beach Italian Restaurant run by an awesome family. Amazing food and Top notch hospitality. I was there this past weekend with my family and we loved it. HIGHLY recommended! We can't wait to go back.
author: Aykut A.

description:
Absolutely Excellent. A family owned  SF restaurant. All you would expect and desire-homemade pasta, sauces and delicious wine. I plan to return. 

They also have a separate room for private events/seatings. This is really a gem.
author: Kayla B.

description: The food was fabulous and a good value for the city! Service attentive. Will definitely go back. Great pizza!!
author: Costanza Z.

description: Small family owned(?) restaurant with great service and delicious food. Portions were perfect and served hot and delicious!! Friendly staff with a quaint atmosphere! One of the best lasagna dishes I have ever had. I would totally go back if I lived in San Fran!
author: Lauryn R.

description:
It takes confidence to make a simple dish.  It takes extraordinary culinary skills to make a simple dish absolutely delicious!

I had the best pasta dish in recent memory at Baonecci Ristorante last night.  While I know Baonecci is also known for their relish pizzas, I'm more of a pasta person so I'm so excited to find that they make their own pasta, fresh daily.  Wow!  ... I'm excited already.

I opted for the Tagliatelle ai Funghi Porcini (Porcini mushroom with their fresh homemade pasta).  I like spicy and requested an extra spicy twist to the dish-- they were happy to accommodate; and guess what, the dish came out extra spicy just the way i like it!  

When the dish arrived, it looked simple and bland in color -- but certainly not in taste or culinary skill!  One taste and I was like Whoa!.. they truly know their pasta.  Their motto is "we try to make you feel like you're in Italy" and this dish certainly came through.

The pasta is a fresh, perfectly textured and cooked deliciousness... the pasta sauce coated each piece of pasta lightly and did not drench or overtake the pasta's freshness and taste.  This is how a great Italian pasta dish should be!  The dish arrived hot and remained hot throughout my meal.  It was so good... I resisted the urge to lick the plate clean.  They also served a basket of complimentary bread and that was also very good... I can see that their pizzas but be delish too - based on the yummy bread.  

Reservation is a must at this restaurant.  Service is attentive, efficient and friendly.  The spot is cozy so can get a bit loud-- so not exactly your romantic spot.  But if your date is a foodie, you can impress them here!  ;)
author: Winnie W.

description: Mediocre food brings it down to 3 stars, overpriced to 2 stars, and rude, lazy service to 1 star. We will not be back. And the arrogant, profiling staff won't care. They go out of their way to make sure that you know that. Just because I don't look Italian doesn't mean I don't understand it.
author: Laura R.

description: My favorite Italian restaurant in San Francisco. We go here quite a lot. Everything is brilliant and so fresh! Plenty vegetarian options. The arrabiatta is spicy and delicious just like Italy!  Bruschetta was awesome as well. The tiramisu is most definitely the best in the city, IMO. Great wines selection. I love this place!
author: Namrata J.

description:
On a blustery San Francisco evening, I was in the mood for some basic pasta. I found this little family run place on Yelp, and I crossed my fingers that there would be something vegan. I was not disappointed.

From the moment I stepped inside this charming little restaurant, I was welcomed and completely... well, charmed... by the staff. The family vibe of the place was comforting and warm, and I settled up to the bar since I was just a party of one. (Ah, the joys of working trips!) I received excellent service, a very VERY healthy pour of Chianti, piping fresh bread, and seriously the BEST penne al pomodoro I've ever had. Better yet? The waiter assured me there was no dairy involved.

Pomodoro sauce is a simple creature, so I can't put together coherent words that explains why this is such an exceptional dish. The flavor is spot-on. It is more than spot-on. It is "I want to lick my plate, is anyone watching?" spot-on. 

I remember sitting there at the bar, thoroughly enjoying this meal, and all I could think was, "I wish I could take this back home with me!" That is the highest regards really.
author: Chanele R.

description: Some great friends took us here and it did not disappoint! Oh my, some of the best Italian food we have ever had! We ordered what feels like the whole menu: two pizzas which were delightfully thin but packed with flavor from the arugula to the prosciutto with the marscarpone on top. But the star was the pasta, oh the pasta. We ordered Bolognese, pesto, and the arrabiata. All three amazing, but the bolognese was so freaking delicious we ordered a second plate. My husband, who is the hardest critic I know, woke up this morning still talking about our dinner!
author: Christina W.

description:
This was a nice find. Heard it's been open for years and owned by a family.  Only recently got popular as they updated their decor.  

Decor is very casual and simple. Food was amazing.  Will be back. Four of us shared 4 dishes and an appetizer
- burrata salad with tomatoes.  I don't even like cheese that much.  This was awesome.  5 stars
- risotto with seafood.  So yummy.  Filled with fresh seafood - 5 stars. 
- two thin crust pizza. One with meat and one without.  Love the crust.  4 stars
- linguine with meat sauce.  This was a little rich for me but everyone else loved it. 

Service was decent but a little absent minded. My friend ordered sparkling water but it never came.  My friends tell me it's because the woman in charge isn't in that night.   Overall a very cute place.  Will definitely visit again
author: Lei H.

description: Service was outstanding! Intimate setting, attentive wait staff. Excellent wine selection. Not to crowded had nice back rooms for party's. Very kid friendly not a bad wait at all.
author: Anna P.

description: Very good food. Might be one of the more authentic places in North Beach. The lasagna was really good!!
author: Robert M.

description:
I am a petite Asian girl with small appetite, and I went home hungry after spending $70 for 2 person ( lasagna & risotto ) !!!! I can not believe this gets a 4 star ,I feel like I have fell into this tourist trap .

The service was not attentive , I have to remind waiter twice to get bread . Waiters are nice but that dun make up for my super hungry belly drumming now  would have been more fulfilled just eating at Oliver garden
author: Phoebe W.

description:
AMAZING.

Great wine selection. Incredible food.

If you're Vegan, this spot has a ton of options that are naturally vegan already. The perfect place to delight a group with dietary restrictions and not sacrifice on flavor and selection!

My new favorite Italian spot!
author: Christopher R.

description:
This is a cute ristorante in the city, and they serve some simply delicious food. If you want to go here, I'd recommend you make a reservation. They have wait times that can be upto 90 minutes. 

We were seated right away coz we had a reservation (of course). The restaurant has a very homely atmosphere, very warm and friendly. And the staff make it more so. They have an exquisite wine selection. They also have a very good list of options for vegetarians and vegans. We got bruschetta for appetizer, which was very good. The tomatoes were very fresh and the flavor of the herbs was awesome! 

We ordered the Tagliatelle All Arrabbiata, basically egg pasta noodles with spicy tomato based sauce. This was the first time I ate spicy pasta in an Italian restaurant. The texture of the pasta was very different from what I have eaten before, and the home made tomato sauce was as good as it gets! I do wish I can get my hands on the recipe. 

We ordered home-made tiramisu and an ice-cream dessert rolled in nuts and cocoa powder. These were finger-licking delicious, and we would have gladly eaten another portion had it not been for the calorie-guilt! 

I would totally recommend this place to anyone who wants a taste of good Italian food!
author: Priyanka R.

description: Came here a couple nights ago without reservations and was given a 30 minute wait time we didn't have time for.  We stopped by again tonight and were seated immediately without a reservation as long as we sat outside which we were fine with.  We were judging Baonecci against Tony's and golden boy on their pizza.  Baonecci was a strong contender.  It is probably the lightest cracker like pizza crust I have ever had which is normally what I am going for but here it was almost thin to a fault.  It was basically like a crispy tortilla.  I realize I am sounding critical but in reality I really enjoyed it. The thickness is my only critique.  The flavors were wonderful.  If I was from the area I would definitely be back since all the pictures of their food on yelp look amazing but unfortunately for now I can only judge the pizza.
author: Gena L.

description:
Gorgonzola and pear pizza is where it's at. No. Seriously. OMG. 
I also had the Burrata, which was creamy, delicious and out of this world. 
Friendly Italian staff. Great vibe. Delicious foods. Go. Go. Go!
author: Susan S.

description: This was a nice, authentic Italian restaurant. We ordered the pizza with sausage, pomodoro, and lasagne and enjoyed it all. Decent portion sizes, not large. Service was very friendly
author: Ronica S.

description:
Excellent food.  Service is a bit slow to start--very European in my experience.  If you're in a hurry, try another place.  

We were seated about 8:45 and left about 10:30.

We had the antipastsa, bruschetta, fagioli (bean, tomato, sausage and basil stew), tagliatelle pomodoro, tordelli (ravioli) with meat sauce and mushroom risotto, plus a nice bottle of wine.  Everything was delicious.  About $250 for this meal.

We met the owner and his son (and his son).  This is a family business and that is clear.
author: Mmmm H.

description:
Five of us had dinner a few nights ago at this casual friendly neighborhood destination. Our waiter was attentive and wonderful - 5+ stars. We started out with a Margherita Bufalina pizza as an appetizer and it was so tasty!....this is not your heavy American pizza; it is the real-deal from Lucca. Very thin crust; light sweet tomato base; yum cheese...a simple, delicate balance.

Overall, our pastas and eggplant parmigiana dishes ranged from delicious (homemade egg pasta) to a little disappointing (fish risotto), with desserts underwhelming (tiramisu and affogato) to very yum and tasty (cannoli). We felt that their pizzas are probably the house specialty and we would certainly come back again. Reservations recommended.

Those who complain about bread being dumped on the table without olive oil, vinegar or butter need to get a grip...in Italy, bread is put down on tables (unceremoniously) and it isn't accompanied by a singing telegram or dipping options, except perhaps in the most tourist-centric eateries. And Baonecci is cooking and serving authentic food from the charming Tuscan city of Lucca. In Italy, small pieces of bread are used for mopping up the last morsel of sauce...."fare la scarpetta". It's the best part of a meal!
author: fused g.

description: Went here on New Year's eve and the staff found us a table without a reservation. I went with a friend, his wife, and 2.5-year-old son. My friend is half Italian and knows his cuisine. He was very pleased with this restaurant. Tastes were authentic and everything was prepared fresh. The portions were reasonable size and the bread they gave us was absolutely delicious. I find many of the Italian restaurants in North Beach to be very touristy-and this one was probably no different. But the staff was so awesome that I would not hesitate to return here even as a local.
author: Robert C.

description:
As a North Beach resident, I'm more than spoiled when it comes to having world-class mom and pop Italian restaurants. Baonecci is certainly part of my special neighborhood elite restaurant collection!

My friend and I decided to split a cheese plate to start with.  The selection of cheeses were a-ok and we were delighted that the cheese board also contained honey and pepper jam.  A side of sliced artisan bread accompanied our cheese and created a nice canvas to enjoy the cheese, jam, and honey.  

We ordered the mushroom and Baonecci pizzas to split.  The crust on the pizza is perfectly thin and fluffy.  The was baked the perfect amount of time and did not have black burnt spots as many thin crust pizzas do.  The pizzas were not too filling for one person, but can easily be split for a lighter meal. 

The house red wine was quite tasty and didn't break the bank.  

I will certainly be back to Baonecci and will continue to keep it on my "best of" list of neighborhood joints!
author: Andrea H.

description:
Disastrous experience when I brought in family from out of town.  At first, we thought we had lucked out by so quickly getting a reservation and then getting escorted to the back room with a huge table.  From there the experience went way downhill.

We were served bread with no butter or oil.  A first.

We had to ask for our water to be refilled.

It took 40 min for our appetizers go show up.

I hour 20 minutes later, have no idea when food is coming.  The table next to us also complained about the crap service.
author: Iftikhar K.

description:
Adorable corner spot on Green Street and an alleyway. I had heard great things about this place from a coworker and glad I listened. 

It was a beautiful Friday night - those really nice ones in the city when you don't need a jacket- so the streets were packed, and we didn't have reservations anywhere including Baonecci. Luckily they have two tables outside that don't require reservations. 

I had only heard about the amazing thing pizza so I didn't realize until I got there that it has other items like salads, cheeses, appetizers, pastas, lasagna, nutella pizza, and then a whole page of different pizza options. 

The pizza options have two sides - like a regular pizza side and then a "fancier" (?) pizza side but a lot of the options sounded exactly the same but more expensive. Like they both had a mushroom pizza but one side was just more expensive. I couldn't figure out what about the ingredients made it more special. 

We opted for a sausage, pepperoni pizza, and a mushroom proscuitto pizza and two peroni's to go with it. The pizzas came out pretty quick, while our beers did not. Had to reorder them so service was just ok.  The pizzas were delicious and incredibly flaky and fell apart when you hold them. Luckily, I love super thin crust pizza because then I get more toppings taste. Yum! While the toppings were average (I opted for the regular side), the thin crispy pizza dough was awesome. Definitely a spot I'd come back to.
author: Veronica L.

description:
What an amazing experience, just had a taste of really Italian food, like in Italy.
Thank you Walter and your family for this wonderful place.
author: Carletto R.

description:
I have a soft spot for family businesses that are run with two generations.  The owner told us how they started as a bakery and changed to an Italian restaurant less than 10 years ago.  They have done a great job building the business.

The evening started off with a tongue-and-cheek question about whether their pizza was better than Tony's.  One of the sons articulated the difference.  Their pizza is thinner and the crust is crisper.  He nailed the difference with their margarita pizza.  Similar to the other place they get their tomato base from Italy. 

The prosciutto and melon had a nice presentation with great taste.  The melon was nicely ripe without being overripe.  The prosciutto was nice but hey, I am not a prosciutto expert.

We had a risotto with seafood including calamari, shrimp, mussels, clams and scallops.  The flavor touched our palettes.  

For dessert the cannoli, as recommended by other Yelpers, was a nice ending.   It had just the right amount sweetness that went well with our cappuccinos.  One of our neighbors saw the cannoli after they had paid and said they wished they had seen it.  My wife stated we saw it on Yelp.

We have had some great experiences in North Beach but this was near the top for fun.  I agree with the other Yelpers that this place feels like going to your grand mother's house.

We recommend you give them a try and suggest you make a reservation.
author: Allen S.

description:
Went here based on reviews. Had a reservation and for a Friday night that happened to be St Patrick's Day- that was wise.    Located in the North Beach Area, it's tucked away in a side street which gives it much more of a neighborhood feel.  I will admit I have had sketchy  luck at some of the more touristy places on North Beach.    Not the case here.  My god it was so good.     My table ordered the pasta Bolognese, the Caprese Pizza, the rustica  pizza, and the Baonicci salad.   We also tried the family chianti- the heartwarming story is told inside the menu. 

First, the pasta was rich, flavorful and simply delightful throughout.   Almost other worldly on its flavor from the meat sauce - even without needing volume .....  wherever the sauce had been, the flavor remained.    The pizzas had the most beautiful thin crust that was near cracker thin and the top, with the appropriate chew in the pizza body.   The salad was equally nice. 

The chianti, exactly what you hope for based on the description .... it was rich, approachable, the right acidity and balance to make it a family table wine.  I resisted ordering another glass, but will search out a bottle. 

The setting- it's the storybook family restaurant.   Really a nice place, managed by sincere people.
author: Darin S.

description: Great food and good wines at this family run restaurant. We had Pizzas and the Burrata, all extremely good. Warm and friendly wait staff, especially Elia!
author: Sharad S.

description: This Italian restaurant is the most authentic one in North Beach. It is owned by a family from Lucca and their mother cooks the pasta from scratch. Delicious fresh pasta and thin crust pizza. The owners are always friendly and accommodating.
author: Aleth C.

description: Simply the best Italian restaurant in town, if you're looking for something as close as possible to Italy. Great service and great pizza!
author: Benoit D.

description: Absolute gem in the middle of North Beach! Some of the best home made pasta I've had in years!
author: Lindsay K.

description: I think this was the best Italian food I've ever eaten. And I don't even like italian that much. The arrabiata was spicy and delicious. I don't remember the pizza we got. It wasn't anything fancy but it was delicious. The only con I can point out it was kinda expensive seeing the ambience wasn't anything special and the server never filled our water glasses, but I thought the food was worth it.
author: Shalini C.

description:
I am a first generation Italian American who is very fussy about my Italian food.
This place was off-the-hook GREAT!
Service = Great
Atmosphere = Great
Staff = Great
Food = Great
author: Tony C.

description: Was excited to eat here based off reviews...but it didn't live up to expectations. Stefania salad lacked cheese and nuts, not much flavor in this and burrata salad.  We also ordered 2 pastas and a pizza. The pastas and pizza took over an hour...no one picked up our salad plates or offered another glass of wine.  No acknowledgement of the long delay either.  3 surrounding tables arrived after us, ordered, ate and left by the time our food arrived.  I understand things happen but an apology or some acknowledgement of delay would have been appreciated.
author: Summer K.

description: Amazing, paper thin pizza with porcini mushrooms was our favorite. We also loved their Risotto AI Frutti Di Mare.
author: Shobhit G.

description:
I am Italian and personally know the owners Walter and Stefania.

They cook their food from scratch and really keep it Italian as it should be. Try the daily handmade lasagne that Stefania makes.

Delizioso!
author: Francesco B.

description: My daughter and I found this restaurant on yelp. We made a reservation about an hour and a half ahead of of our arrival for when they opened at 5. We shared an appetizer and two entrees. The burrata was probably the best I ever had. We then shared tagliatelle with pesto and Aglio Olio e Peperoncino. The meal was amazing and the staff friendly. The place filled up while we were there and they were only taking people with reservations. We both felt fortunate that we got a reservation not far in advance.  We will definitely be back!
author: Bonnie K.

description: As I was walking up to this restaurant, I saw two Italian men leave a Maserati and go inside. I knew I chose a great place. Each member got something different on the menu. I got a spicy pasta and it was the perfect flavor. I highly recommend it. Plus, it is a small business!
author: Erica K.

description:
this place bOWNKZ

Best pizza I've had outside of Italy. Definitely can't wait to come back and try more. Had the spicy pasta as well and it was absolutely perfect. Cozy atmosphere & sweet waiters.
author: Liz R.

description: NOT good for kids! Evidently they don't like families. I was there at 5pm, when they are supposedly open. The staff were too busy watching the TV to unlock the door for us. I had two kids with me and I can only assume they didn't feel like serving us. I'm seriously displeased with this place.
author: Rachel B.

description: Shut the front door and go! Holy wow. This pizza is SO yummy! We tried the white pizza with Gorgonzola and curly pear- hands down the BEST pizza- and we tried the salame with arugula- super good! My niece got the bolognese pasta and loved it! Get a good glass of wine and fall into food heaven. You won't be disappointed!
author: Joy M.

description:
We were going to Sotto Marre, but they stopped taking people for the night. So we found Baonecci place on Yelp!

We ordered the second most popular pizza   monte Blanco (truffle salami was sold out) and one with sausage on it (not sure of the name), lasagna, and a pasta to share between 4. The monte Blanco pizza was probably my favorite from the whole meal. The crust was thin, but perfect. The prosciutto was not too salty and the cheese provided on top went perfect with the pizza. 

Definitely will be back to try the truffle salami pizza!
author: Mary X.

description: We had the pizza with Gorgonzola and spiral cut pear -- it was absolutely divine! The crust is excellent -- crispy and thin. I suggest ordering this as an appetizer though -- the cheese is really rich (excellent quality) -- so maybe think of it as a great appetizer for four people before you move on to pasta or meat? The dessert of coffee with vanilla ice cream and whipped cream was one of the best things we have *ever* eaten! Nice people/staff. Great North Beach location. Can't wait to go back!
author: Kate B.

description: I would like to give them 3 1/2 stars! We went here because everywhere else was packed. They took us right away but we didn't get water right away. I noticed other tables had bread but we didn't get any? They did take a bit longer than I would have liked to take our order. We had the pizza because it was late and didn't want anything real heavy. The pizza was light, crisp and very good. We had the sausage and pepperoni. Then the most amazing part was the tiramisu ~ now that alone deserves 15 stars. You could tell it was homemade, it was again ~ Amazing!!!
author: Jackie T.

description:
This place is small so you will be dining on top of your neighbors. It also means you should book a table in advance if you can. We were seated for our 6pm reservation immediately. We had good attention from the wait staff and then things calmed down. It was fine until we wanted to order the bruschetta when we smelled it from the table next to us. Was a little hard to get our servers attention but we did get our bruschetta just before our entrees! It looked, smelled and tasted delicious!

We were asked how our food was twice only. They really weren't imposing and did notice when our wine glasses were empty. 

The tagliatelle bolognese was light and flavorful. I was going to save half for lunch today but it was so good, I ate the whole thing!

Pizza seems to be a big thing for them and they looked incredible. Wood fired and heaping with toppings. 

I had no room for dessert so I didn't look at their menu. Based on everything I saw coming out of the kitchen, I'm sure it was amazing.

Plan to go back again soon!
author: Tera K.

description:
5 - best fagioli!! The red tomato cream and beans!

5 - lasagna 

3 - porcini egg noodles. The mushrooms were boring and the sauce had no dimension. 

Next time I'm going to get the penne in Stefania's special sauce cause clearly they do red sauces amazingly, as well as a oi
author: JM L.

description:
Food:

I thought overall the food was not good. I ordered the classic calzoni and was really disappointed. Overall the size portion wasn't that bad, but the sauce that came with the calzone was mediocre at best with no taste or flavor. 

A few others ordered some pastas among other things. The bolognese looks to have been the better choice between the other three pastas ordered Pomodoro, Peperoncino. Portion sizes were a bit lighter, but the taste in the bolognese seemed to win amongst our group of 5.

Price: 

Personally my take away was that the price was outrageous. $21 for a calzoni is way to high considering it wasn't very good. Others in our group decided to go with some apps as well which were incredibly mediocre and over priced (eggplant parm and Toscano each over $20 with again a small portion size). Their beers are reasonably priced, however upon looking at the Italian beers (Yes, I know they are known for wine not beer) I decided on a $6 Anchor instead.

Service:

Hard to believe after what was mentioned above, that it could possibly get any worse, but it did. The server didn't hand us a menu and came to check on us 30 minutes after we had arrived. All of us starving by that point, didn't let him run away so we orders beers, water, apps right away. Then we waited almost another 25 minutes before we ordered our entrees. I guess eye contact doesn't go a long way towards saying, "Help me! I am hungry." Then the finale of getting the check was absolutely terrible. A bus boy cleared our table and we still waited close to 45 more minutes to get our check. The entire ordeal took about 2 1/2 hours! No wonder these guys are packed all the time.

Overall:

I won't go back, not a chance. I'd recommend a lot of other potential better priced places around North Beach area. This was a terrible experience and dragged on like it wanted me to suffer.
author: Jon G.

description: Absolutely delicious! I had one of the specialty dishes, tortelli mushroom, and it was so good! My boyfriend had the truffle salami pizza and he says it's the best pizza he's ever had! Very cute and casually romantic. Definitely recommend!
author: Rachel G.

description: Our favorite place to visit in North Beach. The salads and pizzas are a great combo (insert emoji with tongue sticking out here).
author: Diana B.

description: Very authentic Italian. Staff is wonderful and recommends delicious dishes. One of the best Italian restaurants I have tried in the city.
author: Andrew S.

description: I am a sucker for great homemade pasta and they nailed it here! We started with the Diavolo pizza for an appetizer - since this is super thin crispy crust with spicy sauce and no cheese it was lite enough for 2 to share and still be hungry for the main course. The crust was great (I'll have to go back to try other pizzas). I had the Lasagna Sophia (I think that is what it was called) it was so flavorful and the noodles were so light that I finished the entire thing. I love family run feeling with mama Sophia cooking and serving some of the food.  Plus we enjoyed a  bottle of Amarone for an amazing price! I am used to paying more than $100 for Amarone in a restaurant and here it was a super-reasonable $70. I will absolutely be back!
author: laura f.

description: I am extremely picky with my Italian food. I have travelled to Italy and Melbourne, Australia among other heavily populated areas with those of Italian backgrounds. I was very amazed; this restaurant has mastered at cooking and bringing out the flavour of the pasta making it the hero of the dish. I ordered the lobster rivoli, I gotta say they nailed the ratio of the pasta to the lobster portion. When I ate the riovoli, I felt like I was eating more lobster than I really am. The lobster tasted very fresh and the sauce was perfect. It was nicely complimenting the flavour and texture of the lobster.
author: Sophie C.

description: Unique pizza joint with some really good pizza. Walter was very responsive to my emails. We had a decent size group (13) and everyone said they really enjoyed themselves. We will certainly come back and look forward to trying some of the slices we didn't get around to because we were so full! Thank you again!
author: Gabe S.

description: Hands down best pizza in the city!  Old school Italian pizza with great private rooms in the back.
author: Kevin H.

description:
Well hello, perfectly thin crust pizza.
I'm Veronica, & you don't know how happy I am to finally meet you.  

I am a thin crust girl.  I barely remember regular or thick crust pies, & that's AOK w me.

I've heard the raves about BaoNecci forever.  But,   despite my always being in North Beach, & my friends & my man all loving it, somehow we never actually met.  

But, on Wednesday night, the universe brought us together at last.  It was about 7:30.  We didn't have a reservation.  But there wasn't a wait.  We were seated immediately.  How lucky is that?

A bowl of Fagioli all'ucceletto & a bowl of Zuppa Garfagnina to warm us up.  The former is a thick cannellini soup.  The latter is a cannellini & faro purée.  Both absolutely delicious.  Perfect starters.

We went w the Maremma Maiala pizza.  San Marzano tomatoes, fresh mozzarella, onion, & Italian sausage.  The flavors robust, the crust divine.  It's thin, light, & crisp throughout.  They've nailed the crust flavor too. 

This is a Lucchese joint, not Napoletano.  And I'm now loving the ways of Lucca.

It's true.  BaoNecci, you may be the best thin crust pizza in SF.

So glad to finally meet you.
I think we're going to become very good friends.

5 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description: I had made a reservation here for my 29th birthday via email and they were courteous and did a good job at following up with their responses.  Since I had a large group, they had put us in a back room where my friends and I wined and dined.  The food was deliciously good; my favorite was their balsamic vinaigrette because it didn't taste so sour and it was mild.  The staff was amazing, friendly and attentive.  Nothing gone wrong because they were in control of making this birthday girl happy.  My guests and I were delighted that this was a successful birthday dinner; it was memories made and we had a great time here.  I'd recommend this place to families and friends.
author: Joy L.

description: During a recent visit to San Francisco we were looking for an Italian restaurant for dinner. Based on the Yelp pictures and reviews we chose Baonecci and holy crap we were not disappointed! This was one of the best Italian food meals of my life (and my Grandma is from Italy)! The family who owns the restaurant were all working on the night we were there. They were extremely kind and friendly. They went through the wine list with us since we had not heard of some of the types they had available. The food was amazing. The truffle pizza was unlike any pizza I've ever had before. And the lasagna was heavenly. Do yourself a favor and eat here. You won't regret it!!!!
author: Jennifer M.

description: While visiting SF we decided to give this spot a try. Food was great ! Seemed pretty authentic (I do have a full bred Italian GF) so standards are held high when it come to Italian restaurants. Service was great the waiters were very attentive as well as courteous. Would definitely recommend and will definitely  be coming back to this place.
author: S F.

description:
Want to feel like you're dining at your Italian grandmother's house? With your grandmother cooking for you and all your aunts and uncles fawning over you? That's exactly what this place feels like. They have really kept the family feel and the mother is still actually the chef. The space is tiny and so cozy. You automatically just feel so relaxed and comfortable. The service is excellent and they make you feel like they've known you for years. But most importantly, the food is incredible. You must try the tagliatelle arrabbiata. The pasta is made in house and is so fresh. The sauce is truly spicy and just so flavorful. Aside from that, everything is great, so just go with your fave. We also loved the pesto pasta and the pizza. All the food is just so fresh and flavorful. 

Tip: make reservations! The place is tiny and gets packed. If not, expect to wait upwards of 1.5 hours.
author: Lena A.

description: I don't understand why this place is rated 4stars. The service was aweful. We went on Sat noon, it was not crowded, only three table and three waiters. However, after 30 mins no ine came to take our order. Finally, I had to call the waiter. No meat, beef, chicken on the menu. The tase was awful compare to other italian restaurants in the area. They didn't serve bread like other italian restaurants. They didn't ask for drink or deserts. Worst experience.
author: Arash M.

description:
Well heck! Guess I have to go back for the pizza, because my mind was just not blown on our first visit to Baonecci. 

We came in around 6:30 pm on a Friday night and were able to get a seat with a reservation pretty easily. The vibe is definitely casual dressy, with several couples and small groups (max. 4) on cozy little date nights. We were sweaty from a 20-minute uphill speedwalk getting there, wearing blue jeans, and had our backpacks on from work. I think the service was more than a little put off by us, but they did their best to accommodate. 

We didn't order wine, either. Guh, who are these people?!

I ordered the Fettuccine w/ "Frutti de Mare" ($23), a plate of wonderfully-cooked pasta with baby scallops, baby shrimp, mussels, clams, and calamari in it - it was a great seafood sampler and had enough food to satiate, but not ingratiate. 

Don H., now ravenous, ordered the Fettuccine w/ Pesto ($18), and while it was tasty, it was a little but more than disappointing for him that there wasn't any bread to pair with his pasta. :,-(

There wasn't really a "Wow" moment for us - all the things I was jiving on in Yelp pictures weren't on the menu this time; it was a little Fettuccine-heavy if I'm being honest. I'd happily return if someone else were paying; for now, we'll stick with where we obviously belong - on our couch, watching Netflix, eating takeout Eggplant Parm from Trader Joe's! X-)

Buon appetito for next time!
author: Laura B.

description: Had reservations at Tony's but this was our daughter's first suggestion because she wanted pizza. We came in without a reservation and we're told to hold on a second. One second later we were seated! Awesome so far. Haley the daughter ordered Margherita Pizza and wasn't disappointed! Penny ordered the lasagne. Hot and awesome! I liked it too. I had the Calzone with green olives! It was huge on the plate. Thought I couldn't finish it. But it was light like the pizza and full of awesome taste. Ate it all with a slice of Haleys pizza. Highly recommended with friendly staff and warm atmosphere.
author: Craig R.

description:
YUM!!!  We just had a girls weekend in SF and dined at Baonecci's due to their great reviews and I have to say the experience was top notch!  Everyones food was delicious - I especially loved the home made bolognese sauce!  They are very used to theatre goers  time constraints and even asked us as soon as we sat down so they could act accordingly - very impressive.  I highly recommend this wonderful restaurant and will most certainly be back!

Tip:  if you haven't seen Beach Blanket Babylon in awhile - do yourself a favor.  Book Baonecci's and hop over afterward - with the current political climate....it's a HOOT!!!
author: Deborah L.

description:
I had made reservations for two, and the staff immediately seated us. We were given the perfect balance of attention and space. We ordered the family's chianti, the Baonecci salad, the (very) spicy pasta, and the pizza rustica. No misses. No, this isn't the most mind-blowing pizza or pasta, but it is really, really good, better than 95% of what's available elsewhere. Service is perfection.

It's a family restaurant. And, it makes you feel like family. That's hard to beat.
author: Christina W.

description:
Go "big" and with a reservation to Baonecci, or you'll go home. Throughout our Saturday early dinner in North Beach, we counted exactly 8 walk up parties turned away with the restaurant about half full. Before you go, reserve online at OpenTable on their website.

We arrived for our 6 PM reservation and were seated immediately. The mom and pop Italian restaurant is small with a casual atmosphere. There was a laid back, relaxed attitude especially with the two Italian brothers who were serving all the tables. The menu is simple with the house made tagliatelle used for most of the pasta dishes along with pizzas and calzones.

Our table ordered the prosciutto e melone, eggplant parmigiana alla Stefania, and lasagna cesariccia. I had the tagliatelle al ragu di carne with a glass of the The Argounaut sauvignon blanc. The salty prosciutto and sweet melon is always a great combo. My fresh pasta with Stefania's bolognese sauce is a simple dish, but was executed perfectly. I had a taste of the other two dishes ordered, and they were delicious, especially the lasagna.

We skipped dessert there for some gelato down the street. We definitely picked a winner with Baonecci.
author: Arthur M.

description: Terrific family run, local North Beach Italian restaurant with very high quality food and comfortable seating. Risotto was superior and pizzas were great.  Highly recommend for business, casual, lunch or romantic dinner.
author: Marty H.

description: I love their food . I have never tasted a pizza like theirs In My life . You probably won't find any authentic Italian pizza like theirs -anywhere in the city . Their service is great and food is delicious . I would recommend it everyone . Give it a try :) One of the best restaurant I went to ! Thank You
author: Ab S.

description: A light lasagna?   Never thought it possible  until I had some here.  Oh so good.  It was the homemade pasta that made it work.  Came slone.  Was seated st the counter which was fine.  Service was friendly but not quite what I learned to expect based on other places I tried on this trip.  Dessert looks yummy.  Can't wait to take a bite.
author: Michael L.

description:
My wife and I came here last night to have dinner. 

We started with the "Bruschetta Toscana" which was chopped tomato, garlic, basil and olive oil on top of roasted bread. It was garlicy and delicious. For my entree I ordered "Pizza Maremma Diavola" which was a thin crust pizza w/ a spicy san marzano tomato sauce made and garlic. I would not change anything to this dish - perfectly balanced with spice and a lot of authentic flavors.

My wife ordered "Tagliatelle All Arrabiata" w/ HOUSEMADE pasta and a VERY spicy tomato sauce. This pasta dish was amazing! It was simple, but the pasta was cooked to perfection and the sauce was out of this world. Full of flavor, fresh and spicy. Best arrabiata pasta dish she has ever eaten! 

This is a Mom and Pop restaurant that cares about the quality of their food and provides excellent homey service. We will definitely be back!
author: Hari P.

description:
Probably the best Italian Food I've ever had.

I enjoyed everything about this place. The ambiance, the waiter, the food...I'm still dreaming of that Seafood Risotto. My boyfriend said that the Lasagna was the best Lasagna he's ever had in his life. The Nutella pizza...I'm so sad, I was so full that I could only eat one bite.

Definitely will be coming back here when I'm in San Fran.
author: Jacklyn K.

description:
My husband and I came here last night to have dinner. We had a 6 pm reservation  and we were greeted promptly upon arrival prior to being seated immediately. 

We started with the "Bruschetta Toscana" which was chopped tomato, garlic, basil and olive oil on top of roasted bread. It was garlicy and delicious. For my entree I ordered "Tagliatelle All Arrabiata" w/ HOUSEMADE pasta and a VERY spicy tomato sauce. This pasta dish was amazing! It was simple, but the pasta was cooked to perfection and the sauce was out of this world. Full of flavor, fresh and spicy. Best arrabiata pasta dish I've eaten! My husband ordered "Pizza Maremma Diavola" which was a thin crust pizza w/ a spicy san marzano tomato sauce made and garlic. He said it was the best thin crust pizza he has ever eaten (including the many pizzas he's eaten during his regular work travels to Italy). 

This is a Mom and Pop restaurant that cares about the quality of their food and provides excellent homey service. We will definitely be back and next time I will try the cannoli!
author: Reena P.

description:
More like 2.5 stars. But rounded up because we got in without a reservation. Tip: make a reservation. 

So the pear one was one my friend recommended and it slipped my attention that it had Gorgonzola on it. I am not a fan of blue cheese. So I can't say much. 

The mount blanc one was off putting. The prosciutto reminded me of cadavers in anatomy lab. It just didn't taste right to me. (Sorry for ruining your dinner)

The buffalina one was my favorite out of the 3 but still wasn't that good. It tasted like chemicals. 

All in all, I loved how thin the pizza crust was. But that's all. Sorry!
author: E D.

description: We were looking to explore the Italian area here in San Fran and this place popped up. The menu was simple, good Italian food you crave. Had some good wine with our meal and bread was delicious. The waiter was very attentive, friendly and helpful.
author: Abby F.

description:
I was craving for their baked pasta, but not on the menu anymore.  Lo and behold, they cooked it for me.  They are just so sweet!
Oh, it was delicious!!!
author: Nadia S.

description:
I can't decide what's better here - the service or the food. Both are amazing!

Homemade pasta. Delightful sauces. Fresh ingredients. 

Service that's so perfect you barely notice it. 

LOVE this place!
author: Kim C.

description:
We came here with a party of 9 to celebrate a friend's birthday and had a wonderful time!  The food was great, the service good, and atmosphere homey and welcoming.

We shared a number of dishes, and all were tasty:

1) Eggplant parmigiana - good
2) Mushroom / arugula pizza - very good 
3) Eggplant, roasted pepper, and zucchini pizza - very good
4) Buratta salad - delicious 
5) Bruschetta - tasty
6) Spicy tomato pizza - very good, particularly with pepperoni. If you're looking for a pizza without cheese, this is the one to get. 
7) Bolognese - excellent. Good pasta and flavorful ground meat.

The desserts - tiramisu and chocolate gelato - were good, too.

The staff did a nice job of taking care of our large party.  The food came out promptly.  They didn't complain about having to process 9 different credit cards, which we appreciated!

The atmosphere is casual, comfortable, and inviting.

Overall, a great spot - we'd love to return!
author: Barnali D.

description: Wow what a bummer of an experience we had last night. I researched on Yelp for a tasty Italian meal and this place seemed like the spot! I was able to get reservations and salivated at the pics in anticipation. When we got there we were immediately seated and given water, about 20 min later the waiter came around... at that point we had all had plenty of time to decide what we wanted to eat. we started with a bottle of wine and a meat and cheese plate. The wine was reasonably priced but not my cup of tea ( no fault of anyone just didn't enjoy it). The meat plate looked so delicious but the ends of every meat were very dry like they were improperly stored. Dish was okay at best. Now the real bummer came from our main dishes, my friend and I decided to share our dishes with one another, he ordered the margarita pizza and I the fungi tortellini, can't go wrong right? Wrong! The pizza tasted like straight gasoline! I noticed my friends face when he took a bite, and he usually gets very excited and vocal about his food but this time his eyes got really big and just stared at me... i immediately grabbed a bite and was taken back by the strong aroma and taste of gasoline! What the heck! Others tried it at our table and were nice enough to share their pasta with us but... we couldn't even stand that! They ordered the angriest pasta they had on the menu and honestly it was unbearable to eat. Way way way too many chili flakes ( I'm Latina and grew up eating very spicy food). My fungi raviolis were the saving grace however, I only had 5 on my plate! I really wanted to love this place and was so excited to try it but left feeling totally underwhelmed and honestly disappointed :( maybe it was an off night, and I will totally give them that much but I would never go back. Service was below average as well and took the waiter a very long time to acknowledge us and he was just kinda "blah" about everything...I feel like we could have a pretty great meal for $200 and kinda feel cheated but I guess you can't please them all!
author: Sonja D.

description:
I honestly cannot recall the last time I had Italian food this good--superb from beginning to end!

Antipasto Toscano was just the right size for 4 adults to enjoy, and the meats were very tasty. Bruschetta was very good, the ever so slightly crunchy bread even better than the topping.  Homemade pastas were perfectly cooked and tasted wonderful. I had the Pasta al Forno: came to the table right out of the oven, cheese bubbling and smelling delightful--WOW! The wife had the Cannelloni, and it may have rivaled mine for its great flavors. 

Service was efficient, and the staff were very friendly and accommodating.  Small place, so definitely recommend reservations.

Cheers!
RS
author: Rich S.

description: We tried this Italian spot before heading over to Beach Blanket Babylon based on reviews of exceptional homemade pasta, which is surprising rare in North Beach. The food turned out to be excellent. I got the Aglio Olio, and got to try the Arrabiata, Lasagne and Eggplant Parmesan. The serving size on the Aglio Olio and Arrabiata was a little low, but that must be part of the Italian vibe. Of the four, I would recommend the Eggplant Parmesan. It was a good ambiance and a great place to eat before the show. However, the service was not very good. It was a busy Saturday night, so I should be lenient but we sat at the table for 20 minutes before being served. That's where they lose their star.
author: Lauran K.

description: Best Italian restaurant in North beach! Everything is homemade & delicious! Can't pick just one favorite dish because I haven't been disappointed but the lasagna and pizzas I crave!! The service is prompt and done with a smile. To anyone looking for a great homemade Italian meal, look no further!!
author: Nicole I.

description: Rudest staff. Walked in on a Saturday night. Tables were available inside and outside. The rude waiter that came up to us greeted us with "Reservations?"  We said no and he shook his head and walked away. Seriously?  Get off your high horse and take that broom stick out your ass, a'hole.
author: Hugo B.

description: Homemade pasta was great. Small place so make reservations if you go. I would definitely return.
author: Mike M.

description:
Monte bianco - this ultra thin crust pizza with prosciutto and scoop mascarpone cheese is light, crispy, tasty and just amazing. Wanted to try the truffle salami but it was sold out. 
Lasagna - made with a bolognese meat sauce. Very good! Pasta tasted homemade. 
Tagliatelle al ragu di carne - pasta with a meat sauce. This dish was okay, too salty for my taste. 

Overall giving this place a 4 because their thin crust pizzas and lasagna are really good but pricey for the portions.
author: Karen T.

description: it's a very familiar restaurant you eat divinely and I would be all days to eat all the dishes prepared by them starting from appetizers to dessert, the service is very friendly.
author: Angelo D.

description: Don't miss an opportunity to dine and enjoy the authentic Italian cuisine at this neighborhood family owned ristorante.  The owners are friendly and attentive.  The food is outstanding and delicious to the last bite.  Believe me, you will not leave a speck of food on the plate.  Yes, it's that good!  From the light and flavorful salads, to the wonderful thin crust pizza you will be transported to Lucca Italy.  The pasta entrees are delicious with every inch of ingredients being homemade perfection.  We loved the dining experience and will be back soon!
author: Jerry F.

description: This place is the real deal. My go-to order is the Burrata salad and the Lasagna. You really can't go wrong, but those two are my favorites. Would recommend.
author: Devin G.

description:
Favorite Italian in SF. Reminds me so much of the pastas I had in Rome. Great and warm service too.

Arrabiata pasta and their lovely bread to soak up the remaining sauce.  I also highly recommend a glass of the Chianti to go with.  

Will be back soon to try other menu items that I see on Yelp!
author: Jennifer Y.

description: Italiano!  What's not to like?!  We shared the caprese, pear pizza (amazing!) and canoli...all superb!  Good wine pours and we loved the thin crust of the pizza.  The place was packed and everything coming out of the kitchen looked really good and authentic.  My only complaint was that they do not have limoncello!
author: Steve Y.

description: Simple presentation, but amazing food. Came here with a group of co-workers. They split pizza, lasagna, and bolognese. I had the Tagliatelle Aglio Olio e Peperoncino (pasta w/ olive oil, garlic and peppers. I didn't taste their food (tomato allergy) but they all raved about it. Mine was so flavorful and had nice heat to it, which I always love. The pasta is made fresh and you can definitely tell the difference. The service was great too. We also had wine and it was a decent price for SF. The place was smaller, so would recommend a reservation, but that also added to the charm. I will definitely be back.
author: Elizabeth M.

description: This place is the real deal. The owners are from Lucca, the favors from heaven. Casual, comfortable, particular, thoughtful, hearty, traditional, unpretentious, authentic, satisfying, affordable. What more could you want? The wine list is small but well curated. The attitude is inclusive and caring. Don't be put off by the inelegant ambiance. It's not the kind of place that you really expect the quality of food that you are served. Rejoice! You spent hardly anything, and ate like a king!
author: Ras R.

description:
BaoNecci is a small, Tuscan-themed corner restaurant famous for its authentic Lucchese-style thin-crust pizzas. Pizzas (12 inch) and other entrees average $20 each. Beer and wine are served and there are two outside sidewalk tables. It's in the heart of the city's beloved North Beach Italian-American district.

Finally calling up my dog-eared bookmark after two years, we had a chance to try out BaoNecci's renowned pizzas. While it's a charming restaurant with excellent service, we found the food to be...well, bland, and a bit overpriced.

Our waiter was friendly and helpful, letting us know what items are crowd favorites, as well as what wines to try.  The service was consistent throughout our meal, letting us focus on our food and surroundings.

Starting with a $14 tomato and burrata salad, I felt myself jonesin' for summer California heirloom tomatoes. Yes, the dish was authentically Italian - but I just wanted more pronounced tomato flavor to balance the creaminess of the burrata.

Similarly, the recommended $19 Diavala (Spicy san marzano tomato, garlic, Italian parsley), had a nice crust but lacked an intensity of flavor. It arrived warm, not hot, which probably didn't help. Maybe we should have asked for pepper flakes! Not wanting to offend, we figured it wasn't part of the flavor experience. 

The $18 pasta al pesto, housemade noodles and sauce, was good, but nothing we couldn't have whipped up at home. And, pricey at $18 solo.

So many others rave about this restaurant and I hate to be the one saying it's "A-OK but not great." But that's what y'all pay me for, right?

At a Glance:
FoodDrinks: 3 - Mild flavors...too delicate for me!
Service: 4 - Italian accent, of course!
Setting: 4 - Walk to all of North Beach in minutes, corner location.
Value: 3 - Appy, entree, dessert & glass wine =$50pp - I'd like a bit more for the money! 
Date worthy: 3 - It's cozy and romantic; afterwards you can walk to Coit Tower.
Dogs: Leave 'em home!!
author: John H.

description:
I'm blown away. I have read a bunch of reviews and enough of you loved it so much I had to go. I'm so glad I did!

It's a funky place that draws you in with family warmth. Run by two brothers, mom (genius) and dad. You fall in love right away.

We had wine to start, a great white blend for my wife and a super Tuscan for me. Hit me and pick me up, that was a great glass of wine!

Let's eat shall we?

Started with the caprese pizza. Perfect and light. We added some pepper which for us brought out the flavor. Didn't need it, but we liked it. Also had the pear salad which we epic. Great light dressing.

On to the main event! Lasagne. I will say it's the best I've ever had. This is where mom is a genius. It was cooked by itself in a casserole dish and was so simply done that it was life changing. That's a big statement for lasagne, but worth it here. 

My wife had the sausage and onion pizza as her dinner and it was as good as the other pizza. It's the crust, incredibly light and perfect.

All in all, expensive but worth every penny. Service was family and delightful. You feel as know them. I'll be back first night I'm in SF! To the family, thank you!
author: Peter I.

description:
Likes: clean interior, very nice Asian server helped us that night, risotto was creamy, spaghetti and sauce was good.  Nice quiet place for a simple meal.  Not too noisy.

Dislikes: small portions, food was good but I've had better.
author: Karen M.

description: The pizza tasted like the smell of propane and the crust crumbled like a water cracker. A group of friends and I ordered three different pasta dishes and each were mediocre at best, definitely not worth what your expected to pay for them. The service we received was very disappointing, but fortunately the gentlemen in charge of refilling waters was the most attentive. There are several outstanding Italian restaurants in San Francisco, this is not one of them.
author: Joseph A.

description:
Fabulous little family owned restaurant with fantastic pizza and great wine.

Prociutto cotto with fennel - light and unusual. Brings me back to memory of traveling to italy where they get the basics right. 

Salami truffle pizza - after having the pizza here, I realized that there is better pizza than delfina. I especially like the dough which is thin and like even at the edges. Delicious.

Pasta arrabiata - didn't love the pasta even though the sauce was solid. Stick with pizza as main.

We also got half of bottle of amorone which was great!  Decently prized for amorone.

Definitely will return.
author: Rebecca C.

description: This cute family style restaurant transported me back to Toscana! Very authentic and delicious Italian dishes.We sampled the bolognese pasta, pizza and Chianti from the family's vineyard near Lucca. The dishes were extremely fresh and flavorful. Our waiter was the grandson of the original owner of the bakery turned restaurant and his mom was in the back cooking! Loved every minute of our experience and will be back soon! Grazie!
author: Pres P.

description:
Skip the lines at the other "big-named" places along Green St. and go straight to Baonecci. Both its pizza and fetuccini is beyond amazing. You can taste the aroma of thin crust, fresh mozzarella, along with many best ingredients. There is no colorful table, no big display window or catchy posters. This quiet mom-and-pop restaurant makes an outstanding traditional Italian food. 

As the slogan on their check says "We do our best to make you feel like you were in Italy."  I'd say they accomplished that and more.
author: Robert F.

description:
The bruschetas were extremely simple (diced tomatoes with a herb, garlic and oil - served cold), the lasagna was something you'd expect to see a new cook making - it was bland.

I'd say that for the given value this is not worth it at all. If the prices were 1/4th of what they are I would maybe consider going back, which is clearly not happening.

Other than that the service wasn't great either - I had to wave my hand multiple times at the personnel who were all just chatting with each other and laughing by the counter. The place was empty and it still took me at least 20 minutes to get their attention and my check like that.
author: Thiago F.

description: Delicious better than your mom's cooking! My number one go to when I'm craving Lasagna ... and about that lasagna, order it, you won't regret it. Family owned so the service is friendly and attentive.
author: carol g.

description:
Ambiance is nice, but the service is poor. And not much of a good reason since there was staff standing around.  Everyone was perfectly nice when they were helping us, but they just didn't pay much attention to our table. 

More importantly, I thought the pizza and pasta were both mediocre. And the wines by the glass were bad. 

I expect that folks like the ambiance, but service, food, and wine leave a lot to be desired.
author: Amjad S.

description: Excellent experience and fresh homemade everything.  One of the best in North Beach!  Great family atmosphere!
author: Jerru V.

description: This place was horrible! The food service the attitude was despicable. They don't care they're nasty and then when I called regarding the service they told me "never to come back again we don't care we don't need you"!
author: Jacqueline C.

description: Seriously, so good! There are so many options in this area but I am so glad we ended up here! It's a tiny spot but feels cozy and not crowded. The staff was friendly and always there when you expected them. The tomato sauce was so good! Acidic, spicy and perfect! You could see a lady in the kitchen preparing the food just like your Italian grandmother would. We will absolutely go back the next time we are in town and until then will be trying to recreate that perfect sauce.
author: Aley V.

description: I've been there twice and it's definitely the best pizza I've ever eaten! (And I've been to Italy several times). The crust is really thin and tasteful, so you can really savor the ingredients of the pizza. They have a large selection of pizza, mine was with fresh mozzarella and prosciutto, so good! The staff is also very nice and friendly. I would highly recommend!!
author: Marine L.

description:
Cool little place that can be hard to miss! Located on a corner with very little street parking and tight spots. Very cozy and limited table seating. Came here for an early dinner and there were plenty of tables. Immediately seated!

Pizzas here are amazing! Definitely recommend getting a few pizzas for the group here. Pasta, lasagna, and the other dishes were pretty good too, but I came going back for the pizzas.

Service was nothing to complain about. Would definitely come here to try some of the other pizzas!
author: Wing L.

description: Very small place but we were able to get a seat fairly quickly on a busy night. The atmosphere is chic and funky. It's pretty loud but also intimate . We ordered a few beers and the Contadina pizza. It came out quickly. It was cracker thin crust with Parmesan and Gorgonzola topped with lots of curled shaved pears. We were not very hungry so one pizza was enough for the three of us. We did not let any go to waste! It was a superior tasting pizza.
author: Lesley F.

description:
This place is the definition of a hidden gem. We drove by it on a crowded Green street a couple of times trying to find it before finally spotting the tiny entrance to this unassuming but charming little restaurant. Once inside, we were welcomed warmly and treated to the best pizza I've had in my 10 years in San Francisco.

Yeah, I said it.  Best.  Ever.  It's that good.

This family-run place transports you to a little nook somewhere in Italy while you're there, and the pizza is itself transportive, literally the best thin crust you'll ever taste.  

The dough is cooked in a stone electric oven, becoming perfectly crisp.  The sauce which complements the crust so well is made from a single type of tomato, and you taste the difference.  Chef Stefania has really created a little masterpiece here.

Try the Monte Bianco.  Once you lather a bit of that Mascarpone cheese on the prosciutto and take a bite, you'll understand.

There are no pictures of the pizza in my review because we devoured them too quickly.  There is a nice photo of the complimentary cannoli Stefanie treated us to, though, and it was very sweet of her to do that!
author: Saminda W.

description: Excellent authentic properly portioned Italian greatness.  With their thin crusted pepperoni prosciutto pizza, fresh homemade pasta and lasagna finished off with light deserts full of flavor.  Don't forget the cappuccino.  Excellent service would recommend trying for reservations but they let us dine without one.
author: J W.

description:
We stopped in at Baonecci Ristorante due to the 4 star Yelp reviews, and the fact that there wasn't a wait to be seated.

The Great: Big fan of the marinara.

The Average:
o Service was average, although there was a bit of attitude from the host when we walked in without a reservations (although the place was half empty). The staff didn't ask if I wanted another beer and only refilled the water after we made it painfully obvious we needed more.
o Toppings on the pizza were decent. The spicy calzone had some nice heat and the flavor was A-OK.

The Poor:
- The front doors. They open in towards the restaurant. Hopefully there isn't a fire.
- The crust. I am all about thin crust, but this was crazy. It was like a crisp cooked crepe. Apparently it is a specific style of crust from southern Italy, but I'm simply not a fan. To top it all off, it's expensive for the amount of product you get. Profit margins must be through the roof, but rent is expensive down here.

As much as I wanted to like this place, I just can't see myself coming back for the pizza or calzone. Maybe the other entrees are where it's at. 2.5 stars.
author: Andreas H.

description: Favorite Italian in the city! Penne Arrabbiata was delicious and very spicy. Incredibly friendly staff as well.
author: Naomi B.

description: This place is absolutley delicious. Presentation of food is alright, but when you take a bite, its delicious! I had the eggplant parm, burrata salad, and funghi pasta. I will come back and taste other items on the menu. I enjoyed eating out at this place. It gets busy after 6pm so make a reservation and seating is limited.
author: Romit P.

description: This place was fantastic! A little hole in the wall, the food was incredible. We had the cold cuts platter, the bolognese, and a margherita pizza. The pizza's crust was delectably thin, and the bolognese was just to die for. We completely cleaned our plates! The service was also great- very friendly and attentive staff. Would definitely recommend if you're looking for authentic Italian food!
author: Audrey H.

description: Our experience here was nothing short of memorable.  The food was probably the best Italian I've ever had.  The pizza with mascarpone cheese was fantastic, and the bolognese was perfect.  The service was friendly and attentive.  This place is family-owned and has a chill vibe.  Would highly recommend!
author: Morgan H.

description: While visiting San Francisco, I strongly recommend this place. While we were in town we dined here twice. The food is super fresh and delicious  Authentic Italian cuisine. the staff is very friendly and the place is super clean. 5 stars!!!!
author: Chuck M.

description:
Excellent ambient and good service 
A little piece of Italy in town
The bruschetta al pomodori, a good starting , rigatoni al pomodori : supreme !!!!
With a Barbera , what else?
author: Francisco L.

description:
After visiting Rome, I have been in search for the perfect thin crust pizza. I didn't expect to find it in North Beach, our own version of Little Italy where most of the restaurants are tourist traps with food that is very average.  Boy was I happy to discover Caffè BaoNecci! When I heard the kitchen staff except one were speaking in Italian. ' Its gonna be a good meal' I thought to myself. Molto! Bravo!

If you are one that likes big hearty pizzas with lots of toppings with it, this is not the place for you.  The thin crust and toppings are light I could actually finish two whole pizzas since it is not very filling. Ordered the Specialty pizzas. I don't think your life has started if you haven't tried this pizza:

Monte Bianco ~$19.95
Light San Marsano Tomato sauce, topped with fresh mozzarella, prosciutto parma and get this while the pizza is still hot it is topped with a scoop of mascarpone cheese it is spread around so that every inch of the pizza had this sweet creamy cheese taste. Each bite was heavenly.  I would love to take this home but I don't think it will taste the same.

Truffle Salame ~ $18.95
San Marsano tomato sauce applied meagerly, topped with fresh mozzarella, truffle salame, truffle oil and arrugula the sweet and salty combination of the toppings was a treat to the taste buds. Had to order two of these because it was so good.

Tomato sauce wasn't to thick or overwhelming. The ingredients for the toppings  were very simple and high quality and sparingly applied. The dough was just the canvass for the toppings. 

The reason for it being 4 stars was that for light and thin pizzas they were a bit to expensive and believe me your going to want to order more! Can't wait for my next visit to Caffè BaoNecci. Delizioso!!! Left with a smile on my face!
author: Maria M.

description: This restaurant was fabulous. We had such a great experience with our 3 kids. We picked it just by the reviews and it didn't disappoint. I must admit we were skeptical when we walked up but once we were inside, it was a fun, lively atmosphere.
