I went for a glass from the vineyard of a family friend (The story is on the menu) both times.  Just beautiful.  The ambiance is total "tiny pizza joint".  I got seriously sentimental for a second (and am sure the wine contributed).

I went early (because I was on west coast time and ready for dinner at like 4:00 every day!) and I was the only person there.  The service was fast and friendly.  I would say that for pizza, the prices were kind of high, but it is SF and it is amazing pizza.  I would pay more for this pizza.  Lot's more.
author: Laura C.

description: LOVE this new find!!  Four of us passed around every course and each were incredible!!!  This coming from a full-blooded Italian! We started with the Bruschetta, Burrata salad & Cannellini beans w/sausage.  Then moved to pastas which were incredible--Tagliatelle All Arrabbiata (YUM), Risotto ai Frutti di Mare, Lasagna Casereccia and the Pizza Truffle Salame.  OMG.  It was my birthday, so they deliverd a candle topped bao necci's tartuffo--outstanding.  I'll be coming back again and again!
author: Janet R.

description:
Pizza is a major part of my diet, and I love BaoNecci's pizza. Their pizzas have a super thin crispy crust, perhaps the thinnest and crispiest crust anywhere. The toppings are outstanding, I usually like the mushroom pizza with sausage topped with arugula. For the adventurous, they have a very unique gorgonzola and pear pizza. 

BaoNecci is run by a super friendly Italian family and the service is always excellent and very attentive.  Highly recommended.
author: Allen T.

description: I will admit that I am basing this review on a single pizza (the mushroom, arugula) so that is probably less than fair.  Nevertheless, it was tasty but something was missing...the porcini mushrooms needed more seasoning to make them more assertive in the presence of the arugula and the shaved Parmesan.  It was an above average pie, hence the 3 stars but not excellent or earth-shattering.
author: Matthew L.

description: The restaurant certainly has a family run atmosphere - it's nice and homey.  The food was outstanding.  The thin crust on the pizza was amazing, and we could not stop raving about the lasagna (even several days after the meal).  We will definitely be going back.
author: Kport S.

description: Absolutely fabulous!  Quaint family run restaurant.  Meat sauce was best I've ever had.  Chianti, imported from family winery in Italy, was excellent choice to accompany pasta dinner.  A perfect dining experience.  I will come back to SF just so I can dine here again.
author: Michele O.

description: Yum!, I'm Italian and don't usually like Italian restaurants.  I will be back!  Not sure why the line isn't  oh the door!
author: Nadine K.

description: Exactly what we had hoped for when we selected this restaurant...the space was small and intimate, filled with smells that reminded me of my grandmother's kitchen. The house-made Chianti and homemade pasta made it feel like we were not just customers but welcomed guests. The food was wonderful from salads and appetizers to eggplant and pizza. Not a scrap was left to take home. We will be back soon!
author: Amy W.

description: Amazing Tiramisu, great service, outstanding truffle salami pizza and delightful atmosphere. Warmly recommended!
author: Fabien-Pierre N.

description: I'm afraid this place is really quite poor. The staff are warm and reasonably attentive. But the food is just dire. My partner and I had the cannelloni. Truly, I've eaten tastier Italian at large chains, like East Side Mario's. The flavours were all washed out. Pasta was overcooked. Tomato sauce might have started in a jar. I would urge the owners to pay more attention to freshness.
author: Scott M.

description:
JUST GET THE LASAGNA!! I mean everything else here looks absolutely amazing but the lasagna - OH MY!
Ill never eat lasagna anywhere else again  
Its small & intimate & the perfect place to grab dinner with your true love  Italian wine, fantastic food  
Glad all you tempers out there lead me to this place
author: Kari C.

description:
Oh Caffé BaoNecci, I was really expecting to be impressed by you.

The girlfriend & I were in the neighborhood & ended up here after reading all the sterling Yelp reviews for this place.

But then they somehow forgot our order, which meant our food took way longer than it should have & that annoyed the Hell out of me.

Sure, I loved the cutesy & romantic Italian ambiance. But I watched, 1 by 1, as all the other tables around us were seated after us. & then I watched, 1 by 1, as each of those other tables got their food before us.

So, what about the food we waited so long for? We ordered Prosciutto Cotto e Finocchietto, Stefania's Salad & Pizza Margherita. In simpler terms, an appetizer, salad & basic, thin crust pizza. Certainly not the type of order that would take even 1/3 the time we waited.

All of it was actually very good & obviously made from high quality ingredients. The Prosciutto Cotto e Finocchietto had a buttery, almost melt-in-your-mouth Prosciutto & tantalizing thin slices of Fennel. Stefania's Salad was delightfully light with the right amount of sweet from the apple.

When it comes to pizzas, the Margherita is the litmus test of a pizzeria's skill & execution. The Pizza Margherita here was 1 of the better examples of this pizza I've had, but not 1 of the best. For its size, at $15, I would also say it's a little overpriced.

Caffé BaoNecci does have an authentic & welcoming Italian feel + the food is well prepared using fresh ingredients. Without losing our order & for a just a couple $ less, Caffé BaoNecci would be 4 stars for me. But that's not how it went down. 2 stars.
author: John M.

description: The best pizza in north beach hands down. We love the Pizza Bianca... the combination of prosciutto and mascarpone cheese, It is the best pizza I've ever had. The crust is thin and crisp. Delicious!
author: Tom T.

description:
Very good, cosy place

Real italian pizzas !
author: Cécile D.

description:
Underwhelming food and ambiance.  We ordered margherita mushroom and capriccioso pizzas.  All had bland and seemingly unseasoned sauces.  We also tried the burrata salad (a mix of arugula, burrata cheese, and tomatoes).  This, too, had no sign of seasoning... though the cheese tasted nice.

The only dish worth commending was the farro and bean soup.

Based on such high reviews, we had higher expectations... but in the end, Caffe BaoNecci only delivered well on 1 of 5 dishes.
author: Lee K.

description:
1st time here. Highly recommend as one can see. I've been to many parts of Italy. This family and authentic Italian food is incredible. You'll love it!
Atmosphere is excellent too
author: Rollin K.

description: The pizza was delicious - with the truffles making it irresistible. And the burrata salad was spectacular. However, the cannoli was a bit disappointing.
author: Kendra B.

description:
After reading all the amazing reviews on Yelp, we decided to give this place a try. We were in SF for a few days for our honeymoon,  and took a cab over to this address. Very unassuming from the outside,  we weren't sure we were in the right spot at first!  We didn't have a reservation but were seated quickly on a Thursday night. 

Its nice when a restaurant can make you feel like a guest of the family. Our waiter was extremely friendly and helpful. I loved reading the family story on the back of the menu. I was especially excited to discover (after my husband made a trek through the kitchen on his way to the bathroom) that there was a "little italian lady hand-making all the pizzas" in the back
We ordered the brushetta. A-mazing. Perfectly ripe tomatoes and some delicious tasting creamy olive oil. We asked our waiter what the most popular pizza was, and he made a few recommendations. We settled on the truffle salami. Perfect amount of cheese, flavor in every bite. Not a super heavy pizza, but truly authentic tasting. After our wonderful meal, we decided on a piece of pistachio cheesecake dor dessert. Again, did not disappoint in any way. 

The best part.....after raving to our waiter about how impressed we were, we discovered just how special this family business was. Our waiter informed the chef (Stefania, the family matriarch) that we were newly married and how much we enjoyed the dinner. She came out personally to thank and congratulate us!! You just don't get customer service like that!!!

If the gentleman that were sitting next to us happen to read this review.....thank you again!! We quickly made friends with them after their calzones' fragrance wafted in our direction. They were gracious enough to pay for our meal as a wedding gift. Overall GREAT experience at BaoNecci!
author: Latessa E.

description:
What I adore so much about Cafe BaoNecci is its simplicity. Just a cozy little spot, serving great food. What makes the dining experience so unique is the family running it; when there, you feel like your in their home! Great place to meet-up with friends or for a first date.

Service: Excellent. Attentive. Cordial. Informative.

Ambiance: simple, plain decorations, reminds me of the many days spent at cafes in Italy.

The Food (fun part): WIth a group.

Bruschetta Toscana: Wherever I go, the women in our group always order this! What I loved was that it was fresh and vary tasty. Many restaurants let this sit out all day before serving. Here it was made to order.

Prosciutto e Melone: with cantaloupe. Simple, traditional, fresh.

The Pizza's!!!!!!!!!!

Contadina: my favorite!!! Made with mozzarella and gorgonzola cheese. After baking it is topped with layers of thinly shaved pears and more gorgonzola. Absolutely amazing. The contrast of the thin, crispy crust, warm cheese and pear were delightful and refreshing. If you come here for one item, try this!

Bufalina: Simple and tasty! The fresh mozzarella and quality tomato sauce made all the difference. 

Ortolana: Good enough that the vegetarians in the group refused to share.

Monte Bianco: something about baking prosciutto and putting it on a pizza that just works. Maybe the flavor of the meat with crust. It was a good match with the wine. 

You're in safe hands with the wine list, just about anything will be good and all is affordable. Desserts were fun to share, but I liked my Affogato. Well done! I'll return often!
author: Patrick M.

description: Fantastic food, great staff. The pizza is amazing, the steak is just as good. I recommend this location to anyone I know visiting San Francisco.
author: Mark C.

description:
Food: 3
Decor: 3
Service: 4

Came here with a friend for dinner on a Friday evening.

1. Bruschetta Toscana 10.95
Roasted bread, chopped tomato, garlic, basil, olive oil
~Pretty good. Plenty of tomato, and the bread was nicely toasted. A bit difficult to eat though.

2.La Contadina 19.95
Fresh mozzarella, parmesan cheese, gorgonzola cheese, thin curly pears
~Disappointing. Gorgonzola was overpowering, and the curly pears were just okay. Felt like something was missing, and it was difficult to eat.

Service was okay.
author: David L.

description:
Love, love, love BaoNecci. Great Italian food, lovely owners and wait staff, can usually get a table just walking in. Go here.

I've had a variety of their pizzas (highly recommend the mushroom+arugula+parm) and the lasagna. All were wonderful. Om nom.

The wine selection is good, but we order the house wine, which is lovely and goes well with their offerings, as it should.

The good: the food, lordy.
The  bad: smaller space, so watch out if you have a larger group.
author: Amanda B.

description: What a find!  Great little Italian/pizza place in North Beach.  Service was excellent, atmosphere was cozy and relaxed. Pizza was outstanding. Super thin crispy crust with just the right amount of fresh toppings. Great way to cap off a vacation in San Fran.
author: Dana F.

description: We enjoyed an exquisite large family dinner at Baonecci.  The atmosphere was relaxed and casual. Nothing in the decor would hint at the extraordinary nature of the cuisine. Everything tasted amazing!  The marguerite pizza had a delicious, super thin crust and the perfect balance of sauce and cheese.  The pasta was so fresh and the salad well dressed.  Service was attentive and friendly.  Our eclectic and opinionated family all agrees that this is a place we will certainly return for more (preferably with a smaller group, probably with a reservation, likely on the early side, as the restaurant filled up fast)!
author: Hali R.

description: real Italian cuisine, nice place and a very cozy experience. Totally recommend for a dinner with friends or your significant other
author: Fabio M.

description:
My favorite Italian place in my favorite SF tourist neighborhood, North Beach.

Run by a family (Mom is the chef, dad is the boss and son is the waiter), the food really has a feeling of home-cooked.  The dishes are simple and simply fantastic.  This is the kind of place where you order something as traditional as lasagne, because you know their lasgagne will be amazing (it is).

It's a small corner slot with a compact bar.  Not a lot of tables, so it can get very full, so I do recommend reservations.

Now that Chef Jia's has closed (stifled sob) in nearby Chinatown, BaoNecci will be my go-to nostalgia place every time I'm in the city.
author: Ray I.

description:
We had dinner here on a Monday of a holiday weekend, and were pleasantly surprised by how easy it was to get parking, and only having a short wait for a table.

This place is tiny, and service isn't the best, but the food is pretty good,

The couple next to iu were complaining about the prices, but honestly, they weren't bad. It's comparable to other Neapolitan pizza joints. Beer and wine were cheap, cheap, cheap, (but there wasn't much to choose from.)

They do have other items on the menu, (they looked good from spying them on other tables) but we stuck with the pizza. 
It might be the thinnest crust I ever had, which made for a light pizza.

I probably wouldn't go out of my way to return, since there are other pizzas in SF i like better, (and parking in this area is usually atrocious.) Although, if i lived in the nearby, i would definitely come back. 

Even though it's technically in North Beach, it had a lovely neighborhood feel to it.
author: Amanda G.

description:
To say this was the worst restaurant we ate at during our weeklong stay in San Francisco wouldn't say enough. San Francisco does, after all, have a fantastic reputation for amazing food. I can't say anything positive about our experience. There were flies in the restaurant who seemed to be having a good time. The couple next to us seemed to do alright. 

Some reviews have mentioned the poorly cooked pizza crust. They're partly right. The pizza crust I had was undercooked at the center and burned to a crisp at the edge. The ingredients while they might have been fresh were a terrible combination. I spent ten or fifteen minutes (while waiting for the bill, or even to see our waiter again) looking for another place to eat. My wife's pasta was also undercooked.

At one point in the evening we ran out of the room temperature water they provided.  They never brought more. We had time to read through many of the reviews while we waited, and I had time to draft this one. I'm still waiting for my bill. If you happen to come in and see me still waiting, could you maybe bring some water?
author: Nate T.

description:
Not much I can mention that others reviews haven't pointed out. This is authentic Italian in the heart of North Beach. 

I've tried most of the menu items my favorite is the pear pizza, and the eggplant parmesan. My only frustration is the place is expensive. $20 for a thin crust pizza with not much cheese; its insane margins for the owners. I'd happily pay $15 but $20 seems a bit much. I guess it is the neighbourhood. Anyways excellent food, atmosphere, and wine.
author: Chris S.

description: It's my second time being here and I finally have this app to say that this is one of the best Italian restaurants in all of North Beach. The ingredients in every dish is so fresh and scrumptious!
author: Breena N.

description: Great Restaurant.  Lasagna was amazing, as was the bolonase.  Great atmosphere and friendly family staff.  Would highly recommend it.
author: Jay S.

description:
I've fallen in love with this charming place, it's a family business with petit beautiful mother in the kitchen where she prepares delicious food and father and both sons in the front. 

The bruschetta ranks among the tastiest I've ever had, the last time I had anything like th just must have been in Italy.    We ordered antipasti; a variety of mortadella, coppa, salame, cheese, olives and capers. 

I shared a pasta with olive oil, garlic, red pepper and a fungi pizza.   Both equally delicious. 
And thin crust, the way it should be in my cook book...

I'll be back!
author: Ellen G.

description: Wonderful North Beach trattoria.  There are so many to choose from; I recommend this one which is on a quiet stretch of Green Street near Columbus in North Beach.  The Tagliatelle, made with homemade egg noodles and their Bolognese sauce, was to die for!  Salads were fresh.  I had a nice Sicilian wine recommended by the waiter.  The service was excellent, and very friendly.  Lots of locals seemed to come in, as well as happy groups of all ages.  Great food for a decent price.
author: Cynthia B.

description:
This was a great find through Yelp. We were there on Saturday afternoon after Christmas. Parking was not easy but the food was worth it.

The spicy calzone my wife ordered was so good we ordered another calzone farcito with prosciutto. My pasta bolognese was good but not great. My son started with a pizze but added a pasta alla pesto which had such flavorful basil that even I who do not like the store pesto was gaga.

My son finished off with a chocolate gelato. Then we slowly trudged up the hill to where I had parked the car. The view of the bay bridge was worth it.

Will be back.
author: Gautam G.

description: Stopped by here since pizza joints in the area were packed at the time. We ordered 2 calzones but the waitress only brought one which ended up being fine. The portion was pretty large and my wife and I were able to share it and still be satisfied. It tasted pretty good but it didn't blow my socks off. I'd come back again to try other menu items.
author: Brandejo D.

description: love this place!  Great pizza and the lasagna was melt in your mouth good.  had a glass of super Tuscan to go with our dinner.  2nd time there and won't be the last.
author: Wayne S.

description:
The proximity and reviews drew me here for a test run. We were recommended the Monte Bianco (San marsano tomatoes, fresh mozzarella, prosciutto parma, scoop of mascarpone cheese) or Truffle Salame (San marzano tomato, fresh mozzarella, truffle salame, truffle oil, arugola) pizza. We chose the Truffle Salame. The BEST pizza we've had. It's like an appetizer and you won't get even 1/4 full (I could eat 5 of them EASILY!)

It seems a bit pricey, but it's SO worth the try anytime you want to treat your taste buds to some great flavor! I'll be trying the Monte Bianco next go-around!
author: Johnny P.

description:
i live in north beach and i cant believe i didnt know about this place sooner. i do not liberally give out 5 stars so i really mean this rating. definitely one of the best italian restaurants in the city. i love the ambiance. it is fit for a date or for a large group, as they have separate rooms in the back. the service was superb and the food more than delicious. 

we ordered: 
- Burrata Salad: i love burrata so this was simple but good
- PASTA ALLA BOLOGNESE: i was hesitant at first bc i thought it would be like any other spaghetti off the street. but it was SO much better than expected. the sauce, meat, pasta was delish. 
- TRUFFLE SALAME: i love anything truffle. this was the BEST  
- Quattro  Stagioni: a pizza with prosciutto, mushrooms, artichokes, and green olives with each ingredient laid separately on the dough. never had a pizza like that bc its normally stacked but it was good nevertheless

make a reservation and try this place!
author: Jen S.

description:
Sweet family-owned restaurant. Classic Italian... old black and white photos on the walls and silk flowers in short vases on the tables.

Service was pleasant but our pizza took a really long time... and we were one of two tables in the restaurant. 

Salad was fresh but nothing special. Felt the same about the proscuitto pizza. Cute place, but I won't make it a priority to come back.
author: Jenny V.

description: Upon reflection, this place rates 5 stars. It's been 5 months and we can't stop raving about the pizza. So delicious. If you are weighing choices and wondering whether to go, do yourself a favor and put down the phone and just go!
author: Mary N.

description: We were referred here by another local business. Definitely worth the visit and will go back again!! Great pizza, seafood pasta and tiramisu! Excellent service - just the right balance of looking after you and allowing you to have a leisurely dinner.
author: Denise P.

description:
The only reason I am giving this restaurant 3 stars is because the service wasnt too terrible and the food was good.
After finally having the opportunity to come to  this side of town,  I was excited about getting to experience the real authentic cousine that this beautiful city has to offer. After seeing this place had 4.5 stars and reading the variety of entrees on the menu, my family and I decided to give this place a shot.
We arrived, drenched from the rain and we were asked by a gentlemen, "do you have a reservation?" We responded "no". He then walked off to see if he could "squeeze us in", and we were left to stand awkwardly in the doorway in the EMPTY restaurant. I work in a restaurant;  I understand the importance of reservations. However, I truly believe the interaction could have been handled better.
We were then seated and given glasses of water. I don't know if the servers were just coming on to their shift, because we got there shortly right after they opened, but no one came to our table for thr next 15-20  minutes to offer the specials or anything aside from water to drink...which we probably would have ordered because this was a treat for us. Our server finally came to our table and he seemed surprised that we were ready to order. My father ordered an antipasti cheese platter for us to share and we each ordered our own entrees. Pasta Bolognese. Lasagna. Pasta al Fogno.  Canaloni. I expected the cheese platter to come out at least in 10 minutes but it didn't. Which was disappointing because we are cheese fanatics and were really looking forward to enjoying them. Had our server not been so consumed by whatever he was looking at on his phone. It might have occured to him to ask us how we were liking the platter or better yet realizing we never got it. I get it, mistakes happen. You forget to ring in something, you get so consumed with all the tables you have worry about. But we were the only other table in there. So the only mistake was being on the phone and neglecting the customers. However, I did enjoy my food.
Our food came out in a reasonable amount of time though. We didnt wait long. Everything had a nice presentation. Steam was rising from the dishes and the melted cheese was bubbling. My lasagna was delicious. It was well portioned. The egg noodle was tender and melted in my mouth. The ground beef was succulent and had the perfect blend of spices. The cheese was so creamy and fresh. 
I would have definitely have given this place a higher rating if the service was better.
author: Kimberly S.

description: I started with the soup and Bruschetta both were very good. Lots of fresh tomatoes on the Bruschetta.  My family shared a Lasagna and a Porcini mushrooms pizza.  The lasagna was bubbling hot, pasta was tender but firm.  I had to tear it out of my daughters hands to get a bite.  The pizza was crisp and delicious not overpowered by sauce
author: John D.

description:
Never had porcinis so fresh and fat and juicy, or arugula as clean, crunchy and dark green.

Never managed to be merely whelmed, rather than overwhelmed, by gorgonzola.  There is a fine balance, and this pear/gorgonzola pizza attained it.

Thin, thin, thin crust pizza - perfect for this bread-hater.

Takes awhile and costs a pretty penny.  That's the cost of practically-perfection.
author: Hannah E.

description:
I can't believe this wasn't the establishment I wrote my first review on.  I've got only one thing to say: 

If you think you've tasted the best pizza in the bay area and you haven't been to BaoNecci, then clearly you haven't tasted THE best pizza yet.  

Get any pizza, you won't be disappointed. Try their appetizers as well.. everything is delicious!
author: Patricia T.

description:
Decent Italian place in North Beach. The front of the restaurant (the cafe side?) is more casual, but the back opens up into a very romantic, dimly lit room. It's kind of an amusing, surreal experience given that I was at dinner with my co-workers, not on a hot date. The music is kind of outdated, playing cheesy 80s romantic songs, probably from a Pure Moods CD. 
Anyway, onto the food--the pasta is all made w/ homemade egg noodles but they also have regular pasta. I ordered the pasta bolognese, which is my favorite pasta sauce. I thought overall the pasta was decent but nothing amazing. Noodles were a little too soft, not as al dente as I would've liked, but they did taste fresh and homemade. For once, I actually thought the portion was normal sized, even a bit small.. everyone in my group finished their plates. It didn't help that I was starving, though. My friend ordered a pizza and said it was just ok as well, and that it was a little too soggy. I tried a few bites of my other friend's eggplant parmesan, which I actually really enjoyed. It was very flavorful and cheesy and nicely balanced with a side salad. We all shared the nutella pizza which was decent. Sounded like an interesting design but it was pretty much just a flat crepe only w/ pizza dough instead of crepe material.
Service is very friendly, but super slow. Eventually my friend had to walk up to the waiter to hand over the check and credit cards. Overall this restaurant was very cute, but next time I'm in North Beach I'd probably look for other Italian places to try first.
author: Jacqueline K.

description:
After reading all the wonderful yelp reviews about this place, we decided to give it a try.

The food was disappointing, bland, and not special at all. I ordered the calzone and I don't recommend it. 
I think I can cook tastier Italian food  than this.

The customer service was mediocre. After we were done, the busboy cleaned up our table.The waiters were standing on the corner chatting and took a long time to bring us the check. The waiter had a sarcastic sense of humor that I didn't find funny at all.
author: Nancy L.

description:
I discovered this place when Tony's around the corner was unexpectedly closed for a private event. With my heart set on a pizza dinner in North Beach, I took a walk around the area and decided to try this place. We didn't have a reservation, but we got lucky with timing and snagged a table. We had a carafe of wine, the caprese salad, two pizzas, and gelato. The caprese salad was lovely - delicious mozzarella, simply but well-dressed with olive oil, salt, and pepper. The pizzas were crazy good. We had the one with sausage & pepperoni (the best!) and the one with olives/prosciutto/artichokes/mushrooms. The crust is super super thin, which is my favorite. 

A little pricey for a pizza dinner, but I'm so glad Tony's was closed so I could discover this place. Go.
author: Kristina C.

description:
The three of us came for an early dinner on Saturday.  There was boisterous Santa activity in the neighborhood, however the management kept most Santa's from coming in.

We began with a cannellini bean soup and a oven cooked cannellini beans and sausage.  Served with warm focaccia, it was the highlights of the night.  W followed this with two tasty think crust pizzas.  My one complaint is that both pizzas had meat on them, I would have preferred contract in what we orders.  Next the eggplant parmesan and the pasts in spicy tomato sauce.  Lastly, we split three desserts, the cannoli, affogato, and tiramisu.  With a bottle of wine and a soda, the total with tip came to $185.  

I would return again to try more items on the menu.  The restaurant is tucked away on a side street, and has a wonderful history.
author: Hank H.

description:
Sometimes in North Beach what SHOULD be a solid restaurant is a disappointment -- the food isn't very good or the ambience is very 'touristy.'  As a result I don't try as many 'new-to-me' places there.  None of my usual go-to places sounded appealing so we decided to give this place a try.  

I was glad we did because I was happy with Baonecci -- a family-owned Italian place which reminds me a lot of similar sized family-run restaurants in Europe.  The dining room is a little Spartan -- the food was made with fresh ingredients, in what I assume are family recipes.  Service was cordial and professional.  

overall we had a nice experience and I'd go again if I were in the neighborhood and in the mood for classic Italian, not fancy.  it's not a destination restaurant where I will linger the whole evening, but it's not priced like one either.
author: Jaina S.

description:
I have made a commitment to eat at every pizzeria in SF... That being said, If you are looking for an amazing pizza, I suggest you go else where. We got the Margarita, which I was thoroughly disappointed! When I order a Margarita I expect more than 2 leafs of basil. And the crust was way too thin! However the crust was tasty, as was the sauce, and the cheese was fresh. Its extremely hard for me to give negative feed back on pizza, because I love it so much!!! But this one wasn't spectacular!

We also tried the Cannelloni which was FANTASTIC!!!! Very cheesy, and extremely Delicioso!!!
author: Anthony C.

description:
BaoNecci is a small restaurant that was a little difficult to find. If you plan to go on a weekend, you should make a reservation because seating is limited.

I ordered the eggplant parmigiana, which was underwhelming. The portion was small and it is served with only a side salad. It wasn't what I expected from a traditional Italian restaurant. I don't think it was worth the price.

My fiance ordered the Capricciosa pizza. The pizzas are thin crust here. It wasn't the greatest pizza, but it was better than my food. I'd recommend trying the pizza if you go.

The service was alright. This is a family-owned restaurant, and the owner spent a fair amount of time talking to friends (who were not customers), rather than working.
author: Emily H.

description:
Unbelievable paper thin crust! Now that deep dish is so popular, it's a relief to find a pizza place that caters to thin crust lovers. Service is friendly and food is good, though a bit pricey.

Tiramisu could have been much better. We got one that may have been old. It was watery and the cream seemed old.
author: Jeanne C.

description:
I came here during a weekend trip to San Francisco during lunch time and it was not packed at all! I had no idea about little Italy in sf and what to expect, but I wasn't disappointed in the slightest. We ordered a salad - the one with goat cheese, and the mushroom pizza. I generally like thin crust pizza so this pizza was right up my alley. The food is excellent but not overly oily or food coma inducing. If I came back, I'd probably want to try a pasta or the pizza with lots of veggies. Stay tuned for another review in the distant future! 

One thing that was strange was that they didn't give oil with bread until we asked for it. Maybe the olive oil thing is an Americanized tradition?
author: Sherri D.

description: Legit pizza! Closest thing to NY pizza you'll get in SF. And the waiters/waitresses are so friendly. "My only recommendation for New Yorkers looking for legit pizza in SF. "
author: Connor C.

description: Fabulous meal! Just happened by with a friend. The menu isn't exhaustive, but there is love in every dish! The house wine is excellent - warm and easy, mellow and a bit smokey. Despite being early in the season, the tomatoes were nearly as good as those in Italy. Our food was, likewise, homey and flavorful. Chef Stefania stopped by the table to check in and chat. The atmosphere exudes an easy family atmosphere; mom in the kitchen, dad running front of house, son as waiter - all with a warm smile. I'll need to find another excuse to come back to SF for more!
author: Lori M.

description:
This restaurant is very dark!!! Our group of 7 was seated in the back room and I wish they would have turned on just a little more light or lit all the candles.  Overall, food was mediocre. I ordered the pesto pasta which was just that, pesto and pasta, no veggies or any additions. I added prosciutto and tried to add spinach, but they didn't have any. When my pasta came out, they forgot to add the prosciutto and basically just brought me 3 slabs of prosciutto on a plate, which was unexpected and kind of unappetizing. The pesto pasta itself was ok, but the portion size was perfect for me, but may be small for others (I usually don't finish my food, but I finished my pasta this time). We ordered the Nutella pizza to share which was also just mediocre. Not sure what I was expecting, but it was pizza dough, which was overly powdery, with thinly spread Nutella, topped with kiwi, banana, and strawberry. It didn't really go together well as a single dish. Overall, I don't think I would be returning, there are much better options for the price.

I wish I had pictures to share, but it was too dark to take any.
author: Amy L.

description:
Great atmosphere and food! From the elaborate Italian/American decorations on the wall to the vintage looking table cloths, this place will get you in the mood for some Italian flavor.

They specialize in thin crust artisan pizzas similar to the kind served in Italy. 

Tried the signature pizza with the four toppings and the calzone. Delicious! So much so that we came back a few hours to try their desserts. Had the Affogato al Caffe, Coppa Crema Pistachio, and the Almond Cake. All very delightful.

Got a little lost walking here but was well worth the journey!
author: S T.

description: Every time I've been here I've experienced Great pizza and Great service!! Anxious to try some more of their menu!
author: Mary L.

description: Came up by bus from moscone for dinner on a Sunday night.   No reservations.  They were packed.   Even though they were working there butt off, we were greeted by everybody there.  They made a place at bar.  We had a glass of wine then they got us a table.  Food was great.  Endless bread.  I'm a pig.   Not super fancy restaurant but great cafe like decor.   Great place.  Go back again in a heartbeat.
author: Joel R.

description: What can I say--amazing Italian good. Don't miss this place. It is small and cozy. Can be a tough seat to get but so worth the wait. What are you waiting for...get here.
author: J G.

description: Good neapolitan pizza. This is generally our default place since waiting in line at Tony's for two hours plus usually isn't an option. Comfortable, non-pretentious atmosphere, and friendly service at reasonable prices. Be sure to make a reservation at least a couple days in advance as the place is fairly small and the odds of scoring a table as a walk in are low.
author: G A.

description: Great pizza, I absolutely recommend this place if you're looking for awesome italian taste. Monte Bianco and Diavolo are a great dinner. And for entrance the one with beans in tomato sauce. YUM!
author: Anabel V. D.

description:
All fabulous !!!

Authentic Italian food, Stefania came out to talk to us and even gave us a few cooking tips on how to create her fabulous dishes.

Best tiramisu I've ever had for sure.
author: Kelly S.

description:
AAAAAAAAAA, OOOOOOOO, OOOOOO AAAAAAAAA!

I freakin love this place! (Said in my best Bronx accent)

There are many Italian restaurants in North Beach but only a few them have actual Italians in them.  This place is family run and 100% Italian.  The dishes are family recipes and the some of the most flavorful I have ever tasted.  

They have an amazing selection of Italian wines too.  Every server is very knowledgable about the food pairings with each as well.

COME HERE!
author: Brian S.

description:
nAte here with the family for Mothers Day. Polite staff and a cute and open space place. Other yelpers talked about the thin pizzas, and it was true.Real thin crust and tasty! They had a few interesting pizzas that had different toppings not seen at other pizza places on their menu which was quite intriguing!  We had ordered a Mushroom Pizza, forget the name of it and the Contadina. Both were really yummy! Definitely they don't skimp on the toppings! Was quite proportioned to the pizza and all the vegetables and topping were fresh! Had their Lasagna and Cannoloni and good portions and tasty. A little bit pricey, but what do you expect in the  North Beach?
 You'd miss this place as it's a little place on the corner, but I'd say a definite gem!
author: V. P.

description:
What a surprise!  Very authentic Italian food as prepared by the mother of the house!  The family is from Lucca and it's the entire family that makes you feel like you are truly in quaint village from their homeland. We just couldn't  figure why Nate T.'s review (9/29/13) was so negative.  We had no flies, no waiting, and perfect pizza crust. 

We were met immediately by the son and father upon our entry with very warm greeting and made us feel like the guest of honor this very night.

We had the traditional cannelloni and shell pasta and they were both home runs!
Simple interior with wonderful family pictures and Lucca area prints throughout continued with the traditional feel.   The homemade cannoli said it all at the end.  

This is a "for-sure return restaurant" in the heart of North Beach!
author: Keith D.

description: Wanted to like this place more but it just didn't hit the spot. Being a local it's hard to find Italian in North Beach and not feel like you're paying tourist prices. Left feeling a bit hungry which shouldn't be the case when you pay $$ for a meal for two. The pizza was authentic but the cheese was sparse and it was a small pizza for $18. Service was a bit better than other yelpers have reported but there def is a casual, laid back Italian sense of urgency going on here (don't eat here if you're in a hurry or impatient).
author: Nicole O.

description:
Came here two days ago on easily made reservations for two. Got there a little late but luckily there weren't too many people, so even if i didnt make reservations, it wouldn't have been to hard to get a table. Delightfully greeted by Lorezeno and quickly seated. No rush in taking orders and didn't have to wait too long to have to flag down someone. The place is small, cozy, intimate(?). Foods fresh, prices are okay. Great experience overall!

Bruschetta:
Flavorful, large pieces, easy to cut.

Cotto E Funghi
made thin and cut into 6 slices. perfect for two people. for amazingly how thin it was, it held together very well. the crust was crispy. cheesy wasnt overly topped and the sauce compensated well for how many ingredients there were. large slices of prosciutto that werent super salty and easy to bite into.


Tiramisu
best ive had in north beach, but only being compared to cafe greco and cafe roma. presented in a parfait cup(?) and not your usual block of cake. it stayed solid and didnt melt. not over done with coco powder top neither.

Sobertto Limone
now  this is where i went full retard, but only for a while. i thought here, i had ordered a lemon in a cup with only a crown of limone sobert..boy was i wrong. this dessert is actually a lemon hollowed out, filled with lemon sobert filled over the top, and the top of the lemon is placed back on top, like its wearing a damn hat. side note, lemons sticky, as it's coated in lemon juice and sprinkled with some sugar.

5/5, would come back!

Now if your night, day, whatever, fails, head 3 doors down to Golden Boy!!!!
author: Vince L.

description:
Excellent pizza and cappuccino! The best we've had in the city. 

Only cons are, it's a teeny place so seating is limited and tight although they have managed to accommodate us pretty soon each time and like everywhere else in the city, parking is a PAIN!!!
author: Ashwini S.

description:
While in town for the holidays, a group of friends and I were in search of some great thin crust pizza. We decided to dine here after reading great reviews on yelp - we were really looking forward to eating here. 

We are a large group of 12 and were thankfully seated right away. We were waiting on a few members of our party to arrive so we placed drink orders for those present to pass the time. They don't have appetizers so beer seemed like the next logical thing. =) Our drinks took a long time to get considering all they had to do was pop off the caps. Perhaps the prosecco my girlfriend ordered threw them off. Note: beer and wine is all they serve. 

When the rest of our party arrived, here's what a few of us of ordered:

--Caprese salad - a basic caprese salad. There was nothing special about this. Flavor was great. 

--Margherita Pizza - Authentic? Well perhaps the crust but not the flavors. I love margherita pizzas but this one didn't do anything for me. The flavor was bland and that was with the addition of crushed red pepper. I've had pizzas throughout Italy and those have flavor. I'm sorry to say, this didn't. 

--Funghi Pizza - My friends ordered this and I was able to grab a slice of it. The flavors here were much better but the flavor still didn't blow me away. 

Two members of our party also ordered the eggplant parmigiana and the meat lasagna. Both mentioned that the center was really cold. One sent it back to the kitchen and the other kept it in fear of someone spitting in their food. Bummer. 

We all decided against dessert since we no one was overly enthusiastic with what they ordered.

In terms of service, I was a bit disappointed in that as well. We had to ask for everything; plates, silverware and our dishes were just brought to the table. We all had to swap plates to get the dishes that we ordered. It was just awkward and the staff wasn't warm, friendly or welcoming which was very surprising to me. 

I'm disappointed that I couldn't give this "authentic" pizza joint more stars considering so many others liked it. Perhaps it was an off night for them...but it left me very disappointed and unsatisfied.
author: Sharon V.

description:
This place was AWESOME!! Pizzas were great. Pasta was cooked to perfection. The staff makes you feel part of the family. 

We ordered 2 different Pizzas. Both were incredible. Thin crust. Great sauce. The table next to us had a pizza with thin pear slices that looked better than what we had. 

We also ordered the cannelloni which was also cooked perfectly with the right amount of sauce and cheese. 

The staff was super friendly. If you live in SF you have to go here. If you are visiting from out of town you have to go here.
author: K G.

description:
If you love thin crust pizza, this is your spot! What a cute new discovery of north beach.

This small bright (literally like green walls) restaurants reviews definitely live up to the expectation!  It's quite small though so be sure to make a reservation.

We started with a chianti, buratta and bruschetta - all delicious. Then we shared 3 pizzas. This was the perfect amount of food for 4 people.

The servers are Italian and everything feels truly authentic. (It's family run.) I'm so glad we tried this restaurant!
author: Taylor L.

description:
The first time we came here, we were so drunk, I didn't remember coming.  That was about 3 weeks ago.  This last weekend, we were looking for an italian spot on Yelp, and BaoNecci came up.  We called, and they had a table for 2.  Score!

We got there, and the waiters remembered us, and even sat us at the same table.  As we were ordering our food, bits and pieces of my memory came back to me.  

Now that we've eaten here twice, I'd say it's safe to say: 

Service is awesome.  Burratta salad was hard and not smooth.  I'd skip that dish.  The white bean dish is so good!  I'd eat it over and over and over.  

Pizza was decent.  Chewy crust, good toppings, but it wasn't crispy. It was really soggy in the middle.  

3.5 stars for food, 5 stars for service, so we'll average them out at 4 stars.  I don't think we'll be any rush to come back, since Zero Zero is so much better in every way.
author: Vi Y.

description:
Dining at Caffe BaoNecci was very similar to experiences we had dining in Italy.

When we arrived, we stood at the door for about 5 minutes, before we were greeted, which was a little awkward because there isn't really a big lobby area. Two of the waiters (which I believe were the sons in the family business), actually looked at us several times and didn't come over to greet us.  Now, like I said- this was similar to experiences we had while dining in Italy. So I'm just going to chalk it up to a difference in cultural dining norms. It definitely didn't ruin our night. Finally, the owner came over to seat us.We were a little early for our reservation, but they gave us a table anyway, which was very nice- as the place was already very crowded. 

I started with a cup of the **Zuppa Garfagnina**, which was a puree of cannelini beans and farro which olive oil on top. It was delicious. Absolutely delicious. Perfectly seasoned, nice consistency and served with a little bit of Italian bread for soaking up the last bite. I really enjoyed it. Hindsight is 20/20, I would have gotten the bowl and a salad instead of my main dish.

For my main dish I got the **Pesto Pasta**, the Rotini was perfectly cooked. A nice al dente. The pesto covered the pasta nicely, but wasn't served in puddles and pools, which is good for me because I don't like things over sauced. I just wasn't that impressed with the pesto itself. It tasted very fresh, and not store bought as other reviews indicate, but it was not very flavorful and fell flat. My husband on the other hand really enjoyed it and said he liked it better than the Pesto that I compare all pestos to at L'Angello de Museii In Rome. Not close for me, but I'm glad he enjoyed it as much as he did. It was by no means BAD, it just wasn't GREAT!

My husband got the Pepperoni and Sausage Pizza- **Salamino E Salsiccia** He really likes thin crust pizza, so he was impressed with the crust of the pie. It was thin, but he could still pick up a slice and everything didn't go falling off. He also noted that the cheese was very creamy and melted well, a higher quality mozzarella than was served in our regular pizza place. He's definitely not as descriptive as I am, so when I asked him how he felt about it overall, he said "It was good." So good it was.

At the end of the meal, the Owner came up to talk to us and asked me how I enjoyed making our reservation on Open Table. I guess they just started using it a few weeks ago. He was really nice, and seemed really interested in how we felt about the process. 

I think that their business will continue to thrive. They are really nice people, making quality food. I wish them well.

**Another note, the bathroom is in a hallway behind the kitchen, so you need to walk through the kitchen to get there. I was so impressed with how impeccably clean the kitchen was. Everything was neat in prep containers, and there was not a crumb on the ground. I love a clean kitchen. It really shows the pride of ownership and in what they are doing.**
author: Sarah Y.

description: Came before with my boyfriend before and we sat outside to avoid waiting. I came today bragging about their good service and an Italian guy was pretty rude looking at us and talking about reservations the whole place was empty with exception and us. He was "kind" enough to let us in but the true was that he was picking his clients depending how they look eventually he was letting people without reservation use the table that he didn't let me use because was "reserved" we felt watched all the time. While we were there 2 tables without reservations that he gave the honor to received stood up and left without ordering to be honest the vibe was super heavy not in a good way. I felt bad for my guest I promised good food and good experience I will just never feed the snobby owners of this place with my business with that kind of treatment I can tell why people kept standing up and not waisting their money there. Just go to E Tutto Qua these guys will find a table for you  even if they're suuuper busy and always have an smile.
author: Lola P.

description:
This place is an absolute gem in Little Italy!

It's a small family run place with incredibly friendly staff.  The food is fresh and fabulous and fairly-priced.  They give you some warm fresh bread to start.  Hubby and I shared their pear and goat cheese salad which was excellent, then shared one of their thin crust pizzas.  So good!  We had the pepperoni and salami one - my only complaint was that I like the center of the crust to be crisper (their edges are very good though), but this totally reminds me of the pizzas in Italy.

Very authentic, casual Italian dining.
author: Katie F.

description: We had a delightful date night dinner here this evening. The bruschetta and cannoli bean soup was delicious and I loved the mushroom pasta! Our waiter recommended a smooth Italian cab which went perfectly with our meal.  I forgot my phone and one of the waiters ran all the way down the street to return it to me.. thank you!! We will defiantly be returning for more amazing Italian food!
author: Jennifer K.

description:
Caffé BaoNecci has pretty great Italian style pizza. And when I mean Italian, I mean the paper thin kind that you get in Italy that's super crispy with super fresh toppings.

God I miss Italy. Thank you Caffé BaoNecci for reminding me how much with your delicious pies!
author: Leslie D.

description:
A great place with great service. This place is nothing short of a real Italian experience.

The food is great, service is great. 

Walter (the owner) took the time to talk to me about his roots of Italy and what inspired his food. I would give 6 stars if I could.
author: Jonathan G.

description:
Bottom line, the best, most authentic Italian in the city. Love the family who runs it, love the food and just hope I don't get pushed out by the rest of the world finding out about it.

Favorites:
-Monte Bianco Pizza. prosciutto and Mascarpone.
-Pepperoni & truffle pizza.
author: Adam L.

description: Best lasagna I've ever eaten. Fresh pasta and light tomato sauce make this a fresh delicious dish. Pesto noodles were a hit because the pasta consistency is perfect. I've definitely had better pesto. Margarita pizza is juicy and even the kids preferred it to the truffle salami pizza.
author: Jackie M.

description:
I have to say the pizza was way too thin and really overpriced!  I love thin crust style pizza, especially with that slightly burnt bubbly crust, and this was more like eating some prosciutto on a cracker - none of that bubbly or doughy consistency :/  I LOVE thin crusts but this was way too thin.  It was $18.95 for each pizza whether you get sausage/meat/toppings, etc or just cheese, which makes no sense.

On the other hand, the service was really good and staff super friendly. I just think the pizza should be more like $13-15, and even then I probably wouldn't go back.

It was also really noisy in the place and me and my husband were looking for something quiet and romantic.  We didn't find that to be the place :/
author: K B.

description: The restaurant was small and welcoming as we entered the door. Very little room to wait to be seated and narrow walk ways, I felt like my chair was in the way. Friendly and fast employees. Our order came out fast: lasagne, pesto pasta, margherita pizza, and a salad. The food was good but a little under seasoned. $18.95 for a 1C serving of pesto pasta was a little disappointing. $3.75 for a can of soda was ridiculous. $80 later and we were still hungry. We will not be back.
author: Leslie S.

description: The lasagna and Bolognese past was really good; however the service was not.  The restaurant was practically empty and it took about 10 mins for is to even be acknowledged for water.  Then, when they eventually brought our app, they still had not brought us bread.  They then brought our bread without any olive oil or butter.  Asked again was then brought a small ramekin of oil only.  Then had to ask if we could just please have both balsamic and oil and they eventually brought that over.  When food came, server just sat the food down and did not offer any parm or cracked pepper.  Felt like I we were pulling teeth.   The food though was so good that it saved this place from 3 star.  After this, will possibly not go back as Sodini's is my favorite anyway.
author: Tommy A.

description:
The food at Baonecci was excelent. We had the Margherita Pizza and a Goat cheese and pear salad that was great. Based solely on the food, I'd say this place is 5 stars.
What we didn't like was the lack of service and the fact that they sent us to the bar because we did't have a reservation. They could use one more waiter on busy days; the person working behind the bar was not that helpful.
author: Teddy F.

description: My husband was craving pizza and knows how much I love Neapolitan style pizza (super thin crust), so we found this place by its raving reviews. We walked all the way from Bush street, and arrived without a reservation. Fortunately, they gave us a table; many others following us were turned away without reservations, so we were thankful. We had the bruschetta as an appetizer, and the servings were heaping, fresh, and very well seasoned. We ordered the Monte Bianco and the 4 Stagioni and were very pleased with each. The service was great, but expected to be so since the place only seats about 25 people. I certainly recommend going here if you're looking for great tasting pizza, but not if you're trying to fill up. It's a bit expensive, too: $19 a piece. I would be a regular if we lived here!
author: Lauren P.

description: The restaurant was not the best choice for my group. It was unnecessarily expensive. Perhaps a better place for romantic dates not for large groups.
author: Salomon R.

description:
ok just dined here last night: LOVE!

-crust: so good. thin and crispy!!
-pizza, delishhhh
between 3 guys, and 1 girl, we have 3 pizzas, 1 pasta dish, and a dessert pizza it came out to roughly 30 a person. SOOOO good for the amount of food
author: Priscilla W.

description: This is the perfect Italian restaurant: great food and wines, a cozy interior, and the old world charm and hospitality of owners.  Their inventive thin crust pizzas (e.g. pears and gorgonzola), lasagnas (made by one talented chef/mom), and calzones are exemplary.  Maybe, best of all is the warmth of the Italian family that operates this restaurant: they exude love, enthusiasm, and grace -- and nothing makes good food even better.  They (mom, dad, and their two sons) left Lucca, Italy, about 5 years ago, to take over a bakery at this North Beach location and have evolved it into a much loved neighborhood restaurant. Take takes skill, talent, and chutzpah.  You will love this place.
author: joe r.

description:
I am a sucker for mom and pop owned places.
I am a sucker for Italian restaurants owned by real Italians.
I am a sucker for concepts - like tonight they hosted a feast/movie party.

We got there at 6:30 and there was SO MUCH FOOD. 
Issues: seats were too close together, and not comfortable enough to sit in for so long. Ouch!

So the pizza was good - with the caveat that i found the crust not crispy enough and the overall thing too salty. What did I love most: the tortilla-esque appetizer. That was delicious.

Would go back for sure, but with an extra cushion.
author: Andrew K.

description:
Odd.  Very friendly staff but the food tasted strange.  I've been to Italy and this pizza was not even half as good as pizza is there.  Also, it was burnt.  Not just around the edges, but the whole thing.  It was inedible, but we had gotten takeout so it's not like we were going to drive all the way back to complain.  

It also took A LOT longer than the half hour they told me on the phone, so I was stuck standing around their tiny shop waiting for my order, getting hungrier and hungrier which made the eventual disappointment of the food so much worse.  Maybe they were having an off night?
author: Angela R.

description:
Stumbled in here accidentally last night with a group of 4 for dinner because the wait at our intended-to-dine restaurant was far too long and the hostess was rude!

The space is small, but cozy and the waiters are friendly with Italian accents!  The only down side is that the aisles are tiny and you have people squeezing in between you all the time.  

The pizza was delish!  My favorite was the Truffle Salame with fresh arugula.  It has a little heavy on the truffle, but the arugula added a good balance.   

They have three different hots to try, a mild red pepper, a medium and hot chili infused oil.  Try mixing the oils with the pepper to really bring out the spice!

I am definitely not a pizza fan, but not only did I enjoy the pizza here, I loved it!
author: Phoebe L.

description:
This is another outstanding Italian bakery in North Beach.  Everything looks scrumptious whether it be their pastries, cookies, biscotti, pizzas or focaccia.  I've only sampled the focaccia so far, but I'm planning many return trips to sample other goodies.

Yesterday I tried a couple of slices of their focaccia.  The focaccia comes in six inch squares and the bakery will toast them warm for you if you'd like.  I particularly liked the combination variety with sliced mushrooms, black olives and green onion on a slightly tangy tomato sauce covered slice (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/gtIud2JPu_tW3LMldEOUaw?select=2MiPPKyb_CVnSUrabNaM4g).  It was as good as any cheeseless pizza slice I've ever had.

I liked the green onion focaccia (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/gtIud2JPu_tW3LMldEOUaw?select=VjyR3wDHHydoIObplgJk3g) also except Danilo's version has a bit of pepper sprinkled on it, and I'm used to having that without the pepper like what is sold at my favorite Liguria Bakery.  Two things that I did like more than Liguria's on both of the slices was that neither were as oily, and both were still available in the middle of the afternoon.  The combo square was $2 and the onion square was $1.50.  There are tables and chairs both inside and outside.  I was in a hurry to return to work; otherwise, I might have stayed a bit to soak up some of that great North Beach atmosphere.
author: Wilhelm Y.

description: Family owned. All from Lucca, Italy. Maybe best pizza ever. It's a toss-up between this spot, and another in Santa Barbara. Amazing handmade crust. Great sauce. I had the prosciutto with a scoop of mascarpone that was to die for. Had an amazing convo with Filippo, one of the 2 brothers that worked there/sons of the owners. He chatted about Lucca, San Francisco, Italian culture, and life in general. VERY cool dude. His other bro very cool and friendly as well. Absolutely one of he best restaurant experiences Ive ever had.
author: Matt W.

description:
I thought I had met the mecca of pizza - and then I met BaoNecci's pizza. This pizza is so thin it's unreal. The sauce, cheese, and basil were so simple but so fresh and delicious. We also had the barley and bean soup, which was exactly what we Miami peeps needed for that SF freezing weather. For dessert we battled over their extensive dessert menu (all homemade!) and my hubs won and ordered the tiramis, which was so damn good. Fluffy airy creamy - perfect!!!

I second my girl Tiana F when I say the boys working in the place were not bad to look @ - they were total hotties. This place has a total family feel to it - the lady cooking in the back brought out and picked up a couple of our things and you could tell she took pride in the food and service. 

If you're looking for authentic Italian homemade pizza while visiting SF this place will not disappoint.
author: Faby P.

description:
I was looking for a very authentic, Italian experience for my husband's first trip to North Beach.  After a lot of research, I finally decided on Bao Necci since it had great reviews.   

We enjoyed the overall atmosphere---there were several Italian families eating lunch and everyone who arrived (on foot---definitely a neighborhood haunt)  carried on exuberant conversations with the owners in Italian.  Unfortunately, the owners seemed more interested in the locals, who received much better counter service than we did.  For the most part, I felt ignored.

We sat at one of the tables out front---even though this place is on a side street, there were plenty of people strolling by, so it was fun to feel part of the scene.  

I just had biscotti and coffee, but my husband had some pizza.  It wasn't as good as he thought it would be---he says it was very unexciting.  

Bao Necci is a decent place to stop for a coffee and a rest after a morning of sightseeing.  I really, really wanted to like it better, but I am not sure it warrants a second trip for us.
author: Deb P.

description:
Amazing thin crust individual pizzas. The ham, artichokes, and olives pizza is great. The place feels casual but nice enough for a laid back date.

Service is a bit slow and is the lowest point of the experience, but at least it's friendly.
author: Victor W.

description: Honestly the truffle salami pie was one of the best and most memorable pizza experiences I have ever had in my life. I will visit Baonecci every time I am in San Fran!
author: Jeff T.

description:
How this place has such high ratings is beyond me. This is in refeence to the food only, the service was lovely and accomodating, and a very cute little place. However, I thought with the typical italian style caffe, the pizza would be amazing. Boy, was I wrong!

Our fungi pizza that was $16 and meant to have champagine (spelling?) mushrooms on it for sure just has sliced crimini mushrooms. The crust was incredibly flimsy, and the pizza overall had little to no flavor. I make much better pizza at home, and I found myself wishing I was at Pizzaria Delfina... Hmmm.... delfina....

We had brought friends visiting from Australia and tried to go to Tony's but forgot they were closed on Tuesdays. Looked up places on yelp real quick, and wish we had opted for another spot.

Again- friendly and nice, but the food is totally sub par, especially considering SF has so many damn good pizza places. Will not be returning!
author: Kate V.

description: We found this place so disappointing. The pastas dishes were ridiculously tiny and not good. The pizzas were ridiculously thin. Everything was so small that we decided to have a second dinner at another pizzeria after spending $60 at that first ridiculous Baonecci restaurant. Will NEVER go again. I don't like to pay $$$ and have barely anything on my plate.
author: Maria C.

description: Best pizza in North Beach! Paper thin crust, bright veggies. I had not been in a while, and found that I still love this place. I had the pizza with zucchini and peppers. My husband had the Margherita. To start, we shared a salad Baonecci, greens with slices of pear. The atmosphere is casual and friendly. We sat outside, where they have just a couple of tables. The owners seem to know everyone who walks by, and they stop and chat. A real neighborhood feel.
author: Emily M.

description: We stumbled upon this restaurant one rainy Sunday afternoon and were amazed by the service and quality.  Incredible and authentic pizza (I got one with truffle oil and salami) and pesto pasta. We'll definitely be coming back here. Last time we tried to come here for dinner it was packed and we couldn't be seated until 10pm so make a reservation!
author: Sally S.

description:
Tasty Italian food. The lasagna was pretty okay, and the few pizzas were good. That being said, nothing flew my mind. 

The pear salad was pretty bland.

That being said - they were very nice to accommodate our reservation, especially when half the group was running very late! Service was on point.
author: K. D.

description:
This is seriously the greatest pizza I have ever had in my life. I prefer thin crust pizzas, and they're not kidding when they advertise this place as having the thinnest crust pizzas in the world - I would seriously like to see someone else make thinner crusts. 

I went here on a date with my girlfriend and we split two pizzas and took about half a pizza home. I forget what the first pizza was called but it was covered in prosciutto and they placed a chunk cheese on top that melted onto the hot prosciutto like butter. The second pizza was the unforgettable and unique contadina. Fior di latte mozzarella, parmesan, gorgonzola, and thin slices of pear on top. The pear may sound very unusual, and it is, but assure you that it's delicious and the sweet pairing with the gorgonzola works fantastically.
author: Tian X.

description:
I had an entirely pleasant evening at the bar.

The whole menu looks great, and the diners next to me had the pizza calzone, yummy looking!  I definitely want to go back for that.

I had the lasagna.  Tender, delicate layers of homemade pasta with meat &  bechamel sauce.  It was outstanding.  I at e the whole thing.

The atmosphere was cozy and the service was friendly!
author: Susan H.

description:
I've had pizza cooked by real neapolitans.  I've been educated in the art of eating pizza as street food, folding with each bite to ensure that not a spot of grease gets on your attire.  The pizza at BaoNecci is not as good as real neapolitan pizza.

But it's pretty darn close. And in this country, that's enough for a 5 star rating.  

Come here if you want the checkered tablecloth, thin crust pizza, cheap but drinkable house wine italian restaurant experience.  It isn't a fancy italian place.   It's a real italian place, no pretentions, no substitutions.  It isn't completely authentic, because it doesn't have to be, it's just true to the spirit, and for the most part, the taste of italian food.  That is, in the end, what matters, hence 5 stars!
author: Travis B.

description: Most delicious, well made lasagna I've ever eaten! Service was very prompt and the staff friendly. Call ahead though, this place fills up fast. We'll be back to this place soon!
author: Chris J.

description: Overall really good experience. Although I am a fan of thicker crust pizza, all the reviews of this cracker thin crust really intrigued me. The pizza was good. The bruschetta was way better.
author: Jesse D.

description: This restaurant is fabulous!  It is truly a classic North Beach experience.  It is a family operation mom does the cooking and the boys wait on the tables.  Not to be missed.
author: Harvey H.

description:
A friend who is fairly new to San Francisco was going to meet us for dinner on our first night in town.  I turned to Yelp for a good pizza place within walking distance of our hotel on Nob Hill.  We decided to meet at Caffe BaoNecci after the good reviews.

It was early(6P) but the place was empty.  Not a good sign.  I'm used to my favorite NY/Brooklyn places busy at any time.  

We got a table that smelled of urine and expressed concern to one another that this might be a "miss".  We decided to stick it out and ordered an antipasto platter and 3 pizzas.  All wonderful.  Very thin crust and approved by all.  

It got more crowded as we were there.  The service was good, the location was good, the pizza was good!

Thanks Yelpers!
author: Amy R.

description:
Wow.

This isn't even like your usual thin crust pizza - this is more like a crispy cracker with amazing things on it. The crust was like a what a water cracker would taste like if it was fresh and crispier. I had the 4 Stagioni and it was like having 4 pizzas in one.
author: Gee H.

description: The service was the worst. The place was empty so I asked if we could sit at a four top so we could sit side by side. He sat us down but then insisted that I set a cross from my partner. I told him but I wanted to sit by her side and he continued to make a fuss. He began to tell me if I did not move I had to leave. I stood up and walked out. I understand if it was crowded and there was people waiting to sit, but the issue was that it was completely empty. If you like over pretentious assholes this is your place.
author: Justin T.

description:
Whoa, sometimes you just have the perfect night.  We were visiting from Portland and dining with family.  Perfect combination of fun, food and family made this one of the top 5 dining experiences ever.  

The food was phenomenal, we ate and ate and ate, actually caught ourselves saying "yeah bring us another pizza!"

I cannot forget to mention....Cute Italian waiter.   When I told him I found them on Yelp, he asked me if i looked up "cute Italian waiter" and found them.  Well, here's to someone actually looking for a cute Italian waiter.  We found him!

Thumbs up all the way around.
author: Me E.

description: I recently ate here while in town for a Giants game.  I had no reservation, but the staff remembered me and got my group some seats.  The food was excellent as each and every time I've been here.  I love the thin crust pizza!!  It you are looking for a casual yet upscale place to enjoy some real Italian style pizza with a bottle of wine and nice service, go try this place.
author: David C.

description:
Cafe BaoNecci is a very cute family run restaurant --- and you can tell they've been making pizza for a long time.  The staff is friendly, and speedy, which seems appropriate for an Italian joint. The truffle salami pizza was perfectly cooked and covered in salty goodness. If you like thin crust pizza, they do it right here.  The salad was pretty good too. All very affordable.

Looking forward to trying more!
author: Roxane W.

description: Really like the pasta here (homemade noodles, excellent sauce), but didn't like the pizza too much.  The pizza was very average, so I'd recommend skipping.  However, the pasta is excellent and I'll definitely be returning for it.  We loved the arrabiata pasta - it was a little spicy and sooo good.  Excellent service.  Like most North Beach restaurants, it's very cozy inside but there are 2 tables outside that are perfect for a sunny day.  Dog friendly outside :)
author: Naomi P.

description: Refill for tap water is not allowed! The four cheese pizza was very crispy which is ok but at least put some damn layers of cheeses. $19 for what looked like an Italian nacho cheese serving? No thanks, it is overpriced. Avoid the place.
author: Laurent D.

description:
Great low-key spot for mouth watering thin crust pizza.

It's such a cute mom and pop, well FAMILY restuarant because their kids work there too! 

*No fancy decorations, just photos and posters and delicious food! 
*Very espresso cafe feel to the ambience and casual.
*The service was excellent. Their really nice and patient to translate all the things I don't know how to read i.e. the menu in Italian hahah. 

MUST TRY THE PIZZA CONTADINA; the pear pizza..yes! PEAR, the fruit. It's definitely me and my bf favorite and thinking about it makes us want to come back. It's thin slices of pear with gorgonzola and mozzerella... 
SERIOUSLY, ONE OF MY FAVORITE PIZZAS!

We also had the mushroom pizza and it, too, was amazing! 

Off to dessert: CHOCOLATE TARTUFO . 
oh my god... talk about eatting a legit homemade ferrero rocher! Need I say more?? 

Deeeeeliziosa!!!
author: Tiffany N.

description:
By far the most genuinely Italian Pizza I have ever had!  Cappuccinos are stellar, as well. Their warm and welcoming service was especially wonderful, I felt like I was in Mama Gambaccini's house ;) 

I will definitely be coming back soon.
author: Abraham L.

description: The prices were 50% higher than the quality of the food, which was okay but no more than that. Very noisy, we had to shout at each other to be heard.
author: David S.

description: This place cut corner with their food and fool their customers.  I ordered a pizza with half Monte Bianco and half Salsiccia e Taleggio. When the pie came out, it had no sight of prosciutto, only a few sprinkles of sausage. I asked the waiter how come there is no Prosciutto, he responded with "we sliced prosciutto into tiny pieces and put in between cheese. We don't put on the top of the pizza".  Baonecci, you just lost many many customers.
author: Anna Y.

description: We happened on this place in July 2014 and had a great time, so when we came back to the Bay Area in July 2015 we had to come back, and we were not disappointed.  It's family run and operated (by a family from Italy), and there is a nice, friendly, homey vibe, and the thin crust pizza is delicate and delicious.  Admittedly in 2015 our anchovy pizza was a bit on the salty side, but the mushroom pizza had no flaws.   I am looking forward to 2016.
author: Glenn S.

description: Outstanding!!!!! Arrabbiata sauce I've had - and I look everywhere!!!! Small but worth the wait - sat at the bar and conversed with the owner all night!!! Family owned and all work the business - must try!!!!
author: Beth C.

description: AMAZING!! Great chianti, amazing homemade pastas, unbelievable pizza - loved the mushroom arugula! They even had a big bucket of colored pencils for the kids. Bread is to die for too.
author: t p.

description: Delicious food - service was wonderful!  Pasta was cooked to perfection - Tiramisu was creamy and delicious.  Quaint place on the corner - will visit again, the next time we are in San Francisco.
author: Candace N.

description: My fav restaurant in SF.... My boyfriend and I go monthly and really like their mascarpone and prosciutto pizza, burrata cheese and tiramisu. Can't say enough good things!! Doesn't hurt to have a reservation as the place is small and can get very crowded.
author: Megan M.

description: Definitely a great place. Love the atmosphere and the pizza was fantastic. Definitely recommend getting a whole pizza for yourself. The crust is very thin and if you are even a little hungry you will need a whole one. The wait staff was attentive and the food came very fast. Highly recommend if you are willing to pay a little bit more for a great pizza.
author: Katie K.

description:
I was looking for great vegetarian cannelloni, and yelp directed me to this place.. I was not at all disappointed.. pretty delicious cannelloni, definitely gonna come back here again and again!!
I have discovered that the best Italian joints in North Beach are actually not directly on Columbus, but in one of the side lanes. Trattoria Contadina and now this place have me pretty impressed!
This place seemed to be owned and managed by a single Italian family who seemed to know a lot of the people in the relatively tiny seating area. Prices seemed pretty reasonable, and the food seemed pretty authentic. Ambience is pretty cosy and old-school italian-ey!
The cannelloni was really good! They give you 3 pieces which, with the bread, was pretty filling. They seem to have a whole vegetarian section in their menu, which is awesome!
author: Aditya M.

description:
Very good dinner
Eggplant parm done well, more sauce would have provided the extra taste it needed

Pizza very good if you like super thin crust, we do

Canoli was the only good one we have had outside ny.
author: DJ D.

description:
Came here on a girls trip to San Francisco from Texas. We stumbled in on the brink of starvation from walking the hills of the city all morning. We had narrowed down our pizza meal to Tony's or BaoNecci and were very pleased with our choice!!

The crust is perfectly thin and crunchy. I must admit I'm a thin crust girl all the way and this crust was right on the mark. We ordered two pizzas - the classic Margherita and the Monte Bianco. The Monte Bianco has deliciously salty prosciutto and a scoop of Mascarpone cheese in the middle. They were both simple and perfect!! We're sort of pizza purists and believe the fewer the toppings, the better the pizza and this is exactly what Caffe BaoNecci does.

The service was friendly and attentive and I loved hearing the owner and his family speaking Italian with each other and a table of customers. It was a great, laid-back atmosphere and we loved the visit! Will definitely return on our next trip to San Francisco!
author: Alyson R.

description:
Want to eat like you were in Tuscany but avoid the airfare, come here----Caffe Baonecci !!!  For those on Facebook, go to their site & see the inviting restaurant environment, photos of their family & friends(many in Italia) & some of the most delicious dishes prepared by Stefania !!!

I can't tell you my favorite plate made by Stephania because there are so many and she cooks for you as she does for her family. I really like her handmade long pastas, Tagliattelle, Pappardelle etc. made with eggs and from traditional Tuscan menus which accompany savory sauces like her Bolognese made like my Mamma did both with beef and pork. Also, I get very nostalgic with the Fagioli all'Uccelletto with cannellini beans, tomato sause, garlic, sage and sausage ( she adds this for me). I mention the pasta because Caffe Baonecci, and rightfully so, probably has the reputation as having the best pizza in the Bay Area but I wanted to tell you that the pasta is fantastic too.

The Master of the Kitchen is a native born Italian and I mention this because most Italian restaurants have Latins cooking and although trained by Italians, for me there is nothing like having a native born Italian cooking for you as she/he would for their families. They have also expanded so it is wonderful for a private party of 10-15 + and Stephania will cook dishes of your preference or she will recommend some and these are not on the menu. It's a perfect place for a Holiday party, birthday, anninversary etc. Try it, you'll like it, I promise you !!!



Non posso dirvi il mio piatto preferito che Stefania fa perché ci sono così tante ed ella cuoce per voi che cosa ella si prepara per la sua famiglia Amo particolarmente le paste lunge, tagliatelle, pappardelle etc., le paste all'uovo nelle ricette di cucina italiana tradizionale toscana che si accompagna magificamente a piatti dal sapore forte come la salsa bolognese fatta come mia mamma usata per fare con carne di manzo e di maiale. Ma veramente eo divento nostalgico con suoi Fagioli all'Uccelletto con cannellini fagioli, salsa di pomodoro, aglio, salvia & salsiccia(lei aggiunge per me). La nostra famiglia era povera e questo era il nostro pasto intero con una pasta piccola come ditalli, conchiglie etc e pane e insalata. Ho citato questi piatti di pasta, perché Caffe Baonecci e giustamente così, probabilmente ha la reputazione per la migliore pizza della zona della baia, ma ho voluto assicurare persone che i piatti di pasta sono fantastici troppo.

Qui c'è una maestra in cucina che è nativa nata italiana.
