La maggiore parte dei ristoranti italiani hanno latini in cucina e anche se addestrati da italiani, non è lo stesso di avere la Mamma in cucina cucinare apparentemente solo per te. Essi hanno ampliato qui e per una festa privata, 10-15 etc di più persone, Stefania cucinerà un piatto di sua preferenza o ella consiglia qualcosa fuori menu Pollo alla Cacciatora, Arrosti di Porco etc. e vi sentirete davvero come si stanno avendo cena a casa di Mamma. È un luogo preferiscono per una festa, compleanno, anninversary etc. Provatelo, piacerete, vi lo prometto!!!
author: Mando R.

description: Everything there is made from scratch including the pasta. The result is incredible food. We had the pizza and lasagna and we couldn't have been happier. What an excellent restaurant!
author: Nick D.

description: My friends and I enjoyed Baonecci very much.  The family-owners were charming, the service was great and the food was very tasty.  We will definitely be back.
author: Richard E.

description: The crust is so thin and crackles so satisfyingly. They should be open more hours and I wish it was less expensive but when I am in SFO area I always try to go. Rustica is my latest favorite.
author: Lisa L.

description: Great thin crust pizza. Toppings were fresh, crust with crisp. Fantastic service as well. Sit outside on a warm day, but make sure not to sit in the tables that tilt too much.
author: JP B.

description: If you like super thin crust pizzas, then you'll enjoy this place.  If you like soft, chewy crusts, go to Zero Zero.
author: Carol S.

description:
Amazing Italian food! The owners treat you like family but are very professional.

We had salads, mozzarella cheese was so soft and tender it melted in your mouth.

Pasta was spicy and delicious. Some of the best pasta I ever had. I haven't tried the pizza yet but will do next time I'm in town.

This is probably my favorite restaurant in SF so far. Highly recommended!
author: Sean H.

description: Very very good! The pizza is thin, just like they do in Lucca. Very authentic. The eggplant parm was outrageous; simple, fresh and packed with flavor. Good wine list. Slightly pricey, but outstanding italian food from the Tuscany region.
author: Rosie N.

description: Disappointed.  My dish was burnt on top as was my son's calzone. The prices were high considering the xize and quality of the meal.  WIll cross this one off my list
author: Sharyn S.

description:
Super noms. This little neighborhood joint turns out some great food. The prosciutto with shaved fennel was incredible. The pizza has thin, cracker-like crust and is fantastic. We got the buffalo margherita and the boar sausage pizzas. Highly recommend both, though the boar sausage was my favorite by a hair. Very reasonably priced wine list.

Reservations definitely necessary. We went for an early dinner on a Thursday night and saw multiple people with no reservations turned away at the door.
author: Karen P.

description: The thin crust pizza is AMAZING. i'm vegetarian, and there were quite a few options on the menu, and the staff was really accommodating in making adjustments to any of the meat options too. The pasta is delicious, too - we tried the arabbiata and it was excellent. Great food, great wine, and a really cosy atmosphere with lots of beautiful pictures on the walls.
author: Anusha B.

description:
My wife and and I absolutely loved this place. The atmosphere made us feel like we were back in Italy. We ordered a pizza and the eggplant parmesan and they were delightful. The pizza is nice and light but packs flavor. The eggplant parmesan was very filling and felt like comfort food . 

Great food, service, and atmosphere. Very romantic.
author: Ryan W.

description:
This place is the best restaurant in all of North Beach.

Its so good I ordered stuff to take out after I ate.

Screw these idiots giving this place 4 stars or less. Its not like Californians eat good Italian food. Lol!
author: Chastity C.

description: This restaurant absolutely blew me away when I was in SF for work. Everything from the salumi plate, through mains, to the dessert pizza was top notch.
author: Stephanie T.

description:
Yep. Amazing Italian style pizza. Ordered a ceasar salad that was incredibly fresh and had a house made dressing. The thin crust was obviously a house made recipe as well - the marinara had the perfect amount of sweetness. Couldn't have asked for a better thin crust.

We ordered two deserts (oink, oink), the first the almond pie which was fantastic! And the second was the truffle in the shot of espresso. 

Oh . . . my . . . 

Be prepared to fall in love.

It is a little expensive, but you're paying for quality - and it's worth it. Wish I lived here, I would be going once a week!
author: Stephanie B.

description: Fresh ingredients, great service, Real Italian. Try the Chianti,  4 generations, think about that.
author: Kim G.

description:
My husband and I were on vacation in SF, found this place on yelp and decided to give it a try based on reviews. They did not disappoint! We ordered the parma pizza, each bite was so tasty, I would definitely recommend it. Service was amazing as well.

It was the most authentic and delicious thin crust we had ever tasted that we decided to go 2 nights in a row. A bit pricey but so worth it!
author: Kristi G.

description: can't make a reservation which is a bummer as we were 8 people. So we waited an hour for a table. The food was delicious. Not cheap but yummy. Just wish one could make a reservation for larger parties....They make their money either way as they are so busy and don't really need a reservation system but still would be nice. The food was amazing and it is cozy and warm....
author: Viji V.

description: The staff was super friendly and recommended some good wine--we had a  bottle of 2009 Barbaresco--very tasty.  Balanced acidity and it opened up well.  We had one of the non-traditional pizzas--Truffle Salam--it was good but I would like to go back and try one of their more traditional pizzas.
author: Robert J.

description: Love this place! The venue is small and quaint, the pasta is usually great, and the pizza is amazing. I've had one inconsistent visit where the pasta was slightly overcooked but the pizza is always great. They do better with the more authentic Italian stuff whereas the lasagna might not be something I would order here.
author: Amy T.

description:
Pizza is a very personal, don't you think? From the thick and cheesy like the Chicago deep dish to thin Neopolitan style and everything in between, everybody has a favourite. But if you like 'em almost like cracker thin, you gotta come try Cafe BaoNecci.

It's an extremely simple restaurant with red and white checkerboard tables. My pizza has prosciutto and a dollop of mascarpone in the middle and it was to die for! I love what they offer in the menu; definitely not the regular Americanized pepperoni, sausage and bell peppers kind. Instead, you will find buffalo mozzarella, truffle oil, Italian tomatoes. It's different but they make them light and simple so that you can enjoy the crust with all the beautiful ingredients. That's what pizza is about.
author: Kwoky L.

description: Amazing food. If you are looking for an authentic italian experience in North Beach, Baonecci is your spot. The family is kind, and the food is delicious.
author: Kevin F.

description:
Here's another restaurant that I have to upgrade to FIVE stars (I previously gave them four stars but I think it's time to give them a perfect score!). It was a nice warm night in San Francisco and we couldn't pass up the chance of eating outside without freezing to death. Our meal was perfect. Loverboy kept moaning with each bite (and no!!! I wasn't giving him naughty treats during dinner....he was moaning from Foodgasms!) I wanna keep this hidden gem to myself but I think this business deserves to be in the spotlight.

Drink:
I ordered their strawberry prosecco and that was so refreshing. It wasn't extremely sweet and it was really fizzy.  It's way better than their peach bellini that I wasn't a big fan of.

Food:
The lasagna tastes really fresh.  You could tell that they made it to order and it is probably one of the best lasagnas I've ever consumed. The pasta layers were not too soggy and the sauce had the perfect balance of herbs and spices. It also had just the right amount of cheese which complemented the slightly sweet and tangy tomato sauce.

The truffle salame special pie is THE BEST PIZZA I've ever eaten in my ENTIRE life. I dare anyone to suggest to me that there's a better pizza out there (because I highly doubt it).  I'm sorry Tony's Pizza, but Caffé BaoNecci beat your version of a truffle pizza hands down.  The flavor of the truffle is more intense and I really like how they added arugula as a topping.  Loverboy and I both agreed that the flavor of the pizza reminds us of a forest.  Fresh, woody and clean.  The pizza crust was flavored and cooked perfectly.   You can tell (without checking out the kitchen in the back) that their pizza dough is made to order. We loved the pizza so much that we ordered a second one to take home since we were running out of room in our bellies.  The server was so happy to hear that we loved their pizza and he told us that this would make his mother happy (since she's the one who made it). I thought, "awww how sweet!!!!".

For dessert, we had the almond cake which was not too sweet (just how we like it) and it was the perfect ending to an amazing dinner.

Customer service:
The servers were very attentive and came back regularly to ensure that we had everything we needed.  They also were so approachable and didn't hesitate to strike a short conversation with us (without ignoring the other customers).  We were really impressed with their friendly demeanor and they made sure that our glasses were never empty.

I can't wait to take my parents here so that they can have a taste of THE BEST PIZZA EVER!
author: Shirleyanne A.

description:
you will not find a better thin crust pizza anywhere else.

Try the monte bianco pizza which is listed under "special pies" on their menu.
it comes with a heapy dollop of mascarpone cheese in the middle.
You smear this on top of the prosciutto and eat away.
Its not something you see everyday, but the salt from prosciutto, combined with the buttery sweet mascarpone will not betray you.  seriously.

of course, all the other pizzas I've tried here are fantastic.
but that monte bianco is so out of the ordinary that i must share it with you yelpers.

want pasta?
go for the lasagne or the pesto.
pesto actually tastes like fresh basil. not jarred mediocre stuff.

i wholeheartedly appreciate them for using such great ingredients, in great combinations.  thank you.

oh! i almost forgot.
if you need some appetizer, try the caprese with BURRATA.  not regular mozzarella.  ask for it if the waiter does not offer it to you.
HOOOLY.
author: Nat Y.

description:
Service: Atrocious.  So, so bad.

Four stars?

Pizza: Amazing.  So, so good.

I came to Caffe BaoNecci with my girls Liz H and Ricki S. and left about two hours later laughing at the terrible service.  This place gets busy on a Saturday night so we didn't mind waiting.  After waiting for half an hour (we were quoted 10-15mins) we were seated...and then ignored.

After years of experience playing the game Diner Dash I'm quite observant at service order - if somebody gets seated after me but then gets their order taken before me, those little hearts above my head go pop, pop, pop!  Definite pet peeve.

Needless to say, it was quite a while before anybody took our order.  We got the cheese tray, prosciutto pizza, pear & gorgonzola pizza.  After a few minutes, the cheese tray gets dropped off at the table, with maybe four slices of bread.  The waiter flew off before explaining what the cheese were, so we shrugged and just dug in.  For the price I was very impressed with the amount of cheese we got - I just wish I could tell you what the cheeses were.  They were accompanied with honey and a spicy currant jam (this was good!)

After those four baguette rounds were devoured we tried to flag down more bread...and got maybe four slices again, but this time in a basket!  After this bread was gone I gave up and just shoved cheese into my mouth with a butter knife.  Judge me all you want.

We finished the cheese and played my favorite game...waiting!  The couple next to us, who were seated after us but didn't order an appetizer already had their pizza.  And it smelled good.  After a few minutes they brought two pizzas to our table.  Yay! Oh wait..one was the prosciutto and the other was most definitely not pear and gorgonzola.  Solution?  Take both pizzas away and leave us sad and hungry.

So, while they're sorting that out we are still pizza-less.  Another prosciutto pizza comes out and finally, this one is for us!  We devour it.  It is amazing.  It is finished.  We wait another few minutes and the pear and gorgonzola comes out.  We devour it.  It is amazing.  I even devour the sticker on the pear.  JK I spent a minute or two peeling off the tiny sticker slithers.  A sticker won't kill you, but really??


A note on their wine: we tried both the house red and the house white.  Stay far, far away from the house white.  Red was pretty good!

Anywho, we wait another ten minutes before we can flag down our check. They are lucky their pizzas are so fantastic, it makes up for their laughably bad service!
author: Cathy Y.

description:
Unexpectedly fantastic.  Even though I live down the street I had not tried this place yet as I'm always leery of too many italian restaurants in the neighborhood.

However, when a group of friends from out of town suggested it, I checked it out.  Wow - It was really good - on all levels.

Service is fast and friendly.  You can see that it family run as the son took our order while the father was delivering the food.  We started with a carafe of house wine (and got two more) - solid start.

The caprese and caesar salads were both great.  The mushroom pizza was fresh and had an extremely thin crust.  The pasta al forno was fantastic and the puttanesca was extremely good.

Deserts were out of sight.  We got the tartufo, cannoli, and one other.

Highly recommended!
author: Sameer D.

description:
If you've ever read my reviews, you'll notice I almost never review Italian places. That is because the individual entrees served in American Italian restaurants is usually enough for a family and I'm not looking to eat 2000 calories in one sitting. That being said, the mere fact that I'm writing a review should say volumes of how good this place is. 

If you're craving Italian and don't want to eat two days worth of calories at once, come here for their thin crust pizzas. I went with three girls and we all had a different kind. And they were all delectable. 

The cheesiest, by far, was the pear and cheese pizza. It's thinly sliced pears nicely laid out on top of your pizza. 

I got the Quattro Stagioni and was surprised when the pizza they brought out was actually divided in four sections each with its own topping. Side note: the prosciutto was better than any prosciutto I've ever had in my life. Not exaggerating.
author: Iana I.

description:
A picky eater thinks this is fantastic food!

I don't want to hype it up too much but the food is authentic and very tasty. Hands down one of the best Italian food I've had. The pizzas are on a super thin, crispy crust. A bit pricey (expect to pay around $20 per entree). Portions aren't too large.

Highly recommended
author: Ryan P.

description: Excellent service (very helpful Italian waiters). Pizza is delicious. The only downside is that it is super loud when the little restaurant is full.
author: Angie W.

description: This place is awesome! Old World charm with a hip feel. Food is incredible and service is even better. Highly recommend the Nutella pizza for dessert.  Delicious!
author: Jim H.

description:
Excellent food! By far the best pizza I had in CA. The Margherita was the best. I thought the pasta was good but not best, my husband thought it was great. The spicy sausage calzone was good, but we both thought the pizza was better. 

The portions are small and the dishes are a bit on the pricy side, but worth every penny. Minus one star for the spotty service even though the place was almost empty for an early Saturday dinner.
author: TJ K.

description: My boyfriend & I love Baonecci!!   we ordered 2 truffle salame pizza , 2 lasagna & 1 Tiramisu.  Authentic italian food , even the price is little high, but we dont mind , Great service , Definitely highly recommended!! just hope they can open Sunday .....
author: Mocha K.

description: Great service, excellent food and environment. We loved our dinner there on the bar...
author: Ariel R.

description:
I found BoaNecci on yelp when we were looking for a thin crust pizza place. We have visited Italy and wanted something similar to the pizzas we had there.  When we first got there it was empty and a small place so we were having second thoughts about eating there but since we were starving we went in.  The service was good and they had italian accents and the entire experience was like we were in Italy. 
We had garlic bread and tried the pizza with Spicy san marzano tomato sauce, garlic, Italian parsley and the 4 formaggi pizza. We really liked the spicy tomato sauce and the pizza was very thin and crispy.  Possibly the best pizzas I have had in the bay area.  

I gave it 4 stars because we didn't try anything else but the pizzas, but I would definitely go back for the pizzas.
author: Dipu P.

description:
One of the best pizzas I have tried in my life. Very thin crust and extraordinary texture and flavor. Excellent service and truly authentic italian place.


We ordered the Montebianco pizza. 5 stars. I would love to go back and have it again. I thought it was a very original recipe and the combination of the cheese and the prosciutto was awesome.

We had for dessert the focaccina with nutella and fruit. I have to say that how the waiter described it didn't sound so compelling but as soon as we had the first bite we loved it.
author: Guillermo M.

description:
Stumbled upon this place after deciding not to wait 2 hours for pizza at Tony's.  
Couldn't be happier that I did.
Luckily it was early in the evening, and the rush hadn't hit yet.  The little restaurant filled up quickly after we were seated.  Next time I would get a reservation first. I think we got lucky with our table. 

The service was prompt. The menu straight forward and easy to understand.  And the food was amazing. 

My wife and I split a salad and a pizza.  Next time I may opt for a appetizer.  

The Stefania's salad was lightly dressed and very flavorful. The swiss cheese and apple slices were just perfect together.  It was also large enough to be an entree, and just perfect to split between two people. 

We also split a Salamino E Salsiccia (pepperoni and Italian sausage) pizza.  A paper thin crust, and maybe the creamiest mozzarella I think I've ever tasted.  

We capped the meal off with a couple of cannolis.  Again, they were perfect.  Not overpoweringly sweet, but bursting with flavor. 

The food was so good here that I want to go back and further explore the rest of the menu.  Someone at the table next to us ordered a calzone, it looked amazing.
author: Christopher Z.

description:
Great Italia style pizza.  The crust is thin and delicious.  You know you are in a real Italian joint when you see people visiting the staff are kissing cheeks...
If you want cheap pizza to fill you up, this is not the place for you. It is reminiscent of the eateries in Rome and Paris. For a European experience without the air fair, try this place.  The other plus, no waiting like Tony's around the corner!
author: T B.

description: The service was adequate, the Caesar salad was pedestrian, but the Pizza Rustica saved the experience.  Nice thin Neapolitan crust, slightly charred, Tuscan salami, mozzarella, and arugula.  World-class pizza.
author: Jack H.

description: Excellent menu, service and wine selection. Also was very impressed with the cost, particularly in San Fran. I'd recommend this and will visit again when we are in town!
author: Ryan M.

description: This place is absolutely fantastic. We loved just about everything food-wise. The pizza is on a very thin crust and is immensely deep in taste. If you come, I would definitely ask the waiter for suggestions; you will not be led astray. The cannoli was also delicious. The staff is friendly and generally attentive, but you will get more attention if you eat indoors. All told, an easy 5-star rating and well worth the trip.
author: Hunter N.

description:
I was smitten the first time I came here about a year ago but after taking my family when they were in town, my eyes were opened. The interior is just wonderful with the picnic tablecloths and one very attractive waiter (though I think he may be a little young) but the food is really just not up to par.

The caprese salad is pretty bland and I could probably make it better at home.
The thin crust pizzas appear nice, however are very underwhelming taste-wise. I've tried a few: Margherita, Contadina, Funghi, and Marinara Marocchina and all were simply OK.

Once a friend of mine asked which pizza spot I was going to in North Beach and when I told him BaoNecci, he simply responded with a head shake and a comment on a tourist trap. I now believe him.
author: Raina B.

description: Excellent pizza with wonderfully friendly and ++efficient services. Very light, but delicious tiramisu!  Tight space but worth it
author: Bob S.

description: Definitely a cute place in SF to grab pizza. I love the family that owns the restaurant too. We ordered the prosciutto and melon, as well as the salsiccia pizza with two beers. Food was great! It was a little crowded but it's definitely nice hearing those darling Italian accents :). I want to try more things on the menu next time!
author: Sheeva G.

description:
Caffe BaoNecci was our family's first stop in San Francisco. In Austin, I know everywhere i can take my almost 1 year old for dinner. In SF, I had to heavily rely on Yelp for dining suggestions. We still wanted to eat well, but it had to be kid-friendly. Our little one was a bit jet-lagged and ancy, so we opted to sit on the sidewalk to avoid annoying the other patrons. Fortunately, it was the perfect evening for dining al fresco!

Our waiter was amazingly friendly and excited to be waiting on our family, as well as the family next to us. For dinner, we began with a caprese salad (and a couple of glasses of wine!). My husband and I split the sausage and pepperoni pizza, which is the perfect size to share as long as you have an appetizer or something to go with it. And we couldn't leave without some dessert. The Coppa Raspberries and Cream was the perfect ending to our dinner. 

A very warm and welcoming environment, I'm sure we'll be back the next time we are in the area.
author: Allison P.

description: The food was delicious and the service was excellent! We had the lasanga, pasta al forno and our 5 year old loved her pasta with butter and cheese. Good beer selection, rare for an Italian restaurant. We'll be back!!
author: James L.

description:
I ordered the 4 stagioni pizza. Very very very good. I was beyond impressed. I LOVED the pizza. It was a bit expensive, yet I thought it was worth every penny. I thought the pizza was much better here than the pizza I had in Italy.
My friend ordered a dish. I don't remember what it was called but it was very small and the same price as my dish. She said it was really good, but a bit on the pricey end.

I really did enjoy my food, but the service was lacking. I went when it first opened at noon time. There was my friends and I and then two others. It wasn't busy.  

The food makes up for the service. I would go there again. The pizza brought me so much joy.
author: Marsea C.

description: My favorite Italian restaurant in the city. I was actually brought there by two italian friends. Both still say this is the best Italian in California, after +10 years living in the US.
author: Aleix V.

description: Fantastic restaurant all the way around.  Amazing food, classic ambience, and a lights out experience. On par with any dining experience you could ever desire. An Italian gem in North Beach.
author: Matthew C.

description:
BEST pizza in the city. Period. Everyone I've taken here absolutely loves it. 

It's a great sign when everyone in the restaurant is speaking Italian when we get in and the picture on the menu is the family that runs it. 

Get the Cantondina pizza, shaved pears above blue and gorgonzola cheese = delicious.  The desserts are also amazing.
author: Phillip K.

description:
Pros:
If you like thin crust pizza, then you have a home in BaoNecci. It is super-authentic Italian, down to the family that moved here to start the business. 

Cons:
The pizza is good, dont' get me wrong, but I was looking for a crispier crust thin pizza (hard to find), and this one just didn't blow me away even though it was very good.

Fun:
Ask the waiters for their stories of how they got to the US for some fun stories of trials and tribulations.
author: Mike G.

description:
I want to give this place 4 stars, but i really just have to bump it down to three.  our experience waiting for a table was pretty bad.

we got there and there were tables opening up outside.  i asked if we could sit outside and they said yes, of course, just give us a minute to clean it.  immediately someone went to clean the table but then disappeared for at least 20 minutes.  10 minutes later, he realizes he did not clean and set the tables and finally they were like ok your table is ready, please have a seat.

once we were seated, service was ok and food was good. we got the calzone classico and the eggplant parmagiana.  both dishes were pretty good though i thought a little overpriced.
author: Lisa C.

description:
MMmmmmm ciao Italia!  It is seriously the closest pizza to the ones I've had in Italy.  Super thin crust with fresh ingredients made to order!

I almost didn't make it back to my table when I walked through their kitchen to the restroom.  I just stared like a kid in a candy store.  The aromas or the rising crust, fresh herbs, and savory sauce made my mouth water.  I could not wait to try my pizza!

I wasn't too hungry, but managed to eat most of the pie :)

It had yummy proscuitto, mozzarella, and fresh marinara sauce.  I gobbled everything up and enjoyed it with a nice can of Limonata :D
author: Michelle S.

description:
What a diamond in the rough!

A friend brought me to this place for a quick and easy mid-week dinner. It seemed a bit "cheesy" (no pun intended) and Mel's diner-y, I was ready to suggest a slice of Golden Boy Pizza instead. Luckily, I was lured in with a quick glass of wine and the promise of tasty eats. 

Caffe BaoNecci is a gem and a down home Italian eatery. The menu is very limited but everything we had was delicious. We started off with some traditional antipasti, followed by burrata and arugula, followed by a lovely thin crust prosciutto pizza, and finished off with arrabiata pasta. Everything was very simple, but very well made.

I had the opportunity to meet the chef / proprietor herself - it was amazing what she could do out of her little kitchen.

On a regular day, I'd likely give this place 3.5 stars but after meeting the owner, 4 stars all the way. Her love is what makes this place spectacular!
author: Vivi T.

description:
If you've read any of my reviews, you know I'm a pizza snob.  I have declared that west coast pizza on the whole totally sucks.  But Caffe BaoNecci is really good.  Not the best I've ever had everywhere, but the best I've had in San Francisco.  Perhaps the best I've had on the left coast.  Very thin crust, excellent meats, the sauce is right, it's all great.  It's the kind of pizza that must be eaten very quickly, because it's only amazing when hot.  The staff here is excellent, they know their stuff, service is efficient, and they speak Italian.  The space is small, not pretentious or crazed, just a stellar little pizza spot that does it right.

Highly recommended by a pizza snob who's eaten the best of the best in Naples, Boston, New Haven, Chicago.
author: Chester H.

description: Really??? Walked in at 8:15 when there were a number of open tables. Everything else in the neighborhood was overflowing. We were told all of the tables were reserved. Yeah right. Host was just a jerk who didn't want to do any work for rest of night. We live nearby but won't be back. Much better options and once there is any kind of downturn these guys will be out of business.
author: Julieana A.

description: I don't get the rating. I tried the Parma pizza and wasn't impressed at all. Did I order the wrong thing? I came for lunch one day and it wasn't busy but took a bit of time for it to come out. Unfortunately, I left wishing I had waited for Tony's (better pizza) or even Golden Boy (better value).
author: Rachelle T.

description:
This is really casual, small spot in North Beach.  Decor and tables are very Italian, servers are I think directly from Italy! After reading so much about  their pear pizza I ordered that, it was really really good: salty and creamy from the cheese, sweet from the pear, it was simply delicious, and I have been craving that for a while now.

We also got the mozzarella tomato salad and it was really good, too.
Good prices, good service.
author: Bailey H.

description: Amazing!! A must go In little Italy. Doesn't look like much from outside but great on inside and they have TV  for World Cup. Pizza was amazing and Burrata salad was the best I've ever had. There's a reason why it almost have 5 stars, it's great. I would definitely come back.
author: F H.

description:
Cafe Baonecci is an ideal place to go to for lunch on those nice sunny afternoons. Seating outside under the warm rays...or if you like some shade jus head inside instead and enjoy the nice decor.

The pizza here is great...i love deep dish pizzas and never really enjoyed thin crust all that much. But BaoNecci really changed my mind. The Proscuitto Parma...delicious! Ah the mozzarella with the thin slices of proscuitto..and the crunchy thing crust..delicious..

I've also had the lasagna..very very good..nice layers of cheese meat and sauce..very nice. It may not look that big but its actually quite filling..

Enjoy with a glass of white and your lovely afternoon would be quite complete..
author: phillip w.

description: Perfect pizza. Esp the monte bianco. It's so transcendent that your mind will be open on your first bite. I travel for work and this is a must stop every single time I'm I'm town
author: Kien T.

description: What a great family run restaurant! Truly run by the Gambaccini family!  The restaurant had a cheese plate and had an antipasto (cold cuts)  plate,  but unlike the yelp menu which had a combo.  My wife wanted the opposite but didn't want to order both.  When asked if they could give us half half,  they checked and said they could.  Score!  Instant Taglerino di antipasto y du fromaggi (I probably butchered that one) . And it was very tasty and the right amount to kick things off.  My wife had the Tagliatelle di bolognese (not on the yelp menu,  but was on the menu there). Great fresh made pasta and sauce.  I had the Salamino piccante y Salsiccia.  It was great.  I particularly likes the very thin crust,  which is my personal preference.  We had tiramisu which was great.  She had a cappuccino and I had an expresso.  Great meal!! Definitely recommended! Friendly service from the family!!
author: Andy W.

description: The truffle salami was the best pizza I have ever had. You could tell the salami was homemade. My boyfriend and I shared the pizza and the pear salad, which was nice and light. We also got a bottle of wine and ended with tiramisu, which out waiter, who I think is the owner, said his wife made the night before. It was the lightest $95 meal we have ever had, but arguably the best.  I felt like I was in Italy it was so authentic. I will be coming back the next time I an in SF.
author: Brittany B.

description: Sat down and we were handed menus. Place was empty but server never came, then when my wife went to ask if we could order they intentionally ignored her. So we walked out.  What assholes. So for all the reviews about the food we will never know...and never come back. No stars for you jerkoffs!
author: Ron G.

description: Best.  Pizza.  Ever.  No kidding.  This family owned and operated restaurant is the best pizza in North Beach if not California.
author: T. L.

description:
So a large group of us came here for dinner the other night. I have to admit my initial thoughts before we got here were...  it is going to be the over the top, in your face, pizza place. But it's actually quite a chill place and you know what they serve ?? Pizza.  :) Not super greasy, or stale topping or puffy crust, burned or nasty pizza. It was thin crust, a little flaky, tasty and at the same time you could fold it without losing anything. I wasn't covered in flour after either. I was happy with this place. I think my favorite was the prosciutto and cheese pizza. I am a sucker for prosciutto on a pizza. Finally I have found a good pizza place in SF.  Or maybe this is just the start of many ... I hope the latter because I know I will get bored quick.

Desserts here are good too. Dessert Pizza is a genius idea of dough with nutella and a bunch of fruit on top. pretty good. I will be back :) My only draw back for this place is it was a little pricey for pizza.
author: Greg G.

description: My first visit to this place did not disappoint. I love the laid back atmosphere and walking through the kitchen to the bathroom! Ha. We had an assortment of pastas that were all very good. The margherita pizza, while fresh and tasty, had a super thin crust that was even too thin and cracker like for this thin crust fan. Baonecci is a great spot for a good, authentic Italian meal at a reasonable price
author: Mark N.

description: The food was very mediocre.  And way overpriced for what it was.  The eggplant parm tasted like it was made 2 days ago and reheated in the microwave (cheese was rubbery).  The pasta bolognese was very bland.  Would have understood if this was a $7/dish place. But the entrees were $20.
author: Melissa H.

description:
Love it!

Totally low-key, family run, amazing little place.

The pasta - meh.

Pizza and salads are where it's at!

Burrata salad & every pizza I have had here were excellent.
author: David R.

description: Thanks to Yelp for steering us to this authentic and unpretentious family-run Italian place in North Beach.  Mama Stefania and papa Walter are the real deal - from Lucca in Tuscany with old family recipes and their sons and other family members. The lasagna is the best I have ever had - with it's silky soft noodles, creamy ricotta and perfectly tangy/salty bolognese. The thin crust pizzas are fantastic - especially the Monte Verde and the salami. Prices are reasonable and the atmosphere is very welcoming. This has become one of our new favorites in San Francisco.
author: Nick D.

description: Great atmosphere at this small restaurant, I had a pizza that was basically a margarita with capers and a glass of Lambrusco , very good.....the staff was awesome ,the 3 of us walked in with no reservations but we were able to sit at the bar area and that was perfect, I will definitely come back
author: Michael S.

description: This is a marvelous Italian hole in the wall type place. The pizzas are excellent and so is their house pasta. The eggplant parmigiana was one of the lightest we have tasted. Great, quiet atmosphere and wonderful host.
author: Gopi V.

description: Amazing pizza, pasta, bread, service, etc. Somewhat pricey.
author: Eliza D.

description: Food is good, probably a solid 3.5. But it is way too pricey for what you get. Each pie is roughly $20 and serves one person. We ordered two pies, a lasagna and one app (and no wine) for wife and two kids under five to share and dropped about $100. Left annoyed and thinking each dish should be $5 less each.
author: Tana S.

description: Margherita pizza was ok, but NOT worth the wait. Kill me please. Took 15 min to get someone to take my order and thirty min to get one paper-thin pizza. Probably takes 7 minutes to cook a pizza that thin if you had to warm the oven. They killed it. Good pizza. I like it thin, but I hate to wait 30 min for it. Go to the next spot if you're hungry now or in the next 15 min.
author: Zorik D.

description:
Some of the best pizza I've had this side of Italy. 

And the owner's sons are SO STINKING CUTE you'll stare at them inappropriately for the duration of your meal. 

If that's not reason enough to go, I don't know what is.
author: Vonetta Y.

description: One of my favorite pizzeria in SF. The service is very high-level and the ambient so italian. A must !!
author: Thibaut L.

description: Best Italian Restaurant Ive ever been to! Amazing cosy family atomsphere. Try the burrata and the truffle salami pizza. SICK!
author: Athanasios E.

description: The food was very good. Prices were good. BUT service was mediocre at best! True Italians, in no hurry to get you out of there or serve you! Small place, just about 8 tables. The desserts are killer.
author: Kim B.

description: Best Pizza I've had outside of Camaiore--amazing!  Authentic family owned pizzeria with family-style service
author: Raymond B.

description: Quaint little hidden gem of an Italian restaurant.   My husband and I had the BEST Bruschetta we've ever had in our life!  The toast was crispy and so very tasty!  Lots of LOVE in their pasta & food!  Would recommend to all our friends traveling to North Beach area.
author: Deanne D.

description:
Made a day trip to SF, up from Orange County.  Walked from SoMa out here, which is always an enjoyable thing but particularly on a spectacular sunny day.  Great views of Alcatraz, Transam etc. nearby.

I came in just as they opened for the evening and was able to chat with the team about their history and different food items and wines.  The food was simply stupendous, with the second best salad I've ever had (Baonecci with pears). Bread like nothing we get in OC (eat it fast while it is still fresh and hot). Truffle salami pizza, which I had them spice up slightly.  Wow, great stuff.  And then a perfect canolo. I couldn't send a pic of that to my wife after several others; she would have hated me since she was having a hot dog for dinner.  Will be suire to bring her here when back.

I watched as the place filled mostly with locals, and then, highly satisfied, I caught a some views as the sun settled and headed back to the OC.
author: Scott C.

description:
Excellent Italian style (thin-crust) pizza!

Great service, family owned... and it doesnt hurt that the owners (son) is easy 
on the eyes! (haha)

Love this place!
author: S. M.

description:
Who doesn't love pizza??  I mean, even bad pizza is pretty good.  But this place really know good thin crust pizza.  I'm not a person who generally complains about the price of food, but I wish that they had given more porcini mushrooms on the pizza.  I mean, it was a few slivers and the pizza was close to $20.  Even so, the crust was great and it seems like a family owned pizzeria.  My wife did see them reheat some lasagna in the microwave as she went to the ladies room [you have to walk through the kitchen].  Not saying that it's not fresh or that it's frozen, just thought that it wouldn't be heated up with a microwave.  Just saying.

Very friendly staff and the service was good.
author: Del C.

description:
4-1/2 stars!  I feel bad for lowering the average but I'm a tough grader.  

This is a great place.  Like others I came here after whiffing at Tony's, which is closed on Mon-Tue.  The pizza here was very thin and slightly crispy, but not too dry or crumbly as thin crusts can be if not carefully done.  Nearly perfect.  This is a family run and worked business, and their care shows.

The Burrata Insalate was a very nice accompaniment. The chocolate tartufo for dessert was outstanding!!  The place is small, so reserve a table or arrive early and take your chances.  It was as authentic an experience as you can get without going to Italy.  Half a block east of Tony's and better.
author: Trent H.

description:
Gotta love an Italian place that's run by real Italians. I ordered the caprese salad, and I swear, I am 100% sure that I was pronouncing it correctly, but the guy stared at me like I was speaking Greek, and then I pointed to the menu and he said "OH! Caprese!!" and I just thought...yes...exactly as I said. But who knows, I definitely don't speak Italian.  In any case, the caprese salad was excellent :)

We also ordered a pizza, which was beautifully thin and flavorful. I'd come back for sure.
author: Erin P.

description:
Raves about the Contadina are all true.  It looks amazing on the plate, and tastes delicious on the palate.

I had a calzone, which my companions told me would be a mistake, but I had to be a rebel.  That in itself didn't disappoint, though.

Of course we all sampled each other's plate, and I thin the Contadina won.

Two of us had mushrooms on ours, and we came to the conclusion separately:  they tasted canned.  

Having heard such great things about this place, we're certainly ready to give it another try, though :)
author: Ken B.

description:
Disappointing, bland, overpriced. $50 got us one glass of wine, one flavorless pizza (prosciutto, mozzarella, and mushrooms), and 5 pieces of caprese salad. The pizza was soggy in the middle but had hardly any cheese or tomato sauce - there are several places in my small Midwestern city that do better thin, brick oven style pizza than this place. The caprese was also pretty lame - a few pieces of shredded basil that lacked flavor, bland tomatoes, and blah mozz.

I will say the bread they brought was delicious and the wine was good. The service was very friendly but it took forever to get water and they had to be asked to refill it. All in all, we were really disappointed given the reviews. Even in SF you should be able to get a delicious meal for $50. Value- and food-wise, this place just does not live up to the hype.
author: Kelly R.

description: Authentic food, great atmosphere, and wonderful family owned place.  Yum! You need a reservation unless you want to sit at the small bar but it is worth it.
author: Corey K.

description: Amazingly friendly staff, they are all part of the family that came over from Tuscany.  A little place tucked away in North Beach with five-star Italian food.  We have not tried their pizzas but we have had almost all of their appetizers and their pastas, lasagnas, cannellonis, and it is all so very good.  We will be back over and over and over again!
author: Sailing A.

description: So delicious. This might be the best pizza we've eaten in SF. Service was wonderful, and it feels like a classic North Beach type of place. Small and intimate. The salad we had was incredibly fresh, and we raved over the pizza.
author: L C.

description:
I adore this cafe... I really wish we could of sat down to eat but we were in such a hurry we had to order to go. Pizza is excellent, I've never had pizza like this. Very very thin crust, with not too much sauce. I got the Caprese pizza and it had thin slices of tomato and basil. Spent close to $40 for 2 pizzas. You definitely have to eat this food right away. By the time we got home my husbands pizza didn't taste as good as mine did in the car:) I cannot wait to go back and sit outside and enjoy the ambiance and some Italian wine. What a cute little neighborhood this is. Will definitely be back.
On a side note, my husband loves pizza and he didn't like this place. He likes the really thick crust with tons of toppings so if that is the pizza you like you might not be a fan.
author: Dee L.

description: This restaurant is the gem of the North-beach neighborhood. We celebrated my husband's birthday and they gave us a nice room used for private parties. The food was the best as usual. If you decide to go there make sure you have their antipasto with salame and prosciutto. Their pasta is always cooked "al dente" and to perfection and it's all home made. The pesto is made by chef Stefania using only local grown basil. The pizza is amazing...My favorite one? I don't really have one. I have tried almost all of them and I loved them all. However if I really must pick one I would say the dessert pizza with Nutella and fruit. This sweet version of a pizza is something you won't find anywhere around! The wine selection made by owner/sommelier Walter was the perfect pairing for the whole dinner. Thanks to Baonecci Restaurant... we had a wonderful celebration and fun all evening. They even allowed us to stay there a little bit later than the regular time. Actually the owners decided to sit  and have the dessert with us. Thank you again Walter and Stefania...see you soon!
author: E.M. E.

description:
I thought this place would be way better based on the yelp rating. The Pizza was fairly good.... but nothing outstanding.  The variety of options were nice, but the ingredients did not seem exactly high end or fresh, which I would expect out of a family run establishment. I did like the way the pizza was cooked and the crust though.  I did not care for the lasagne, just didn't do it for me whatsoever.   

Service and the "italian family atmosphere" was pretty real up in the spot. I really dug that aspect of it. for a pure campiness factor, it was good...i'm a fan of family owned joints like this. 

I did like being able to walk into the kitchen on the way to the bathroom, lots of italian ingredients and you see how much of a mom/pop shop it really is (in a good way).
author: Eric t.

description:
Disclaimer - I know the people who work here.

This one is REAAAAAALLY close for me.  It's maybe a 4 star place but what pushes me over the edge to a 5 star review is that my one thought was "this food really reminds me of Italy" so call this a homer 5 star review.  If you have never been to Italy and don't really care about that (READ: pizza snob disclaimer (sorry!)) or just can't empathize or actually enjoy what I call crappy California pizza, then you might want to cut a few stars off this review for yourself.  I recently got back from Italy (Sorry! I'm being snobby again aren't I? woooo, I've beeeen to I~taly :P) as well and got to eat at some award winning pizzerias (really overdoing it, aren't I?).  If you have been to Italy and eat here, you will know what I am talking about!  For that magical transportation, they get full ranks from me.  This is authentic pizza here.  I will actually say that their pizza was better than some of the places I ate in Italy (naturally the award winners still rank highest for me (I'm just full of it here)).  The pasta dishes are good but I recommend just sticking with the pizzas.  If you can go in a big group, you can also try different types of pizza a la family style.

Similar to my pizzetta 211 review, I feel like I should make a few comments on pizza.  If you don't like thin crust pizza, don't go here.  if doughy crust , stuff crust, deep dish, Sicilian style pizza is your bag, come with realistic expectations.  My brother has a theory that we all love the pizza of our childhood.  Growing up in New York, I've always had a soft spot of bubbly thin crust, saucy, cheese sliding off, fold-it-in-half so you can eat it pizza so I am definitely particular to that style of napoletana pizza.  Cheers!
author: Nat L.

description:
Some of the best pizza in the City!

this sweet little cafe gets great sunlight on sunny days and is just off the beaten North Beach path enough to avoid most of the tourist crowd.  

and did i mention the pizza is some of the best in the city?
author: Lauren J.

description: Great food. Great servers. Great ambience. -1 star for the somewhat awkwardness that goes with walking in and immediately feeling like you're on top of the restaurant unless someone immediately comes over to see if you booked a reservation. Cool place.
author: Michael H.

description:
Caffe BaoNecci is such a hidden gem.  We used to ONLY go to Tony's but once we found BaeNecci, we were hooked.  The Pizza Rustica is our #1 pick.  At that price point (~$18), it's a toss up whether it's really a "good" value, but either way, sometimes it's nice to mix things up and eat at BaoNecci.  With it's intimate atmosphere, tasty thin crust pizzas and eclectic decor, BaoNecci is a great find! 

p.s. BYO Bottle of Wine!
author: Renae K.

description:
I came here for a friend's birthday - the pressure was on - it was up to me to choose an Italian place in the area.  So of course, I consulted Yelp.  This place had the best rating.
 
The inside is very cute.  If you're looking for something fancy, this isn't the place for you - this is more of a homey place with an authentic Italian feel.  The tables are pretty close together (had I sneezed, I would have contaminated my neighbor's calzone), with adorable little checkered tablecloths.  Italian flags adorn the walls, as well as photos of Italy.  The best part is that to get to the bathroom, you get to walk through the kitchen, and see the magic happen first hand. 
 
Okay, onto the food.  It came out relatively quickly, which was great - we were in a huge hurry unfortunately, and didn't really have time to enjoy everything like we wanted to.  We decided to get the four cheese pizza and pesto pasta, and split them.  The pesto was good - I'd give it 3.75 stars.  It was tasty, but I've had better pesto.  It could have used a pinch more garlic.  And I don't think it had pine nuts - all of the best pestos I've had (i.e. my mom's) have had plenty of pine nuts.  The pizza was great - I'd give that 4 stars.  Paper thin crust, delicious sauce, and you could taste the different cheeses.  There weren't tons of menu options, but there were enough.
 
This is somewhere I'll come back to one day, but need to explore North Beach a little more first before I make it a go to spot.
author: Ashley M.

description:
A word of warning - and this is not at all reflected in our review because it's beyond their control - parking around this neighborhood can be a real B.  Luckily there's a parking garage on Stockton right around the corner.

After reading the reviews of this place, and deciding what we really wanted for dinner was some delicious pizza, we chose this place for dinner.  The descriptor for two stars - "Meh.  I've experienced better." sums up our experience last night in a nutshell.

We ordered the porca pizza and a salad to share.  There was no word of warning from our waiter that the pizzas were individually sized, but after we ordered we saw other peoples' pizzas coming out and put two and two together on our own.  That was a minor gaffe, though.  The pizza itself...the dough at the middle of the pizza felt a bit gooshy and undercooked.  It was severely underwhelming, and even their prosciutto lacked the strong flavor I was expecting.

The salad was also very bland, with shredded carrots and onions atop what I can only assume is a premade mix of spring greens that was not very well washed before it came to our table.

For these bland dishes, a glass of the house wine and a cappuccino, we were charged $45 before the tip.  We left still feeling hungry and extremely disappointed.
author: Sadaye M.

description:
Authentic Italian pizza. After coming back from Italy, I didnt know if I would be able to find the same pizza I had there in the states! Most places with the thin crust arent thin like this. 

My favorite is the Napoli pizza, which includes capers and anchovies, and also the Contodina pizza, which is an amazing combination of melted cheeses, with thinly sliced pears on top. Its a gorgeous pizza to look at, and also wonderful to eat. These two are the most unique pizzas to me, and they are representative of how good this place is. All the pizzas are light, tasty, and will leave you full without feeling gross like most pizzas will. 

This is a family owned restaurant, and the owner is very nice and treats all his customers like his own family. I went on a Saturday around 1pm, and there were still one or two tables left in the place, but it filled up pretty quickly. It is a rather small place, but I've seen groups about 5-6 people and they were able to accomodate them easily. If you are looking for a place with good food in a touristy neighborhood this would have to be it. It also seems like a good (and impressive) place to take a date!

 It has a lot of hype due to the fact that you cannot get this type of pizza anywhere, with these quality ingredients, atmosphere, and customer service. Yes, you can go to North Beach pizza down the street, or any of the other tourist-based 'Italian' places on Columbus, and get what most people expect out of food: to be grossly full with bad food. Or, you can walk the extra block or two, and go here.
author: Mary K.

description:
UPDATE!!!! They renovated the place, it's bigger with a big flat screen TV. WOW! Now my whole family can fit in it.

I still love their polenta, BEST EVER! and their cafe moka, caprese, and pizza just to name a few. Love it love it love it!
author: Cristina D.

description:
My best friend and I were in the city for the morning and were looking to find a restaurant that was on our way to crossing Golden Gate home. I found this restaurant on Yelp, and we decided to give it a try. It was a beautiful April day, and we were able to snag one of the few tables outside, being form Canada, it was so great to be eating outside in the Spring. 

I ordered the Mushroom Pizza. It was delicious, as everyone has mentioned, it has the thinnest crust I have ever seen on a pizza. The pizza was also full of mushrooms, which were yummy. I believe my friend had a panini which he loved. 

For our drive home, we grabbed some Florentines to  go, which were gooey and delicious and just the right size for a lunch time dessert.
author: Vanessa J.

description: my kids and husband devoured everything here. seriously the best, authentic italian pizza we've had. almost crepe thin crust wood fired to perfection. try the arugula prosciutto pizza with shaved parmesan. it doesnt have the typical melted mozerella cheesiness. just so light and amazing. kids loved the sausage cannelini bean appetizer so much they were licking their plates. who knew they liked beans??? u need reservations here as they were turning away ppl at the door even at 930.
author: Susan C.

description:
I first learned of Caffe Baonecci from a bartender @ Castello Di Amorosa while visiting Napa, CA; she raved it so much. I'm always game for trying to find a great pizza and Italian restaurant. So my wife and I gave it a shot. Caffe Baonecci did not disappoint. Not only is the service good and very friendly, but the pasta and the thinnest pizza I've ever ate rocked. 

I'm rating it four stars because of the price. As good as the pizza, the twelve inch pie costs $18. Ouch. It's a steep price to pay, but worth it. 

My wife and I ordered the salami pizza with truffle oil and arugula. The flavors melted in your mouth and the saltiness of the salami was amazing. The crust is very thin and it worked very well. We also ordered the special of the day and it was very good. It was a penne pasta dish with ground pork and ground beef. This was authentic Italian, folks. Not only was it very good, but my wife gave it a rave review. The pizza is very thin and is solid. 

The people who work there are very friendly. It's a real neighborhood place. Stefania our waitress was so friendly and accommodating and she treated us like family. Little did we know, that we were actually chatting with one of the owners. If you're looking for an authentic Italian restaurant, I highly recommend Caffe Baonecci. I know and my wife and we'll definitely be back.
author: Albert B.

description: We came here for Valentine's day and had a great meal. We started with a cheese plate, and all 4 cheeses were fantastic. We shared the truffle salami pizza, which is unlike any other pizza I have ever had. The only part of the meal that wasn't flawless was the  Calzone Farcito. The flavor was spot in but there was way too much liquid, which made the crust soggy. I was disappointed by it, especially after enjoying the pizza so much.
author: Diana G.

description:
4 1/2 stars for this modest store with amazing pizza.  Thank you fellow yelpers for recommending this place.  My dining companion had not been to the Bay Area for 15 or so years and he was hankering for thin crust pizza.  Baonecci did not disappoint.  We were torn between the prosciutto pizza and the truffle salami special of the day.  The waiter kindly offered to let us do as 1/2 & 1/2.  Both were wonderful.  The salami was delicious, but both of us gave the slight edge to the prosciutto which had a saltier bite which paired well with the arugula topping.

Be warned that the pizza is not large and has a super thin crust, so it will not fill you up like a slice of Golden Boy's pizza (thick, doughy crust dripping with topping) and located a few door down, but this is quality thin crust.  This is the real deal.  If you love thin crust, go to Baonecci.  Next time I am in the Bay area, I will return!
author: CJ C.

description: The margarita pizza had a authentic Italian thin crust and was very tasty. It was about $15 and I though it was a bit overpriced considering I could make the same pizza at home for about $4.
author: Amanda O.

description: Amazing pizza!  I felt like I was back in Italy enjoying traditional pizza.  The dessert selection is also amazing.  My favorite pizza place in the city.
author: Yvonne M.

description:
Caffe BaoNecci is all about going back to the basics: it's a simple little family run restaurant with a simple menu featuring pizzas with simple toppings.  When you can't drench your pizza in heavy sauces, you are forced to use quality ingredients.  You taste the crust, the mozzarella, tomato sauce and basil, each individually, and then harmoniously together.  

Claim to have the thinnest crust in the city, pizzas do come in a small size of 12" and almost paper thin, barely holding the toppings together.  Four slices can vanish within minutes.  So don't plan on sharing, unless you are doing it for the sake of sampling different flavors. 

Other than the Marguerita pizza, we also got the one with prosciutto.  Also delicious, and especially divine if you like cured, thinly sliced meat.  

We shared a cannoli at the end of dinner which was just alright.  Nothing exciting. 

Price can be more expensive than you thought, since the decor is very simple---suggesting a more humble priced menu.  But pizzas run between $15 and $20 each, and they aren't big. 

Service is friendly and efficient.  Room is quickly filled with people, so do come early.  Some article on the wall says that they host movie nights where you eat family style for $30 each and watch a movie together.  Another charming note of this restaurant.
author: Candice B.

description:
I had some of the best pizza of my life here, and I've been to Italy! Thin crust, very minimal ingredients, but absolutely AMAZING.

The place has a very European vibe, small tables, that kind of thing. We went on a sunny Saturday afternoon and there were hardly any tables left inside or outside. Nevertheless it was such a great experience. Definitely a must any time I'm near North Beach!
author: Isabelle M.

description: Went to BaoNecci on the recommendation of my buddy that works in the area. He was right on, it was great. My buddy and I both had the lasagne, it was delicious. Would highly recommend this cozy, family run restaurant to anyone. Gonna take the wife next time.
author: Tommy L.

description: We went to BaoNecci hoping to have a nice goodbye meal after a couple days in SF. We had no reservation but they were really nice and made us some space in the bar. We ordered pasta, and although itself was good, the sauce was too salty on both and the arrabiata was too spicy. We complained but the guy said "next time we will make it better". I'm not sure there will be a next time. I'm sorry to say that this place was a disappointment.
author: Adelaida A.

description: Where do I begin, if you're starving get the lasagna, but I would suggest that you try another restaurant and I will explain why, When we came in...there were 2 to 3 tables available and they told us that we had to have a reservation, however, two girls came in and they sat them down without a reservation. We we asked if we could sit outside because we saw the great reviews about the food. Like I said the lasagna was great & we also ordered a Quattro formaggio pizza and pasta Pomodoro. This review is based on the pizza and the service. The pizza  was not worth $18.95 and it was a complete disappointment. I could take a flour tortilla and sprinkle cheese on it and it would've been the same. The service was nonexistent. When I asked about why they didn't come out to refill our waters he said you only get one serving of water. Not sure if that's a San Francisco thing, but being that we ordered three plates of food I think you could refill our tapwater thank you.
author: Kim Y.

description:
LOVE LOVE LOVE!
we came here tonight.  the food is simple and made perfectly!!!   every dish ordered amongst the four of us was wonderful.  and the service was great.  thank you baonecci.  you are a wonderful gem.  i look forward to coming back.
author: Laura K.

description: Best pizza in SF.  truly Italian style pizza.  Friendly family run business
author: James R.

description:
Puts hipster Delphina to shame.

this is the real deal.

Try the Margherita Pizza.
author: Nigel F.

description: Best pizza in SF.  The crust is like a cracker and the cheese is fresh and full of flavor.   The burrata in the salad is like butter.  Friendly service.  Heaven!
author: Sue Ann M.

description: Wanted to like the monte bianco a lot more - I think my expectations were probably too high. Still really enjoyed the pizza and mozz app...this one pizza just didn't meet the hype. Should prob be 4 stars because it was solid - but not has hyped as yelp ranks it in my opinion. Maybe I need to return! (Also, thought it was a good value for NB).
author: Sean S.

description:
My rating would definitely be 5 stars but after we saw our check, we were astounded. $60 for LUNCH? I mean, the pizza was good but it was a personal sized pizza for ~$20. That's a pretty steep price. I mean, the pizza was amazing, it tasted great but would I pay $20 again for a personal sized pizza? Probably never again. The salad (Barrata) was also delicious. We had one espresso and one cappuccino and two beers. But for lunch, that is a steep price to pay. I could get much cheaper pizza that tasted just as good in NJ/NYC.

The price range should really show $$$.
author: Patty G.

description:
Anyone who seeks out homey, authentic feeling restaurants has to check out this pizza place. Having transplanted from the east coast, I'm well versed when it comes to delicious pies and Caffé BaoNecci makes'em top notch. 

This feels like a clean and quaint hole-in-the-wall full of Italian speakers or those just in to catch a futbol game (always showing on the giant screen mounted behind the register). You know you're getting the freshest ingredients if they're willing to let you traverse the kitchen to get to the bathroom!

Sip on a Peroni, indulge in your porcini pie and listen to the adorable Italian family buzzing around taking orders. Great place to feel like a local, even if you're not.
author: Monica S.

description: This truly is my new favorite pizza spot! A very small place so you will want to make a reservation. This place is just simply perfect!
author: Steve S.

description: Authentic in every sense of the word!!! We had the truffle salami pizza (flat crust, fresh mozzarella, truffle oil, and salamis, topped with fresh baby arugula). Best pizza we've had since our trip to Italy in 2012. Their house salad had super fresh greens, wonderful creamy cheese crumbles, and slices of fresh pear. Absolutely delightful in every way. Highly recommend this place!
author: Katie L.

description:
Disclaimer: I'm from Italy, so I'm picky about "Italian" restaurants
I went there for a pizza, and as I described it to my friend, it lacked "personality" - it wasn't bad, but not great either.
author: Steve E.

description: What is an Italian restaurant without a wild boar ragu over pasta?  Baked penne with marinara sauce, ricotta and mozzarella was fantastic, eggplant rolletinni - not so good.
author: Robert L.

description: Lovely, amazing, wondering neighborhood Italian place. Family owned and the best pizza I've had in SF. Make sure you try the fruit and nutella pizza for dessert (seriously!)
author: Arlyn A.

description: Well, 250 + reviews, and average of 4.5 stars, I expected solid.  This was pretty good at best. I had a marghareta, which was, quite frankly, only ok.  I also had a prosciutto and funghi, which was good.  But each pizza cost $18! And honesty, this is very thin crust.  But the edges are like a cracker, not chewy.  I like the chewy on the outside and thin in the middle with a little charring.  This is more like pizza on a cracker.  And they never asked if I wanted another beer (I did).
author: gary g.

description:
I came by Cafe BoaNecci with my family recently at 5 sharp when they opened. There was no one in the restaurant and one couple outside. When we asked for a table inside they said they were all reserved. We were about to walk away when they said we could have a table outside. We sat outside with mediocre service (they never brought plates!) and by 6:15 there was only 1 couple inside the restaurant. We were going to get another pizza but decided to try Golden Boy since they seemed like they actually wanted our business. We asked our waiter about the supposed reservations and he said the tables had to be held for and hour and a half and that they were in fact all reserved. We left at 6:30 (so he was clearly BS-ing). We then drove by on our way home around 7:30 and there was STILL NO ONE IN THE RESTAURANT.

Here's the summary:
- Good for kids? Absolutely not - rude in fact
- Good food? Pretty good food (thus 2 stars)
- Service? Lame for reason #1

Don't try to bring your family here; but I guess that the way they want it.
author: Tom S.

description: My husband and I were blessed to travel to Italy last Fall and have been in search of true Italian pizza since our return.  My Italian teacher recommended this little corner place in North Beach and it did not disappoint!  The family relocated to SF from Lucca, near Florence, and were all charming, helpful - and ok the sons are very handsome!  The pizzas were thin crusted with just the right amount of cheese and toppings.  We had our teenage boys and my husbands mother with us - she loved her spaghetti - and the boys weren't disappointed in their choices either; pizza and calzone.  This is true authentic Italian, not americanized, so expect a ton of cheese or over sized thick crusted pizza.  We loved it!!!
author: Libbi K.

description:
This place is good, but my dining experience had serious flaws. The truffle pizza was excellent, and the service and decor are great, but the calzone was thin, watery, and collapsed in seconds. For an $18 calzone, I was seriously disappointed, and felt ripped off by a place with such a high yelp score.

Leave this place for the tourists who don't know good Italian food.
author: Ned D.

description:
Food was good but very small potion. An eggplant dish for $19 you expect to be at least half a regular plate size; it was less than 1/4 of it !!!
And just like original italian restaurants, limited variety of pizza ingredients; vegetables and cheese and some pork meat. No chicken, no beef.
author: Neda M.

description: Great italian food, made by real Italians. I had the pasta agle olio. The noodles were home made. Tasted great! A bit on the spicy side. My wife had the four cheese pizza. That was pretty good too. I recommend!
author: Daniel M.

description:
Our waiter changed his shirt mid-service which was pretty awesome, and for that he gets solid respect.

I didn't have the pizza that everyone raves about, but instead had a salad. It was pretty tasty, but not worth the price at all. Others who did have pizza said it was "pretty good" but for the nearly $20 you'll spend on a "serves one" type pizza, it better be "damn good".

The decor is nice and it's really a small home feel - I can dig that. I'd come back, though I'd probably skip a salad and just split a pizza and a pasta dish like some folks did across the room. That seemed like the winning combination.
author: Tim Y.

description: 1st meal for us in San Fran. We were looking for just a pizza joint and ended up here. Great food, great service and not just your average pizza joint!
author: Frank G.

description: We had the margherita pizza, stephani salad and the lasagna.   Love, love, love their thin crust pizza!  I have had nth like that before!!  And the salad was a pleasant surprise- it was fresh, done just right to bring all the ingredients together and let the ingredient shine!  I'm looking forward to try more pasta dishes!  My only complain is that most of the dishes on the menu is loaded with carbs.  Oh well I guess it's true in most Italian restaurants!
author: Mandy C.

description: The pizza rustica and rigatoni arrabbiata were the best things that we had but everything was amazing including the service.  Best spot I've been to since moving to SF.
author: Jessica R.

description: Great pizza but not the best I have ever had. Maybe I was expecting more since so many yelpers claim it's the best pizza they ever had. The salads are fresh, pizzas are good, nice thin crust, and great prices. I would go again to try more dishes and prob order another pizza to try again. But seriously don't understand all the hype.
author: Betsy R.

description:
I'm long overdo for a review of this place, since I've been coming here about twice a week for almost six months...yea...that's how good it is...

Why you should go the first time:

Yes, the pizzas are amazing. Coming from Europe I can tell you these are as authentic Italian as it gets. Amazing thin crust that almost breaks in your hands, great tasteful sauce, not too much cheese, but really good cheese, and many types of great meats and fresh ingredients overall. If you wanna know what I mean, order a Pizza Rustica. 

It was pretty hard finding a pizza of this caliber in Rome, even when avoiding the tourist traps that try to lure you in off the street (always stay away from those. in Roma, AND in Northbeach)

What will make you come back:

Do you like paninis and a good european style salad? Great! They have that, too, and it's all good. So if you can't have pizza here three times a week you can feel safe about changing it up a little.

Finally, there's the Gambaccini family. These wonderful tattooed owners don't just own the place. They make the food, serve you, and appreciate you in a way that makes it impossible not to come back.

So if you're sick of North Beach pizza or golden boy or just want something different try Baonecci!
author: Christopher N.

description: Alright food, bad service. 6'4 waiter never even asked how my food was, even though the place wasn't busy and neither was he.
author: Rob B.

description:
I'm Chinese, so I can't say I know what real authentic pizzas are like. But if I have to say and guess, I would think the pizzas here are AUTHENTIC as it can be!

No, I'm not talking about those thick crusted overflow with cheese type of pizza here. The pizza here are something that you can't find anyplace else in San Francisco, they are to die for!!!

Okay, back to the food part... the pizza we ordered were very unique and delicious. Came here with my friends and girlfriend, ordered the Contandina and Salsiccla e Salamino. The Contandina was the one that I loved more. It had some cheese and covered with slices of pear all over it. It is a must have, you won't regret it! The Salsiccla e Salamino on the other hand was good too, tomatoes and pepperonis :)

Aside pizza, we ordered lasagna and dessert. The lasagna good, but the dessert captured my heart at the end. We had the Lemon Sorbet (tasty), Chocolate Tartufo (the chocolate was just awesome...) and the Affogato al Tartufo Cioccolato (same chocolate same awesomeness).
author: Gordon L.

description: Wow! Beautiful food! We didn't have a reservation so they sat us in a special back room, we loved it, and they did not forget about us. The food and wine blew us away. The family that owns it helped us and it was clear they love what they do! On our next trip up to SF, we will be back!!
author: Vanessa D.

description:
Probably the best italian in SF. The family that manages the business are warm and friendly and they have created a great ambience. 

Great great great pizzas and salads. I have lived in Italy for a year and that makes me pretty picky about Italian food abroad. This place won't disappoint anyone.
author: Juan G.

description:
I found this place Yelping and wanted to try it for a not so far away  attainable piece of Italy. 

I ordered the Monte Bianco and indeed it was the thinnest pizza I've ever had, the crust very much like crispy Naan bread and the ingredients were definitely delectable. I could have attacked the entire pizza, which I will be doing the next time I go. I shared with the boyfriend and was hungry for more. I think it's kinda pricey for a pie, but since the ingredients are so fine, it's not so bad.

Surprisingly, the tiramisu was INCREDIBLY good. Honestly, my boyfriend is not a big fan of any kind of sweets, but the tiramisu is cold, light,  fluffy, moist and when the spoon digs through all the layers for a bite size piece of goodness nothing else compares. We've tried it in other places, not to par. This particular one is different, it is served in a single serving dessert cup rather than the traditional square cut, but however they do it, this may the only place I will ever order tiramisu again. 

The service was great, served by the polite and handsome Gambaccini boys, yet again the hour I went was not very busy. I did see the Contadina pizza (with thin shaved pears) come out on a nearby table; I will be trying that soon.
author: Angela L.

description: Mediocre at best. I love pizza, but it was strangely bland. It was as if there was not enough cheese to satisfy your palate and the prosciutto was definitely not cooked enough. Get some bold flavors! At least the ambiance was lovely.
author: Amanda M.

description: It's got a cool atmosphere.  The food is 4 out of 5 stars in my opinion.  I compare most Italian in the city to Capos, which I consider 5 stars.  The pizzas are definitely worth trying.
author: Salar S.

description:
Nom nom nom nom nom.  There are two pizza places in North Beach that are delicious.  Caffe BaoNecci and Tony's Pizza Napoletana.  I prefer Cafe BaoNecci simply because it is family owned and run.  The owners work here and are extremely friendly.  They treat everybody like family.  On top of that, they know how to make some delicious pizzas!

I am fan of thin crust pizzas and this place makes a good thin crust pizza.  The crust is nice and thin (did I mention that already)?  It's soft, but not soggy (I prefer crispy thin crust, but this crust is just fine).  The ingredients on the pizza are fresh and delicious.  As is the sauce. 

Service is fantastic!  For the quality pizza and the atmosphere you get there, I'd say they  were undercharging for their pizza.  They could charge a couple more bucks per pizza and I'd still go there.

The place is a little small, so if it's busy, be prepared to wait!
author: David K.

description: If you like thin crust pizzas - this place will hit the spot for you.   The restaurant is pretty casual but the service is good!  Their dessert pizza is yummy but stay away from their chocolate molten lava cake.
author: Bhavnak K.

description: I had dinner here this week, didnt have a reservation but there was definitely room for 2! The waiter asked us for for any wine or drinks, I told him we don't drink and he gave us a weird look like we're from Mars!? We ordered two pizzas and I was shocked that Yelp didnt come thru on our Pizza run. Yes the Pizza was ok but not as good as yelpers stated and the portions were so small! We had to have 3 orders of Pizza for $85! I asked the waiter for Ranch and he smirked at me, you could just say no or offer a side of Marinara. Cafe Baoneccis Pizzas are phony just like there phony italian accents!
author: L P.

description: This place is okay, but not outstanding. The service was a bit weird and slow. The pizza was good but the pasta was really the best part. So fresh and al dente. Definitely get the pasta if you go here.
author: Karen B.

description: Awesome food and wine, the pizza is authentic, the pasta is handmade, the waiters know their food and wine pairings, and it's very clean.  This place is a serious authentic Italian restaurant.  They have Brunello, Barolo, Barbaresco, and Chianti all at reasonable prices.
author: Hector R.

description:
I feel bad that I haven't written a review thus far for these folks. People I sent here have already done it!   I've been here at least 5 times and just love the thin crust pizza!  I've talked about so much that i had to take my kids last week while on spring brake.  Guess what?  My 12 and 9 year old loved it too!  This time I went the the sausage and pepperoni, excellent!  I'm had several of the other pizzas and would eat everyone again.  The Stephanie salad is very nice as well, work great right before pizza.  The salad comes dresses with a light dress, which I find refreshing and almost palate cleansing (in a good way). 

The environment with the waiters and family talking Italian makes for a really cool vibe as well.  If your a visitor, the taxi ride is worth it!
author: David C.

description:
I've never had authentic Italian pizza till I went here.  I was just completely blown away by how simple the thin crust pizza was, and it had soooo much flavor to it!

I came with two friends, and we had two pizzas: Contadina (Fior di Latte Mozzarella, Gorgonzola, Parmigiano, Thin Curly Pears), Proscuitto Parma (San Marzano Tomato Sauce, Fior di Latte Mozzarella, Prosciutto di Parma, Arugola).  We also had a panini: Boscalola (Ham, Mozzarella Cheese, Champignon Mushrooms).

The Contadina is a MUST have; I loved the cheese, the pear slices, and the crust.  The tomato sauce in the Proscuitto Parma was so tasty, and the arugola was really fresh.  The panini has to be eaten right away, while the cheese is warm.

Ahhh, I can't wait to come back for more! =)

By the way, there's a deal for lunch from checking into Facebook Places.  There should be a Foursquare one too, IMO.
author: Serena T.

description:
Cute little North Beach cafe, and I think it'd definitely be a nice place for coffee or lunch.   

But this time I stopped by looking for biscotti, of which they had a few different varieties.  The price was about $16.50 / lb, and for $9 I came away with a small paper bag of about 5 pieces.  

Ouch, that was an expensive mistake.  Albeit, a tasty mistake.

Anyone know where i can get some good biscotti for cheaper?
author: Joanne G.
