great tasty pizzas and panini
wonderful warm owners
author: Riley D.

description: Small restaurant in the neighborhood that makes the thinnest crust and freshest pizzas! I love the monte blanco. This place is perfect for catch up dates and intimate outtings.
author: Jackie M.

description:
we were hungry so i looked for a nearby restaurant on yelp and we found this place. 

it was 3pm something, so most of the lunch items were gone. we ordered panini. they were very thin and looked different from panini that i've ever had. they were tasty. i was little disappointed because we saw four and a half stars on yelp. but overall it was good. but it was little pricey for what we got though.  but it's prolly the cheapest you can find in 'little italy' area.
author: Te R.

description:
Yum. What good food. The pizza was perfect. We got the first one on their list, and it was delicious: hot, fresh, beautiful. The crust is wonderfully thin, so expect to eat it all there. It's soggy a few hours later.

I brought my family into the city and we went to church, then hung about. I had read about this place, so we went. My parents, my brother, and my toddler sister all enjoyed the place in our different ways. My mom ordered the Ceasar Salad, and it was good (just not my favorite salad, really). I got the Fava Bean Soup, and it was amazing. I hope it's not just a Sunday thing, because the velvety texture and beany flavor are a new necessity of life. My step father loved the atmosphere. You don't get that in Turlock, you know. This is a family run business, and the mom helped us figure out how to fit all five of us (baby in a big stroller) into her tiny restaurant. Baby slept the whole time, but it's not particularly quiet in there. The waiter was obviously the son of the woman we met initially, and we were all amazed at the polite service. My brother would not touch the pizza, however, because of the "messy" (read: fabulous) way they put on cheese. If you have picky eaters, order them some pasta.

Visit. Enjoy.
author: skylar p.

description: We had a pizza. It was phenomenal. Crust was wonderful. Ingredients fresh.  Served by members of the Italian family who owns it. Soo good!
author: Leslie S.

description:
Seems a nice Italian family took over from the little old ladies that used to run this place. These charming new people were from the town of Lucca near Florence.
I tried a hot-pressed focaccia with prosciutto, mozzarella and mushrooms which was so yummy that I had to turn back up the street and try another one: the tuna and tomato foccacia was out of this world in that it tasted true to the ones I've had in Italy as a kid.
The owner admitted that he made everything right in the shop and that the tuna "sandwich" was indeed a specialty from his hometown.
Sundays they also serve fresh italian donut fritters ("fritelle").
Don't miss this gem and go before they ever think of using any shortcuts like most other joints do over time when they start making money.
author: Sara K.

description: I walked in debating whether I wanted the pizza or the foccacia, $3.50 for a slice of pizza and $2.50 for the foccacia.  Cheapie it is!  Got the marinara foccacia and man, walking down the street back to school, it was definately not a plain foccacia.  Very flavorful and the perfect consistancy.  Didn't have the time to try any of the cookies or pastries, but they definately look awesome, so on the list for future visits.
author: Asha H.

description: Margarita pizza was great. Antipasti plate was good as well. Owners very friendly.
author: Nori L.

description:
Hands down the best in north beach.  Have a coffee and biscotti, delicious breakfast and you must must try the AMAZING PIZZA. The family who owns the bakery is very friendly, and whoever did the drawing of Corto Maltese on the mirror MUST be a professional! 
Unique and quaint! A must try!
author: Amber M.

description: There are few places in north beach that are genuinely Italian anymore; this is one of them. The new owner is from Luca, near Florence. Walking in door is a cultural experience. You can practice your Italian or just appreciate the care that is put into their products. I generally just go for a sandwich but they have great pastries also-- they supply Cafe Greco among others.
author: Andrew M.

description:
most authentic thin crust pizza you will find outside of italy! all of the pizzas i've tried are light and tasty and they are such a nice break from the other heavy, overly-cheesed pizzas in the area. you can't argue with the dessert pizzas either- thin crust, nutella, fresh fruit, and mascarpone...yes please =)  
also, the family that owns the place is really friendly and completely charming too!
the pizzas are all a bit pricey, so i'd recommend eating there to get them fresh and for the overall atmosphere.
author: arielle n.

description: Wonderful soy latte's and amazing bakery...truly a North Beach favorite! I have had nothing but great times here and the owners are amazing as well...a must if you are in the neighborhood!
author: Stephanie J.

description:
Hi five for the amazing not on the menu cannoli made on request!!!

  So there we are in North Beach and it comes up in conversation that I've never had a cannoli. My friends are aghast upon hearing those words come out of my mouth and we instantly embark on a hunt for a cannoli. Believe it or not we went to THREE bakeries that did not have our sought after treat. As we walk into Danilo we notice that their case is also lacking cannolis and we softly grumble and turn to leave. The man behind the counter notices this and asks what we are looking for. We tell him of our hunt and he says "Well why don't I run back to the kitchen and make you one... or two!" We were so excited we jumped at the option of two freshly made cannolis. Pure gluttony. When the man returned he placed the cannolis on the table and exclaimed "They don't get any fresher than this!" Man was that a great cannoli. Granted it was my first one but the ricotta was sweet but not overwhelming. The chocolate chips gave just the right amount of texture and bitterness to the sweet cream. And the cherry... My favorite... Was sweet, but not candied to the sticky extreme, and a bit tart. Man did they make a fan out of me quick! Any place that can conjure up a little slice of foodie heaven on request, especially when that item is not on the menu, definitely deserves five stars!
author: chelsea b.

description: The fact that Italians flock to this place speaks for itself. Great thin crust pizza and coffee. Friendly service. A very cute Italian working behind the counter today ;-)
author: Daria G.

description: I found this restaurant by doing a Yelp search for the "best cheap Italian" in San Francisco. This just might be it! We had a wonderful meal of pizza, salad, polenta, and tiramisu. Yum. We went on a Saturday night and it was full but we didn't have to wait for a table.
author: Libby V.

description: Authentic.  Reasonable Prices.  Excellent tastes.  Excellent Pizza and paninis (may not be on menu, but ask).
author: Ellen R.

description: Ohhh man. Ohhhhh man. Ohhh geeze!!!! Walking around in N Beach and i wanted a coffee and a chocolate something. So we stopped here after walking by it for the past 8 months. I kept telling myself i should have stopped in. I will never doubt my hunch again. Walking in here is like going to a cafe in Italy. Seriously, guys sitting around watching soccer, Nutella on the shelf's and awesome coffee and treats. I found my new Sunday morning hangout, no more cartoons i guess.
author: Stephen K.

description: Had a warm prosciutto, mozzarella, and mushroom sandwich and a latte on a late Saturday morning and everything was great.  The sandwich was perfectly toasted, the coffee was great and the gentleman behind the counter was extremely nice.
author: Brian W.

description:
The Best Pizza In North Beach, Bar-freaking-None.

I'm shocked by how many people (North Beach residents, even!) haven't been here - BaoNecci's one of my favorite spots in the city. This place is amazing. Family owned, super friendly, and in-bloody-credible pizza. Great coffee, always a place to sit, open whenever - skip Golden Boy, walk another 100ft up Green, and get yourself some authentic Italian pizza.
author: Eric D.

description: Danilo's is a good neighborhood place where to get a slice of pizza and cannoli that is filled with this delicious ricotta cheese.
author: Oscar F.

description: Pizza is molto bene! The whole crew is very nice and are real Italians.
author: art s.

description: this place is yummy! great pizza, excellent cappuccino, delicious biscotti. All made by some friendly Italians. I tell you, I think it was an Italian in my past life. Fine women, fine food, the best wine and they live by the coast. I guess I sound like a Californian too! anyways, thank goodness for Italians! Go here, bring your dog, sit outside and eat some pizza then walk up to coit tower.
author: Kevin L.

description: very local, authentic italian restaurant.  you know it's going to be good when you see the staff hand-cutting every vegetable for each pizza (as witnessed on the way to the restroom, another great sign that you know it's going to be good).  helpful wine pairings, amazing pasta, very cozy.
author: Judy K.

description: After 10 years in the bay area I can finally eat a original focaccia with prosciutto crudo. Deliziosa! There are also other excellent dishes - pizza for example is simply fantastic. Environment is warm and friendly. Ask for aperitivo called Walter - better than mimosa e bellini.
author: Giacomo L.

description: We ordered pesto pasta and caprese pizza. The food was excellent and the tiramisu was exceptional. Loved it.
author: K J.

description: Yum, yum, yum! It's so hard to find a really good authentic Italian style pizza in San Francisco. The pizza is delicious and the service is very good. Even worth battling the North Beach parking. We'll be back!
author: Tasha M.

description:
ONE STAR

Speechless and betrayed. This is one place where Yelp has failed me. I looked at the positive reviews and thought, this must be a great place.

Little did I know I would be walking into a fiery burning inferno of mediocrity and coming out disillusioned and unenthusiastic. Food was mediocre, service blew, and atmosphere was disappointing.

WHERE HAVE ALL THE FLOWERS GONE? What did I do to deserve this?!
author: Gray Z.

description: Best pizza I've had since living in Italy!! Great service, friendly, small, very charming!!!
author: D C.

description: I used to go to Danilo regularly for a focaccia sandwich. Back then, about 2.5 years ago, I thought it was a great bakery with excellent canolis. It's come along way since then! The owners have updated and made the place much nicer inside and added a full menu. We had breakfast there the other day, I had an Italian Ham and mushroom omelet with a side of polenta. It all was excellent! I'd highly recommend this place for focaccia and food.
author: Warner Y.

description:
I think I'll have to try this place again.   I went there on a Sunday and seems like most places in North Beach are closed so maybe not a good day to go there?

I ordered mushroom pizza by the slice, lasagne, and a panini.  The pizza was good but came out lukewarm.  I like my pizza warm to hot.  I guess that's what you get for ordering by the slice vs. a whole pizza.   My sister-in-law said she liked her panini.  I tried to order another pasta dish that was on the wall but the waiter said that was a "specialty", but my son ate up his lasagne.  Next time I'm in North Beach I'll give this place a shot again, but based on what I had, I'll give 3 stars for now.

We didn't get any drinks and was about $10/person including tip.  Probably cheaper than other sit down places in North Beach but high for what you're getting.  I didn't get itemized bill but I'm guessing the lasagne dish skewed the overall tab.
author: Dennis Y.

description: Sad!! I had high expectations, but I was rather disappointed. Their cappuccino was good, but I wasn't impressed with their coffee at all. Today was a strangely hot day in November (80s), so we had to gulp down our coffee in 5 mins and go somewhere else with A/C, which is unfortunate. Maybe i'll come back when it's a little cooler and give it another try...
author: Jen K.

description: Best foccacia I've had outside of Italy.  Mine had golden pieces of potato on top and it was the perfect mix of moist and crispy.  The family who runs the place is super friendly and they keep it clean and inviting.  We just grabbed a table outside and relaxed for a while while we ate and sipped lattes and Italian orange sodas.  My wife was excited that they had brown sugar for the coffee.  Nice find.
author: Matt L.

description: bit pricey but excellent service! The pasta was great. Very friendly and helpful staff. Will come back again!
author: Sandra C.

description: Nice little place with adorable ambiance. Wait staff very attentive. Although the place is supposed to be known for the pizza, I ordered the veal cannelloni, since I was in the mood for pasta. It tasted like it was just defrosted from a frozen dinner menu. I've had better in a chain like Olive Garden. My wife was smart and had the 12" zucchini pizza. (I tried a slice of hers!) Although I'm not a fan of thin crispy crust, it was very very good. The meal was a bit pricey, but not ridiculous.  Go, but stick with the pizza.
author: Nick D.

description: We love this neighborhood gem. It reminded us those little neighborhood cafe all over Tuscany. Really warm atmosphere and great place for cappuccino and desserts.
author: Sonya W.

description: We walked over here from Pier 33 and had a wonderful lunch.  My husband and I especially enjoyed the Pizza Prosciutto, delicious!  Our boys insisted on ordering the dessert pizza and it was wonderful as well.  Service was great.  Hope to return soon.
author: Ann G.

description: Experience Italy in America.  My daughter and I wanted some bread from a real Italian bakery while in North beach for the day, so a stop in at Danilo was a planned  stop.  What I didn't expect was the bonus of  feeling that we had just stepped into a different country for a moment as they were all speaking Italian. What a joy when you find a quaint little place that puts a smile on your face, even if it means a few extra carbs!
author: Jan C.

description: Great service and excellent latte's! The family who owns this place is so nice!! They humor me with what little italian I know and they ask me if I'd like the usual (a large latte w/ non-fat milk) when I come in---I love that. I also love how they let me bring my pug in while I'm ordering my beverage. I used to leave him outside but one day he got tangeled up in the patio furniture and I thought someone stole him! I went sprinting outside and the female owner came running out with me. She was as concerned as I was! From that point on she let me bring him in.  Great place and warm service. They make my mornings fun and kick off a great work day for me.
author: Jenn L.

description: Just amazing. The pressed sandwiches are delicious, and the owners are warm and friendly. Great little spot.
author: Katy D.

description: We had pizza and a nice salad. All was good, but for the 4.5 review rating we expected more. Authentic Italian, probably would have been very satisfied if we'd ordered something other than pizza.
author: ann T.

description: best pizza in San Francisco. great staff, great food.
author: Shaye S.

description:
Fantastic pizza, expresso and Cappuchino Genovese! (Inside joke.)
Service was EXCELLENT and always with a smile.  The breads, biscotti, and gelato were also terrific. The Cappuchino Genovese and Macchiato Tassa Grande were unbelievably delicious! And I can attest to this as I just returned from Rome. HIGHLY RECOMMEND this quaint cafe. Great food is made in small quantities so not everything on the menu will be available on that day.
Parking in North Beach can be a challenge but this Cafe/Bakery/ Restaurant is well worth the effort. The thin crust pizza and expresso were INCREDIBLE!  GO GO GO.
author: Jay Y.

description: There are so many bakeries in North Beach it is hard to know where to go - Danilo is the cookie bakery. Order special breads for parties or Easter - but really - if you are in a pinch and need a gift for a party, house warming or casual birthday - pick up an assorted dozen Italian cookies and wait for the thanks to come rolling in.
author: CarOline C.

description: This place has the most delicious pizza- get the one with gorgonzola cheese and pear on it- I think it's called the contandina?? The owners are terrific- it's a family and they're kind, honest, and generous. If you go there a few times in a row, they will remember you and treat you right!
author: Rob W.

description: Great bruschetta, ham pizza, and decent veggie pizza with very thin, and crunchy crust. bread and oil+vinegar served before the meal. Good wine recommendation. Great place.
author: Mike W.

description:
This place ROCKS. Italian owned in NORTH BEACH?! That alone is amazing, but they are known for their breads. Don't forget to ask the owners for the "Loaf of Love". Yummy!
...It IS Valentine's Day afterall!
author: Outrageous O.

description: Came here on a quest to find Italian Food after driving up the 5 on our honeymoon smelling garlic through that section of the highway. Loved the walk through ChinaTown and then kind of BOOM...Little Italy! The staff were all Italians...questionably the owners? Amazing pear salad with goat cheese and thin crust pizza. The wait staff was kind and attentive. The place has a nice italian charm or red and white picnic table cloths. I kind of love the unpretentious dining aspect to the place. To end the meal, we tried these bit sized pastries (apparently the mother makes all the display desserts from scratch- love that, too!) One was a chocolate cookie with white cream and the other resembled a nilla wafter with chocolate cream. Both were the perfect ways to end the meal. So satisfying and fantastic! Will definitely return on our next trip. The best way to travel is to eat your way through a city and this is definitely fantastic!
author: Erin V.

description: We decided to seek out this currently top-rated restaurant in "Little Italy".  We ordered 2 pizzas.  One thing we noticed that is different is the super-thin crust.  Other than that, nothing to brag about !  My kids love pizzas and they only gave a "so-so" rating.  I couldn't agree more.  It is definitely one of the cheap-eats in the area if you are on a budget.
author: Howie L.

description:
As close to the real deal as we've found in San Francisco.  Try the ham and mozzarella, the tuna, or the vegetarian w/marscapone from the case.  Delish!  Foccacia is good too.

Sometimes on Sundays, they sell out of the good stuff by two...so go early and eat at the small counter or snag one of the few tables if you can.  This place is no frills, but as close to Italy as you're going to get around here.
author: Steve J.

description:
comforting to know that their sauce does is not the same ooey-gooey, pasty tasting ooze you taste when eating totinos (y'all know what i'm talking about?!). that fake pasta sauce just ruins my day.. all day.

but, oh my-- baonecci is just the opposite. i've had the garlic, and rustica pizza; the stefania, and the shrimp salad -- and this place has not yet failed! 

they don't joke about their thin crust pizza. it's no wonder why service is fast. the pizza they serve is just about as thin as your regular kettle chip (the crust is just as crispy too). this gives you the chance to taste the tang of the pizza sauce, the spice of the arugula, the savory gorgonzola, and the comforting taste of prociutto. 

it's such a gift to eat pizza where you could still differenciate the danged cheese from the piece of meat! how about that crunch from the crust? nothing but flour and water, you basically end you pizza eating experience with some good crunch.

but wait, there's more-- aside from the food, coffee and dessert were champion. if not ordered as an espresso, coffee is served americano. nothing ridiculously memorable, but it sure is good coffee. for dessert, the tiramisu is served so thick on a small glass that if you order it to go,  you get its original container with your order. 

the espresso-soaked tartufo definitely seals the meal deal as a major treat! it's no mystery that i'm writing this at almost 3AM. the espresso was so profound, the smooth ice cream and the hearty hazel nuts that were swimming in its goodness were capable of popping in your mouth as a secret blockbuster.. you know, the kind that matt damon and judy dench would star in (POW!)
author: benita b.

description: I just discovered this place on a trip to San Fran with my boyfriend. We wanted italian but after reading some bad reviews of the famous Stinking Rose, we found Bao Necci's. We instantly fell in love. If you're looking for a big, fancy place, this isn't for you. Its definitely a small family place. But if you want to experience some truly authentic Italian food, then you should go visit this place! We got the meat lasagne and pasta puttanesca. It was so amazing that we came back the next night for pizza! I hadn't had Italian food this great since I was in Italy!
author: Jennie R.

description: The food was delicious and the place has a really positive family owned and operated atmosphere. Definitely somewhere I would like to go again
author: mike w.

description: Any of the pizza's are a must!  Sure to delight your palate. Like eating with the family. I no longer need to travel to Italy.
author: Fred H.

description: Went here on the advice of others. Was everything they said it would be. My friend and I had pizza first. The sauce is what separates this pizza from the others. Excellent! I will say that you better plan on having one pizza per person. They are not really filling. We had 2 pizzas and had no trouble putting them away. We actually ordered another dish. That said, as good a pizza as I've ever had. 5 stars for taste. Had to knock it down one on the portions.  Highly recommended
author: John L.

description: Wow! The pizza is exquisite here. The crust is impeccably thin, and the tomato sauce is almost juicy. The cafe also has a nice old-fashioned interior. The waiters were very nice, and you could tell it was truly a family business.
author: Ben G.

description:
One of the best cappuccinos I've ever had. THE best I've ever had that I didn't make. I've been making and drinking em for over two years. It was $2.50.

The prosciutto focaccia sandwich was really quite good, and only $4.75. (Someone on here mentioned it being cheaper. They're not.) Where I used to work in Buffalo we had decent focaccia sandwiches, served with a salad and a little bigger for $7.95, so really, not a bad price at all. And they're pre-made, so no wait.

Four stars because I gotta leave room in case I find a better place, but still wonderful and worth the money. No line, open tables, newspapers to read, friendly staff, free wi-fi and no waitress to feel bad about not tipping well.

There's a question below that yelp is asking me: Good for groups? I'll give it a yes, but I wouldn't take more than 4 people.
author: mark m.

description:
The focaccia is great but the 5 Stars is for the boys that work there.
They are so cute, and when they talk to you with that Italian accent mamma mia!!!!!!

Hot Italian Boys Rock!!!!!!!!!!!
author: B O.

description:
This place is sooo European. It actually sells bread. Who'd a thunk it? 

A bakery should sell something besides sugary donuts and overpriced croissants a la Americain. 

I can make a lunch out of a piece of Danilo's focaccia. Or to paraphrase Omar K: "A loaf of bread, a piece of brie and thou....."
author: patrice a.

description: This place feels super authentic Italain. Family run. Try the tuna or prosciutto pannini or order the lasagna with a salad. They just got their liquor license so they have wine etc. now as well.
author: Patrick M.

description: This is by far the best pizza place in San Francisco. Authentic Italian, friendly staff and the best and unique thin crust pizza I've had.
author: Nomaan L.

description: super cute little italian bakery! their pastries are yummy as are their omelettes. service is prompt and friendly, the cute owner is adorable. loved it.
author: Mira K.

description: finally i've found the thinest crust pizza in SF, 15 bucks for this pizza seems a bit high, but it was so good i'll go back.
author: pochini m.

description: Best biscotti in San Francisco. Like the family (staff) that runs it too. Nice people. Great espresso too.
author: D Y.

description:
Having moved from Italy to San Francisco, I am lucky to live in North Beach. Me and my husband found Bao Necci (after having tried Rose Pistola's pizza which was not authentic) and we are a regular-at -least once-a-week customer. We also take our family and friends there. I love the pizza since is one of the best I have ever had . With my high standards, this place is a 5 star even in Italy and she has a unique way of making pizza from Lucca in Toscana.
They were less crowded when I moved here, but with their alcohol license and a few review they got, they are quite busy. The Service is the service of an Italian Trattoria/Pizzeria run by a family and you have to take it for what it is and experience the spirit. They might even tell you to go get the knife from the drawer, which is their way of making you feel at home :)
She always tells me that she doesn't want the place to be called a restaurant.... she loves to cook for friends! :)
author: Mary G.

description: This place is the best place outside of Italy!  I go there  everyday they are open.   The panini  and  soup  are soooo good.  The family  who owns the place are the grooviest people in the  world..Great coffee, cookies, pizza!  I love BaoNecci!  GROOVY1
author: ana h.

description: My family came ~2+ hours to check out this little slice of heaven.  What a treat!  The family hosts/owners were warm, inviting, the cappaccino fabulous, and pizza superb.  We'll definitely be back.
author: Cece P.

description: I live a block from this place so I stop by often.  The family who own and run the place is very friendly.  They have a full menu but I have only tried the panini and pizza, which are always fresh and well made.  Some of the better coffee in North Beach too.  It is a smaller place so it probably isn't where you'd go if you want to sit and read a book over a cappuccino but has a nice atmosphere for a relaxed conversation.
author: C A.

description: danilo's is great!!! you'll feel like you've stepped into an italian cafe upon walking through the door- italian men watching futbol, drinking espresso and eating huge plates of gnocci. besides having really good coffee and pastries, they also serve homemade soups and pasta, they take orders for fresh italian, wheat or sourdough bread (you can place orders and pick up on saturdays), and they sell pizza and lasagne. be sure to get there by 5:00 because, unfortunately, they close early.
author: Kate M.

description: I lived in North Beach from 1987 to 1995 and Danilo Bakery was one of my daily stops. Eventually I was on a first name basis with the owner and was right at home here.  A move to the Peninsula left me Danilo-less but I made do with my own homemade bread and what I could get at Whole Foods. Recently I came back.  New owners and yet a very familiar feel.  A very handsome young man behind the counter flirted with me (as only a European man can do!) and I found they are making the delicious corn bread loaves on Saturday again!  And just as good as I remembered!  I'll be back for more of the bread and a leisurely lunch!
author: Yvette P.

description: 3.5 really. Pizza was good, the cheese was amazing, pepperoni also great but the almost non-existant dough just didn't do it for me. I know they are proud of their thinnest crust in the city, but man that crust is sure really thin and the flavor of raw AP flour was coming through a little too overpowering. I asked for a bathroom and they pointed me through the kitchen, it was very odd walking right through the kitchen back to the john, being from Seattle I'm not use to that, probably a little more common in bigger older cities and it was pretty fun to do so, I wanted to take my time walking through to check out the goins on but I got the vibe (and understandably so) that they wanted me out of there. Waiter was really cool, extremely friendly. It was a great place to start the night out while I was visiting friends in SF. The ravioli we had, however, I didn't really care for, it was kind of bland and dry. All in all good experience, will have to explore more pizza places next time I'm down though.
author: Sean W.
